loans.name: Hardyal

texts.en:
Hardyal has recently started a recycling business that exports scrap metal to India. He is quite fulfilled in his business because he sees it as a win-win situation. There is a high surplus of scrap metal in the U.S. and a high demand for scrap metal to be used for construction in India. 

Hardyar came to ACCION USA to find the capital for start-up costs and was approved for a loan. This is his first loan through ACCION USA and he plans to expand very soon. He enjoys this work because it comes easily to him and he loves to be able to set and achieve his own goals for his business. 

Thanks to the flexibility of his job as a cab driver, he has time to find metal through the internet and create a contract with business partners in India to buy the metal. Business has gotten off to a good start, he says. He trusts that within the next two years it will be booming and he can take it on full-time.

loans.use: To purchase scrap metal

loans.name: Esperanza Y Esfuerzo 1 Group

texts.en:
Raquel is a mother of two young children ages 4 years and 7 months. Raquel lives in the remote community of Consuelo.  Often times when people in her community want to buy new clothes for a special occasion they have to spend a considerable amount of money in transportation to get to San Pedro de Macoris, the nearest city. She will use this loan to buy new clothes and serve this demand in her community. She hopes to expand her business as time permits. She hopes to better her life and the lives of her children. 

Please help Raquel become a successful business woman in her community. Thank you.

loans.use: Buy new clothes to resell

loans.name: Esperanza Y Esfuerzo 2 Group

texts.en:
Yenny's goal in life is to triumph in what she does and, if she fails, to get up and continue forward and always to learn from her mistakes. She is the energetic mother of two children, ages 12 and 5 years. She lives in the remote community of Consuelo. Consuelo is a green community where few cars are seen. The common means of transportation are walking and riding motorcycles. You usually see fields with tied-up goats, cows, and horses and, of course, roaming chickens. When people in her community want to buy new clothes for a special occasion, they have to spend a considerable amount of money for transportation to get to San Pedro de Macoris, the nearest city. She will use this loan to buy new clothes and meet this demand in her community. She hopes to expand her business as time permits.

Don’t hesitate to help Yenny become a successful businesswoman in her community! Thank you.

loans.use: To purchase new clothes to sell

loans.name: Juan Xiii Group

texts.es: Las socias que componen el grupo "Juan XIII" son muy unidas y se apoyan mutuamente como lo demostraron en sus anteriores financiamientos en la Institución. La socias se dedican a actividades como la venta D. comida, cosméticos por catálogos y abarrotes en tiendas D. barrios. La competencia en el mercado D. venta D. productos es granD. en especial por la variedad que se ofertan en el mismo, por este motivo los miembros del grupo requieren un nuevo financiamiento que ayuD. a hacer frente a la competencia con productos mas competitivos y D. mejor calida con la compra D. mejores insumos y herramientas que ayuden a realizar un producto D. calidad que genere mayores ganancias para brindar a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
The members that make up the group "Juan XIII" are very close and support each other, as they demonstrated in previous loan cycles with the institution. The members dedicate themselves to work such as the sale of food, cosmetics (through catalog-order), and groceries (in neighborhood stores). The competition in the market is high, especially because most of the products offered are similar. For this reason the members of the group need a new loan that will help them face the competition with more competitive products of better quality and with the purchase of better supplies and tools that will help them offer better products that generate more income to proviD. their families with a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Irma Yolanda

texts.es: Irma Yolanda es soltera, ella se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, ademas en sus tiempos libres hace trejidos tipicos.  Los cerdos ella los compra pequelos, losa laimentea y cuando los tiene de buen tamaño los vende, eso dura de 3 a 6 meses.  Siempre mantiene de varias edadedes, para poder vender mensualmente los cerdos, los cuales vende en su casa.  Su prestamo lo necesita para seguir invirtiendo en cerdos pequños y alimentos para ellos, sus planes son seguir creciendo en su negocio, mantenerse y seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Irma Yolanda is a single woman who works as a breeder of pigs. Also, in her free time she weaves traditional garments. The pigs that she sells are small and when they grow to a good size, she sells them, usually after 3 to 6 months. She has pigs of various ages in order to sell them on a monthly basis, which she does from her house. The loan that she needs is to continue investing in small pigs and food for them. Her plans are to continue growing and maintaining her business, and also to continue studying.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her business of breeding and selling of pigs

loans.name: 7 De Julio Group

texts.es: Las socias del banco comunal "7 D. julio",  no presentan ningún nexo consanguíneo  ni D. afinidad. Las socias desarrollan diferentes actividades comerciales y D. servicio por el barrio la pajonal tales como vendedoras cosméticos ambulantes, tienda D. abarrotes y los socios participantes con el transporte público D. pasajeros, vendedores D. tarjetas telefónicas. En cuanto a la competencia se pueD. decir que ellos están conscientes D. la misma pero saben como salir adelante en especial si se cuenta con la confianza D. una institución que siempre esta dispuesta a extender una ayuda para que los socios puedan sacar adelante sus negocios con la compra D. materiales, insumo y herramientas que generen mayores ingresos y mejore la calidad D. vida D. sus familias. Un porcentaje alto D. las socias ya cuentan con experiencia ya que trabajaron con grupos anteriores en la Fundación Agrocapital por lo que conocen la modalidad des trabajo solidario así como la responsabilidad que se requiere para formar parte D. un grupo.
texts.en:
The members of the "7 D. Julio" (July 7th) Village Bank are neither related to each other nor have anything in common. They engage in a variety of commercial and service activities in the El Pajonal neighborhood. The women's businesses incluD. traveling cosmetics sales, and a grocery store, and the men's incluD. public transportation services, and phone card sales. The members are aware that there is competition. They know how to get ahead, though, especially when they have the trust of an organization that is always inclined to help its members buy materials, supplies, and tools so their businesses can generate more income and their families can enjoy a better quality of life. A large proportion of the members have prior experience working with Fundación Agrocapital so they know how to work alone as well as the responsibility required to be part of a group.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Las Triunfadoras Group

texts.es: El grupo “Las Triunfadoras” esta representado por el señor Marco y conformada por 15 miembros que en su mayoría se dedican a actividades D. comercio como la venta D. CD, comida, abarrotes y actividades como el servicio D. transporte público D. pasajeros, servicio mecánico y como empleados en diferentes empresas. Dentro del ámbito comercial siempre existe la competencia D. oferta D. productos, es por esta razón que los miembros del grupo requieren el crédito, para agrandar sus negocios y para la adquisición D. materiales, insumos y herramientas que ayuden a mejorar sus ingresos diarios y por enD. la calida D. vida D. sus familias. A pesar D. ser un grupo nuevo la mayoría D. ellos ya tienen experiencia en grupos solidarios ya que trabajaron con instituciones similares a la Fundación Agrocapital y conocen la responsabiliza que se requiere para cumplir con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
The group “Las Triunfadoras” is represented by Marco and consists of 15 members, the majority of whom participate in selling CD's, food, groceries, public transportation, mechanical services, or are employees of various companies. The group as a whole always has the ability to sell various products. For this reason, the members of the group require the loan, in order to grow their businesses and for the acquisition of materials, supplies and tools that help improve their daily incomes and the quality of life of their families. Despite being a new group, the majority of the members already have experience in supportive groups that have worked with similar institutions to the Fundación Agrocapital and are familiar with the responsibilities required to complete their obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for operations

loans.name: Las Maravillas Group

texts.es: El banco Comunal “Las Maravillas” esta representado por la señora Marlene y conformado por 16 miembros en su mayoría mujeres dedicadas al comercio de productos como empanadas, comida, abarrotes en tiendas de barrio y como ayudantes en fábricas conocidas. Dentro del ámbito comercial existe mucha competencia pero las socias no se preocupan por ello debido a que confían en los productos que comercializan, pero les queda el deseo de incrementar su negocio, es por esta razón que acudieron al apoyo económico de la Fundación Agrocapital que les brinda un fondo que ayudara al crecimiento de sus pequeños negocios así como al mejoramiento de la calidad de vida de sus familias. En general las socias cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios a pesar de ser su primer ciclo con la institución pero cuentan con experiencia del manejo de fondos por entidades financieras similares y saben como responder a sus obligaciones puntualmente.
texts.en:
The community bank “Las Maravillas” is represented by Marlene and composed of 16 members, who are mostly women engaged in the selling of products such as empanadas, food, neighborhood grocery stores, and as assistants in well-known factories. Within the commercial sector, there is a lot of competition, but the members don't worry about it, owing to their confidence in the products they sell. But there remains the desire to increase their business, and for this reason they came to economic support of Fundación Agrocapital, which offers them a fund that will help the growth of their small businesses and therefore improve the quality of life of their families. In general, the members have experience in group loans; despite being their first cycle with the institution, they count on their experience managing funds for similar financial entities, and they know how to respond to their obligations on time.

Translated from Spanish by Cara Gutterman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational Capital

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario Group

texts.es: Los miembros del grupo “Virgen del Rosario” están representados por el señor Juan Carlos quien es el presidente del grupo. En general una mayoría D. los miembros del grupo se dedica al comercio  D. diferentes productos como abarrotes, ventas D. cosméticos por catalogo, ropa, pan y empleados D. diferentes empresas. Dentro del rubro D. cada uno D. los miembros del grupo existe gran competencia, es por esta razón que los socios requieren D. capital para poder poner productos a la venta más atractivos para sus clientes e incrementar sus ingresos para brindar a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. En general las socias cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios gracias a financiamientos D. entidades similares a la Fundación Agrocapital, por lo que conocen la responsabilidad que implica un crédito grupal.
texts.en:
The members of the group, “Virgen del Rosario” are represented by Juan Carlos, who is the president of the group. In general, the majority of the group members are engaged in the selling of different products such as groceries, cosmetic sales by catalog, clothes, bread, and employed in different businesses. Within the sector of every one of the group members there is a lot of competition; it is for this reason that the members require the capital to be able to sell more attractive products to their clients and increase their income to offer their families a better quality of life. In general, the members have experience in group loans thanks to the financing of entities similar to Fundación Agrocapital, therefore they know the responsibility implied in group credit.

Translated from Spanish by Cara Gutterman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational Capital

loans.name: Urkupiña Group

texts.es: El grupo “Urkupiña” esta representado por la señora Carmela y conformado por 15 miembros que van cursando juntos su quinto ciclo demostrando siempre puntualidad, respeto y ganas D. salir adelante. En general las socias se dedican a diferentes actividades entre ellas la venta D. productos como comida, cerveza, material escolar, abarrotes y al servicio D. peluquería, carpintería y transporte público D. pasajeros. El destino del financiamiento es para el incremento D. su capital D. trabajo y para la compra D. materiales, insumos y herramientas para mejorar sus trabajos haciéndose mas competitivos en el mercado y generando mayores ingresos para dar a sus familias una mejor calida D. vida.
texts.en:
The group “Urkupiña” is represented by Carmela, and composed of 15 members who are together in their fifth cycle, demonstrating punctuality, respect, and the desire to move ahead. In general, the members are engaged in different activities, among them the selling of food, beer, school materials, and groceries, and in the services of a hair salon, carpentry, and public transport. The fate of the financing is to increase their work capital to buy materials, raw ingredients, and tools to improve their jobs, making them more competitive in the market, and to generate income to give their families a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Cara Gutterman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational Capital

loans.name: Barrio Lindo Group

texts.es: Los miembros del grupo “Barrio Lindo” son relativamente nuevos aunque cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios gracias a anteriores financiamientos con instituciones similares a la Fundación Agrocapital quien les brinda la oportunidad D. generar mayores ingresos en sus pequeños negocios D. venta D. ropa, frutas, abarrotes y a la compra D. herramientas que les ayudara a realizar un mejor trabajo en sus actividades D. carpintería, albañilería y a mejorar sus herramientas actuales como es el caso D. los socios que se dedican a actividades como el transporte publico. Como expresa su presidenta la señora Elvira la competencia en el mercado va creciendo cada día, pero las socias no dejan que renovar sus productos haciéndolos acorD. a las preferencias D. sus clientes ya que D. ello depenD. sus ingresos y por enD. el sustento D. sus familias que es la razón D. su lucha diaria con la competencia en el mercado.
texts.en:
The members of the “Barrio Lindo” group are relatively young, but they have experience with group loans thanks to previous financing from institutions similar to the Agrocapital Foundation. The Agrocapital Foundation is giving the members this opportunity to generate more income in their small businesses, which incluD. activities such as selling clothing, fruits, and groceries. Other members will use their shares of the loan to purchase tools that will help them to do better work in such activities as carpentry and bricklaying, or to improve the tools that they currently have, as is the case with the members who make a living in activities like public transport. As Elvira, the group’s president, states, the competition in the market is growing each day, but the members don’t let that affect the products they are producing according to their customers’ preferences. The members depend on the income from their businesses to support their families, and that is why they are struggling daily with the competition in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Renacer” es un grupo renovado por lo que sus miembros cuentan con experiencia en créditos  solidarios ya que provienen D. grupos anteriores y conocen lo que se necesita para formar un conjunto D. socios unido y dispuesto a crecer junto con la Institución. En general los socios se dedican a actividades D. índole comercial como la venta D. refrescos, cosméticos por catálogos y a actividades como la atención en centros D. llamadas, costura, soldadura D. arco y oxigeno y empleados D. diferentes empresas. Los miembros del grupo están representados por la señora Verónica que al igual que sus compañeros lucha diariamente con la competencia en el mercado D. oferta D. productos y desea realizar la adquisición D. materiales insumos y herramientas que ayuden a general una mayor ganancia y mejore la calida D. vida D. sus familias que es su principal motivación apara luchar día a día.
texts.en:
Renacer ('Rebirth') community bank is a group renewing their loans, so the members already have experience in solidarity group (peer-backed) credit. They all come from previous solidarity groups and know what is necessary to form a close group of partners willing to grow together along with the institution. Most of the members dedicate themselves to work of a commercial nature, such as sale of sodas, cosmetics (through catalog order), and services such as attending phone booth centers, tailoring, soldering, and jobs at different businesses. The group is represented by Verónica, who, like her fellow group members, fights daily with the competition of the supply market and hopes to acquire materials and tools that would help generate greater income and improve her family's quality of life, her main motivation to fight every day.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Fanny Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Fanny del Socorro B. tiene la edad de 47 años de edad, reside en el barrio Hialeah, casada y con dos hijos,  los cuales ambos estudian. Los planes para su familia es poder terminar de construir su casa,  su negocio es un cyber que desde hace cuatro años lo administra, pues es un negocio rentable ya que ahora con la tecnología casi todo es buscado en Internet. Con este préstamo es su cuarto ciclo en Afodenic el cual lo quiere para infraestructura en la compra de materiales de construcción para hacer una pared de concreto y poder estar en mejores condiciones con su familia, da las gracias a la institución por los beneficios adquirido en mejoras de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ms. Fanny del Socorro B. is 47 years old. She lives in the Hialeah neighborhood with her husband and their two children, who are in school. The family's plans are to finish building their house. Their business is a cyber cafe, which they've had for the past 4 years. It is a profitable business, as the internet is used to search for many things. This loan is Fanny's 4th loan with Afodenic, and she will use it to purchase materials to build a concrete wall and improve her family's living conditions. She gives thanks to Afodenic for the benefits she has received to improve her home.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials to build a concrete wall

loans.name: Antonia Guadalupe

texts.es: La señora Antonia Guadalupe tiene la edad de 55 años, casada y con dos hijos de 12 y 14 años de edad, ambos estudian la primaria, reside en el barrio Memorial Sandino en la capital de Managua. Su esposo se desempeña como contador y ella vende ropa y cosméticos desde hace ocho años el cual inicio con fondos propios, sus planes para su familia es poder terminar de hacer mejoras a su casa, y espera incrementar el volumen de sus ventas con la captación de nuevos clientes, con este préstamo en Afodenic lo quiere para comprar materiales de construcción y poder hacer un baño. Da las gracias ala institución por que es de gran beneficio poder obtener el crédito con la facilidad de pago y proyectarse en las mejoras de su casa, como en el bienes
texts.en:
Ms. Antonia Guadalupe is 55 years old. She is married and has two children (ages 12 and 14) who are still in school. They live in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood in the capital of Managua. Her husband works as an accountant, and Antonia sells clothes and cosmetics for the past eight years. She began her business with her own funds. Her plans for her family are to finish improving her home, and to increase the volume of her sales by getting new customers. With this loan from Afodenic, Antonia wants to purchase construction materials to build a bathroom. She gives her thanks to Afodenic, as it is very helpful to obtain a flexible loan in order to improve her home.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials to build a bathroom

loans.name: Olimpia

texts.es: La señora Olimpia G. reside en el barrio Villa Reconciliación en la capital de Managua, tiene 43 años de edad, con tres hijos uno independiente y dos que cursan sus estudios. Su negocio es  una pulpería que desde hace seis años logro poner a mucho esfuerzo, con ahorro de las tortillas que vendía, sus planes para su familia es poder ayudar a sus hijos  que sean unos profesionales para que puedan tener un nivel de vida mejor. Este crédito en Afodenic es el décimo ciclo el cual va invertir en comprar granos básicos como: frijoles, arroz y productos de limpieza para ofertar a sus clientes variedad, con esto espera aumentar las ventas y poder obtener mejores utilidades. Da las gracias  ala institución por los beneficios que ha obtenido en las mejora de su vivienda, a si como en el incremento de su inventario.
texts.en:
Mrs. Olimpia G. lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood in the capital, Managua. She is 43 years old with three children. One is independent and the other two are studying. Her business is a general store. After six years and a lot of effort, she has managed to open it with savings from the tortillas she used to sell. Her plans for her family are to help her children get a degree so they can have a better standard of living. This Afondenic loan is in the tenth cycle. She is going to invest it in the purchase of basic grains, such as beans and rice, and cleaning products to offer her clients variety. She hopes to increase sales and make a better profit. She thanks the institution for the aid she got for home improvements as well as to increase her inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains: beans, rice and cleaning products

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana tiene 37 años, hace 10 años vive con su pareja y padre de su hija en el terreno que adquirió, donde vienen construyendo su casa propia para brindar a su hija las mejores condiciones de vida. Desde que asumió la responsabilidad de ser esposa y madre buscó la forma de generar más ingresos, gracias al apoyo de su hermana incursionó en la venta de cosméticos hace 5 años, primero la apoyó en las ventas, pero poco a poco se independizó debido a la gran cantidad de clientes que había logrado conseguir. Ahora se asoció con su hermana para la elaboración de collares artesanales que realizan en su casa para luego venderlos en las ferias del distrito y a la vez dictan clases de bisutería en algunos colegios. Ana se siente muy bien, pues enseñar es uno de sus dones, de la misma forma, trata que cada entorno social sea una oportunidad de buscar a personas que puedan convertirse en clientes potenciales para su negocio. Su más grande sueño es tener una empresa de joyas junto a su hermana. Su permanecía en Microfinanzas PRISMA es de 3 años, está en el su 5to préstamo y durante  estos años, junto a su grupo, ha tratado de trabajar organizadamente y con mucha responsabilidad a favor de todos. Los 1000 soles que solicita los invertirá en la compra de más productos de belleza y materiales para la elaboración de sus collares.
texts.en:
Ana is 37 years old and has lived with her partner, the father of her daughter, for the past 10 years on the land they bought. They are building their own house to give their daughter a better standard of living. Ever since she has taken on the responsibility of wife and mother, she has looked for ways to generate more income. Thanks to the support of her sister, she started with cosmetic sales 5 years ago. First she helped with the sales but little by little she became independent thanks to the large number of customers she had made. Now she has gone into partnership with her sister. They make hand-made necklaces at home to later sell at the district fairs. At the same time they teach jewelry making in some schools. Ana is very happy since she is gifted at teaching. In the same way, she tries to turn every social setting into an opportunity to look for people who could turn into potential customers for her business. Her biggest dream is to have a jewelry business with her sister. She has been with Microfinanzas PRISMA for 3 years. She is on her 5th loan. During these years with her group she has tried to work in an organized and responsible way for all. She will invest the 1000 PEN she is applying for to purchase more beauty products and supplies to make her necklaces.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Baleria

texts.es: Baleria tiene 37 años, vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos, quienes son su mayor adoración y por quienes se sacrifica diariamente. Viene trabajando desde hace 4 años en la venta de cosméticos, actividad que realiza con mucha alegría, ya que tiene la posibilidad de obtener buenas ganancias, pero para incrementar sus ventas tiene que salir a visitar a sus amistades y parientes quienes son sus clientes regulares. Esta labor la realiza desde las nueve de la mañana hasta las seis de la tarde, siendo muy cansado debido las distancias que tiene que recorrer, tratando de realizarlas rápidamente para  llegar a tiempo de apoyar a sus hijos en las actividades educativas. Es por ello, que ha decidido  utilizar los ahorros de muchos años para adquirir un motocarro, el cual alquilará para transporte público, y administrará las ganancias desde su hogar, y así tener un ingreso extra, que compense las horas que dedicará más tiempo a su familia sin salir a vender sus cosméticos. Este es su primer crédito individual, pero sigue trabajando muy gustosa en el banco comunal al que pertenece desde hace muchos años en MFP, donde está muy comprometida por el crecimiento de su grupo. Con los 3000 soles que solicita adquirirá el motocarro que requiere para realizar sus proyectos.
texts.en:
Baleria is 37 years old and lives with her husband and two children, who she greatly adores and for whom she sacrifices on a daily basis. She has worked for four years selling cosmetics, a job that she does with much joy, as she has the chance to make a good income. In order to increase her sales, she has to go out and visit her friends and relatives, who are her regular clients. She does this work from 9am until 6pm, and she becomes very tired from the long distances that she must travel, trying to make the trips quickly so she can arrive home with time to support her children’s educational activities. For this reason she has decided to use her savings of many years to buy a moto-car which she will use for public transport. She will administer the earnings from her home, and in this way will have extra income, which will make up for the additional time that she will dedicate to her family without having to leave to sell her cosmetics. This is her first individual loan, but she continues working happily with the communal bank, Kiva partner Microfinanzas Prisma, to which she has belonged for many years and where she is very committed to the growth of the group. With the 3,000 soles that she is requesting she will buy a moto-car that she needs to move ahead with her projects.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a moto-car

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, a sus 50 años, tiene en anhelo de seguir trabajando en beneficio a sus seres queridos, que son sus dos hijos y su esposo, quien tuvo que salir fuera de la ciudad para trabajar dejándola como cabeza del hogar. Desde hace 20 años se dedica a elaborar diversas prendas de vestir, las cuales diseña según los modelos que observa en catálogos y revistas para hacer un trabajo novedoso que llame la atención de las personas. Esta actividad le demanda de mucha creatividad y rapidez, debido a los pedidos que le hacen constantemente, por lo que trata de agilizar su labor trabajando hasta altas horas de la noche, lo cual ha llegado afectarle la vista por el esfuerzo que realiza, pero esto no es una barrera que pueda detenerla, por el contrario la motivó a proyectarse a nuevas formas de seguir trabajando, siendo una de ellas las compra de una máquina de coser que le ayude agilizar y mejorar su labor. Para un futuro cercano, Carmen desea instalar una tienda de abarrotes, pues está convencida que con el paso de los años no podrá seguir trabajando en la costura y desea tener un negocio el cual cubra los gastos en su vejez. Este es su quinto préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA, en el tiempo que viene trabajando con su banco comunal ha sabido compatibilizar con sus compañeras, y unánimes tratan de realizar las actividades que lleven al progreso a todo el grupo. Los 1000 soles que solicita los invertirá en la compra de lana para elaborar chompas, pues ya tiene varios pedidos a medida que se acerca el invierno.
texts.en:
Carmen, at 50 years old, wishes to continue working to benefit her loved ones, who are her two sons and her husband. Her husband had to leave the city to work, leaving her as the head of household. For the past 20 years she has made a variety of clothing items, which she designs according to models that she sees in catalogs and magazines, to make her clothing something new that attracts people’s attention. This activity requires a lot of creativity and speed, due to the orders that she is constantly receiving. She tries to speed up her work until late at night, which has begun to affect her vision because of the effort that she makes. However, this is not enough to stop her; on the contrary, this motivated her to find new ways to keep on working, one of them being the purchase of a sewing machine that helps her speed up and improve her work. In the near future Carmen would like to open a general store because she is convinced that over the coming years she will not longer be able to work as a seamstress and she would like to have a business that can cover her expenses during old age. This is her fifth loan with Kiva partner Microfinanzas Prisma. In the time that she has been working with her communal bank she has been compatible with the other members, and together they try to do activities that will bring progress to everyone in the group. The 1,000 soles that she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of wool for jackets as she has various orders because winter is approaching.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wool to make jackets

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Ángela M. se dedica a su negocio de pulpería el cual es atendido por ella misma en su establecimiento.

Es de importancia destacar que ella ha logrado salir adelante gracias al apoyo brindado por Ceprodel por medio de los créditos. Hoy en día, una vez más acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un nuevo crédito y así salir adelante en su negocio que tanto requiere de su apoyo para continuar.
texts.en:
Ángela M. earns her living running her own mini market in the city of Chinandega. It's important to stress that she has succeeded in getting ahead thanks to the support of loans from Ceprodel. Now she is coming back to Ceprodel to benefit from a new loan, which she really needs to move forward with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Reyna Francisaca

texts.es:
La dama Reyna Francisca E., se dedica a atender su negocio de venta de frutas y de verduras en el Mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega donde a diario se dedica arduamente a desarrollar su actividad.

Ella ha logrado salir adelante gracias al apoyo que Ceprodel le ha brindado y es por esta razón que espera muy confiadamente que su nuevo crédito que ha solicitado le sea otorgado y así mejorar su situación económica.
texts.en:
Reyna Francisca E. earns her living selling fruits and vegetables in the Central Market in the city of Chinandega, where she works very hard at her business every day. She has succeeded in getting ahead thanks to the support she gets from Ceprodel, so she is very hopeful that she will be granted the new loan she is seeking, which will allow her to improve her economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Las Flores Group

texts.es:
Las socias del Banco Comunal Las Flores son D. la comunidad D. Paltamarca, Distrito D. Pachamarca, Provincia D. Churcampa, la comunidad D. Paltamarca esta ubicado a 2800 m.s.n.m. la mayor parte D. la población se dedica a la agricultura, produciendo maíz, también a la ganadería.
Paulina es casada, tiene 7 hijos, Paulina tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, Paulina necesita un préstamo D. 400 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. abarrotes y productos plásticos, los sueños D. Paulina son que sus hijos sean profesionales.
Rufina es casada, tiene 5 hijos, Rufina se dedica a la compra y venta D. animales menores en las diferentes ferias, también venD. comida y bebidas, Rufina con el préstamo que obtendrá tiene proyectado comprar mas productos para ampliar su negocio, Rufina sueña con ampliar su negocio y dedicarse al engorD. D. animales.
Rosa es casada, tiene 7 hijos, Rosa se dedica a la compra y venta D. animales menores y quesos, Rosa necesita un préstamo D. 200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. un cerdo, los sueños D. Rosa son educar a sus hijos y dedicarse al engorD. D. animales.
texts.en:
The members of Las Flores Community Bank are from the Paltamarca community, in the Pachamarca Distrint, of the Churcampa Province. The Paltamarca community is located at 2800 M.S.N.M. For the most part, the population is engaged in farming activities. They produce corn and raise livestock. Paulina is married and has seven children. Paulina has a store in her house where she sells general groceries. Paulina needs a loan for 400 PEN to buy groceries and plastic products. Paulina’s dream is for her children to become professionals. Rufina is married and has five children. Rufina buys small animals and sells them in the different fairs. She also sells food and drinks. Rufina plans to use the loan to buy more products to expand her business. Rufina’s dreams are to expand her business and devote her time to fattening her animals. Rosa is married and has seven children. Rosa buys and sells small animals and cheese. Rosa needs a loan for 200 PEN to buy a pig. Rosa’s dreams are to educate her children and to devote her time to fattening her animals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, drinks, small animals and grain

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: Elsa tiene 21 años, es una joven muy trabajadora, vive sola en una cuarto que alquiló cuando llego a Juliaca desde su natal Cabana (Distrito de Puno) y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. Su negocio es la venta de cosméticos, es una actividad muy rentable y divertida, ya que tiene muchas clientas a quienes venderle y con quienes disfruta mucho conversando, sale todos los días muy temprano por la mañana, y con su bolsa repleta de cosméticos comienza su venta diaria. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientas sobre qué crema les harán mejor o qué colores les darán mayor realce a su rostro. Lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y espera en el futuro pueda tener una tienda de productos de belleza, donde pueda ofrecer con mayor comodidad todos sus productos, ya que lo que menos le gusta es tener que caminar todo el día bajo el inclemente sol. Este es el primer préstamo de Elsa con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo y está dispuesta a hacerlo, ya que desea obtener más créditos en el futuro, en su banco comunal es muy responsable. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos de belleza, y así podrá incrementar la cantidad de mercadería que vende.
texts.en:
Elsa is 21 years old, is a young very hardworking person, and lives alone in a room she rented when she arrived to Juliaca from her hometown of Cabana (District of Puno). What she most wishes is to improve her quality of life. Her business is in the sale of cosmetics; this activity is very fun and profitable given that she enjoys chatting with many of her clients to whom she sells her products. She leaves every morning very early, and with her bag full of cosmetics she begins her daily sales. What she most enjoys about her job is giving her clients advice on what cream will be best for them or what colors will make their faces gleam the most. She has been carrying out this activity for the past 3 years, and hopes to in the future be able to have a beauty shop where she will be able to offer her products more comfortably, given that what she likes the least about her job is that she has to walk all day under the glaring sun. This is Elsa’s first loan with MFP, and she knows that she has to make her payments on time and is willing to do so given that she hopes to obtain more loans in the future. In her communal bank she is very responsible. With the 1,000 PEN that she is requesting she will purchase more beauty products and will be able to in this way increase the amount of merchandise that she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To add to her merchandise (beauty products).

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: Miriam es una joven que a sus 23 años siente la obligación moral de llevar dinero a su hogar, vive en la casa de sus padres y siente que ya es hora de ayudar en los gastos del hogar. La creciente demanda por las llamadas a celular, le han dado la oportunidad de ejercer una actividad con la que se siente cómoda, trabaja todos los días ofreciendo llamadas a celular de forma ambulatoria. Su llamativo chaleco verde y su encantadora sonrisa, han hecho que sea una de las muchachas más buscadas para alquilar por unos minutos uno de sus teléfonos celulares, además es muy atenta y justa en el cobro, por ello, su negocio marcha muy bien. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y ayudarlos a comunicarse con las personas que desean. Lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y anhela en el futuro tener su propilo local de llamadas, así podrá mejorar sus ingresos y ayudar a sus padres con los gastos de su casa. Por otro lado, lo que considera más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día parada en la calle en la espera de clientes, lo cual le es muy cansado. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, en su primer crédito fue muy puntual y espera serlo ahora también, en su banco comunal es una socia muy querida, ya que contagia su alegría al resto de socias. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará dos nuevos celulares para atender a más personas a la vez.
texts.en:
Miriam is a young woman who is 23 years old. She feels the moral obligation to bring money into her home. She lives in Miriam is a young woman who is 23 years old. She feels the moral obligation to bring money into her home. She lives in her parents’ house. She feels it is now time to help with the household expenses. The growing demand for making calls on cell phones has given her the opportunity to engage in a business in which she feels comfortable. She works every day, on foot, offering cell phone calls. Her eye-catching green vest and her enchanting smile have made her one of the most sought after girls to rent a few minutes of cell phone time from. Also, she is very thoughtful and fair in her charges. Therefore, her business is going very well. What she likes most about her work is talking with her customers and helping them to communicate with the people they want to talk to. She has been doing this for five years, and in the future she would like to have her own stand for making calls. This way she could improve her income and help her parents with the expenses of their house. On the other hand, what she thinks is the most difficult is having to stay all day standing in the street waiting for customers. This makes her very tired. This is her second loan with MFP. She was very punctual with her first loan, and she expects to be the same with this loan, too. She is a beloved member of her community bank. Her happiness is contagious to the rest of the members. She will use the 1,000 PEN to buy two new cell phones to be able to tend to more people at once.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy two cell phones

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga tiene 38 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y admirada en su barrio, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su hija Mayomi de 17 años, a quien desea dar unos buenos estudios superiores. Su trabajo le exige mucha responsabilidad, es empleada del hogar, y entre sus muchas tareas diarias como; cocinar, lavar, planchar, etc, está la de cuidar a los hijos de la familia para la que trabaja, a quienes quiere como si fueran sus propios hijos. Su día comienza muy temprano, a las 7 de la mañana el desayuno tiene que estar preparado sobre la mesa, para luego llevar a los niños hasta sus respectivos centros educativos, luego, y lo más le gusta es cocinar y la sazón que le pone a sus comidas es muy sabrosa. Lleva 25 años realizando esta actividad, 5 de ellos, con esta familia, pero su deseo es tener un negocio propio. Este es el primer préstamo de Olga con MFP, espera cumplir con todas sus cuotas a tiempo y así no perjudicar a las socias de su banco comunal, en donde es muy respetada por la responsabilidad que demuestra. Los mil nuevos soles solicitados serán parte de capital para su futuro negocio, una de las posibilidades es comprar ropa para venderla en la feria de su localidad los días que tiene libre de su trabajo, la otra, es instalar una bodega en su casa y dejar de trabajar para otros. Asimismo, con una parte del dinero pagará los gastos de educación de su hija.
texts.en:
Olga, 38, is a very hard working woman who is admired in her neighborhood. She lives in a rented house with her 17 year old daughter. Olga wants to give her daughter a good university education. Her work demands a lot of responsibility. She is a household employee. Among her many daily tasks are: cooking, washing, ironing, etc. She takes care of the children of the family she works for, and she loves the children like they were her own. Her day starts very early. At seven in the morning breakfast has to be ready and on the table. Then, she takes the children to their respective educational centers. Later, she does what she likes best; she cooks. The flavor that she adds to her meals is very delicious. She has been doing this type of work for twenty five years. Five of those years have been with this family. But, her wish is to have her own business. This is Olga’s first loan with MFP. She expects to make all of her payments on time. That way she will not harm the members of her community bank where she is much respected for the responsibility she has demonstrated. The 1,000 PEN will be part of the capital for her future business. One of the possibilities is to buy clothes to sell at the local fair on her days off from work. The other is to set up a store in her house and stop working for others. With part of the money she will pay her daughter’s educational expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital to invest in her business

loans.name: Sabiduria Ii Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Sabiduría inicia su tercer ciclo con 21 socias. 
	
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta de abarrotes en general, prendas de vestir, artesanía, verduras, cereales, carne, comida, cosméticos, repuestos, quesos.
	 
Como es el caso de Basilia que es casada, tiene 35 años y 3 hijos, Basilia tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, carnes, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su hija, además los días sábados y domingos viaja a las ferias en donde compra queso y animales menores.
Por otro lado Teofila es casada, tiene 36 años y 2 hijos, Teofila junto a su esposo realizan bellos trabajos en telar como pasadizos, productos que vende en el mercado de la ciudad, además Teofila vende alfalfa en el mercado de Carmen Alto.
	
Mientras que Aydee es soltera, tiene 31 años y 2 hijos, Aydee se dedica a la compra y venta de quesos, sus ventas son a trabajadores de instituciones y al crédito. Además Aydee vende cereales en la ciudad de Chincha. 

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos de prestamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles  haciendo un total de 11,950 soles de prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra de bebidas, arroz, azúcar, alfalfa, trigo, cebada, maíz, quesos, animales menores.

Los sueños de las socias son mejorar sus negocios, salir adelante, ahorrar y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The Sabiduría communal bank is starting its third loan cycle with 21 members. The members are involved in various businesses such as selling groceries, clothing, handicrafts, vegetables, grains, meat, food, cosmetics, spare parts, cheese, etc. As an example there is Basilia, who is married, 35 years old with 3 children. She has a stO. in her house where sells groceries, vegetables, and meat, which she does with the help of her daughter. In addition, on Saturdays and Sundays she travels to various markets where she buys cheese and young animals. Another example is Teofila, who is married, 36 years old and has 2 children. Teofila, along with her husband, make beautiful woven products such as ponchos, which they sell in the city market. In addition, Teofila sells alfalfa in the Carmen Alto market. Finally, there's Aydee, who is single, 31 years old with 2 children. Aydee works selling and buying cheese. Her sales are to workers and on credit. In addition, Aydee sells grains in the city of Chincha. The members need differing loan amounts such as 300 Soles, 600 Soles, 900 Soles, etc. with a total of 11,950 Soles for the entire communal bank. The loans will be invested in the purchase of drinks, rice, sugar, alfalfa, wheat, barley, corn, cheese and young animals. The member's dreams are to improve their businesses, get ahead, save and that their children become profressionals.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sodas, rice, sugar, alfalfa, wheat, barley, corn, cheese, and young animals

loans.name: Mirachisun Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mirachisun que significa “Hagamos Reproducir”, el Banco inicia su ciclo 20 con 18 socias. 
	
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta de accesorios, cosméticos, ropa, joyas, animales menores, helados, jugos, mercerías, ferretería y brindan servicios de fotocopias.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos de prestamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles  haciendo un total de 11,950 soles de prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra de helados, joyas, arroz, azúcar, fideo, colonias, pinturas, frutas, polos, chompas

Los sueños de las socias son ampliar sus negocios, tener casa propia y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank Mirachisun, which means “Lets Make Things Reproduce”, is in its 20th loan cycle and has 18 members. The members carry out different businesses such as the sale of accessories, cosmetics, clothing, jewelry, small cattle, ice cream, juices, sowing wares, hardware, and they also offer photocopy services. The members are requesting different amounts to loan such as 300 PEN, 600 PEN, and 900 PEN, which comes to a total of 11,950 PEN in loans from this Communal Bank. Their loans will be invested in the purchase of ice cream, jewelry, rice, sugar, noodles, colognes, paints, fruits, polo shirts, and sweaters. The dreams of the bank members are to expand their business, have their own homes, and that their children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ice cream, jewelry, rice, sugar, noodles, colognes, paints, fruits, polo shirts, and sweaters.

loans.name: Rosa Sonia

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Morenita II.
Rosa es casada, tiene 37 años y 3 hijos, Rosa junto a su esposo tienen una imprenta llamada “Emely Graf” esta ubicado en el centro de la ciudad en un local alquilado. Además Rosa vende insumos de imprenta que ofrece a las demás imprentas.
Rosa necesita un préstamo de 750 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de papeles.
Los sueños de Rosa son implementar con maquinas modernas su negocio y que sus hijos tengan una buena educación y alimentación.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Communal Bank Morenita II. Rosa is married, 37 years old, and has 3 children; Rosa and her husband have a printing press called “Emely Graf” that is located in the center of the city in a rented locale. In addition Rosa sells printing supplies and offers to the rest printing services. Rosa needs a loan of 750 PEN, money that will be invested in the purchase of paper. Rosa’s dreams are to run her business with modern machinery, and that her children receive a good education and are well fed.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase paper.

loans.name: Tania

texts.es:
Tania es socia del Banco Comunal Morenita II.
Tania es conviviente, tiene 33 años y 3 hijos, Tania tiene un puesto en el mercado Magdalena en donde vende carne, actividad que realiza todos los días, los animales los compra en las ferias y los beneficia en el camal.
Tania necesita un préstamo de 750 soles dinero que será invertido como parte de pago de una res.
Los sueños de Tania son implementar su carnecería con una cortadora, moledora y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Tania is a member of the Communal Bank Morenita II. Tania lives with her partner, is 33 years old, and has 3 children. Tania has a stand in the Magdalena Market where she sells meat, an activity that she carries every day. She purchases the animals at regional markets and processes them at the slaughterhouse. Tania needs a loan of 750 PEN, money that will be invested as part of payment for a head of cattle. Tania’s dreams are to furnish her butcher’s shop with a meat cutter and grinder, and that she is able to offer her children a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay part of a payment for a head of cattle.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Morenita II.
Maria es conviviente, tiene 42 años y 4 hijos, Maria junto a su esposo se dedican a la venta de ataúdes que manda a elaborar con los carpinteros y ella realiza los acabados de tapizado y pintado, sus ventas los realiza en las diferentes provincias.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ataúdes en blanco.
Maria sueña con tener un negocio estable y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Communal Bank Morenita II. Maria lives with her partner, is 42 years old, and has 4 children. Maria and her husband dedicate themselves to the sale of coffins that are ordered from carpenters, and she carries out the finishing touches by upholstering and painting them. They carry out their sales in different provinces. Maria needs a loan of 900 PEN, money that will be invested in the purchase of blank coffins. Maria dreams of having a stable business, and that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase blank coffins.

loans.name: Lidia Q

texts.es:
Lidia es socia del Banco Comunal Morenita II.
Lidia es viuda, tiene 57 años y 6 hijos, Lidia viaja a las diferentes ferias D. la región en donD. compra cereales, quesos, animales menores, productos que venD. en los mercados D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho. Además Lidia hace bordados D. cuadros artesanales.
Lidia necesita un préstamo D. 750 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. oveja, quesos.
Los sueños D. Lidia son mejorar su casa y su negocio.
texts.en:
Lidia is a member of the Communal Bank Morenita II. Lidia is widowed, 57 years old, and has 6 children. Lidia travels to the different regional markets where she purchases grains, cheeses, and small cattle, products that she sells in the markets of city of Ayacucho. Lidia also embroiders artisan handicrafts. Lidia needs a loan of 750 PEN, money that will be invested in the purchase of sheep and cheeses. Lidia dreams of improving her house and her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sheep and cheeses.

loans.name: Patty Maribel

texts.es:
Patty es socia del Banco Comunal Corrí Ayllu que significa Familia de Oro.
Patty  es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 1 hijo, Patty  tiene cabinas de Internet en su casa, negocio que es administrado por su hermano, en donde también vende golosinas. Además Patty  vende cosméticos por catálogos.
Patty  necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de una computadora.
Patty  sueña con ampliar su negocio con mas maquinas, locutorio, fotocopiadora e implementar una librería.
texts.en:
Patty is a member of the Communal Bank Corrí Ayllu, which means Family of Gold. Patty lives with her partner, is 30 years old, and has 1 child. Patty has Internet booths in her home, a business that is managed by her brother and where they also sell sweets. Patty also sells cosmetics through catalogs. Patty needs a loan of 2,000 PEN, money that will be invested in the purchase of a computer. Patty dreams of expanding her business by adding more computers, a telephone kiosk, a photocopier, and a bookstore.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a computer.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina es socia del Banco Comunal Corrí Ayllu que significa Familia de Oro.
Alejandrina es casada, tiene 58 años y 6 hijos, Alejandrina junto a su esposo tienen una fabrica de yeso ubicado en su casa, para lo cual cuenta con hornos y con personal que trabaja en el proceso, sus ventas los realiza a las diferentes ferreterías de la ciudad.
Alejandrina necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de piedra y leña.
Alejandrina sueña con salir adelante con su negocio, vender sus productos fuera de la ciudad y que su ultimo hijo culmine sus estudios.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is a member of the Banco Comunal Corrí Ayllu, which means Golden Family. Alejandrina is married and 58 years old. She has 6 children. She and her husband make plaster in their home, where they have ovens and staff to assist them. They sell their product at various hardware stores around the city. Alejandrina needs a loan of 2000 soles, which she will use to buy stone and firewood. Alejandrina dreams of improving her business, selling her products outside the city, and watching her youngest son finish his studies.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing stone and firewood.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es: Adela tiene 56 años, es madre soltera, vive con su hija y su nieta en su casa propia. Desde hae 6 años vende ropa de segundo uso y abarrotes, esta mercadería la lleva a un puerto fluvial cercano a su casa, donde sus principales consumidores son los agricultores. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que se siente una mujer útil y se relaciona con muchas personas, además le es muy rentable, ya que sus productos y sus prendas de vestir se venden muy rápido cada día. Posteriormente, Adela quiere mandar a construir un local para establecerse en tienda de ropa y dejar el comercio ambulante. Este es su 3er préstamo con MFP, y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque todos sus compañeros son muy responsables y amables. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más ropa y productos comestibles para incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Adela is 56 years old. She is a single mother and lives with her daughter and granddaughter in a house she owns. She's sold secondhand clothing and groceries for the past six years. She takes this merchandise to a port on the river near her house, where most of her customers are farmworkers. What she likes best about her work is feeling like a useful woman and interacting with a lot of people. It's also quite profitable, and her food products and articles of clothing sell very quickly every day. In the future, Adela would like to build a shop location instead of selling on the street. This is her third loan with MFP, and she likes working with her communal bank because all of her partners are very responsible and friendly. She will use the requested loan to buy more clothing and groceries to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her stock

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia es socia del Banco Comunal Corrí Ayllu que significa Familia de Oro.
Eugenia es casada, tiene 45 años y 7 hijos, Eugenia junto a su esposo tienen una panadería en su casa, en donde elaboran panes variados, galletas, sus ventas los realiza en la ciudad de Vilcas Huaman.
Eugenia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina.
Los sueños de Eugenia son salir adelante con su trabajo y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Eugenia is a member of the Banco Comunal Corrí Ayllu, which means Golden Family. Eugenia is married and 45 years old. She has 7 children. Eugenia and her husband have a bakery in their house, where they make a variety of breads and cookies, which they sell in the city of Vilcas Huaman. Eugenia needs a loan of 1000 soles, which she will use to purchase flour. Eugenia's dreams are to grow her business and see her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flour.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz tiene 48 años, vive con su esposo, quien es trabajador dependiente, y con sus 2 hijas quienes la ayudan mucho en su negocio. Desde hace 5 años se dedica a la crianza de pollos en su propia casa, en un pequeño galpón que construyó su esposo. Una vez que sus animales están listos para la venta, ella misma los sacrifica y los vende listos para la parrilla, con esta modalidad tiene mejores ganancias. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que conoce a muchas personas y entabla buenas relaciones con sus clientes, además su vivienda, que es también su puesto de venta, esta ubicada en un lugar muy transitado. Para un futuro cercano, Luz quiere mandar a construir dos galpones adicionales para tener mayor espacio para sus animales. Con MFP ya tiene 3 préstamos, lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que todos son bien organizados y dinámicos para el trabajo en equipo. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más pollos bebé y alimento balanceado para criarlos adecuadamente.
texts.en:
Luz is 48 and lives with her husband, who is a salaried worker, and her two daughters who help her out a lot in her business. For the past 5 years she has earned her living growing chickens at her house in a small coop that her husband built. As soon as her chickens are ready for sales she kills them herself and sells them ready to cook, which earns her more money. What she likes about her work is that she gets to meet a lot of people and develop good relationships with her customers. In addition, her house, which is also her place of business, is located in a very busy area. In the near future Luz would like to have two more coops built so she can have more space for her chickens. So far, Luz has had 3 loans with MFP. What she likes about her village bank is that everyone is well-organized and excited about working on a team. She plans to use her loan to buy more baby chicks and nutritious feed so she can raise them well.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy baby chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol es socia del Banco Comunal Corrí Ayllu que significa Familia de Oro.
Marisol es casada, tiene 35 años y 3 hijos, Marisol realiza trabajos artesanales como carteras, correas, Marisol es la presidenta de una Asociación Civil de Mujeres Artesanas Cabuya, el cual cuenta con 10 socias, sus productos los venden a diferentes tiendas de la capital y también se exportan a través de intermediarios.
Marisol necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de una maquina aparadora de cueros.
Los sueños de Marisol son tener tiendas de exposición en diferentes departamentos y exportar directamente sus productos.
texts.en:
Marisol is an associate of the Communal Bank Corri Ayulla which means Family of Gold. Marisol is married, is 35 years old and has 3 children. Marisol makes a living as an artesian. She works making purses and sashes. Marisol is the president of the Civil Association of Artisan Women, which has 10 associates that sell their products to different stores in the capital and also they export their good through intermediaries. Marisol needs a loan of $1025 that will be invested in the purchase of a sewing machine for leather. The dreams of Marisol are to have stores in different neighborhoods and to be able to directly export her goods.

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine for leather

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.es: Ninfa tiene 57 años, es soltera y vive sola en su casa propia. Desde hace 3 año vende frutas (naranjas, papayas, mandarinas, etc.), comida (desayunos y almuerzos) y bebidas durante todo el día en la puerta de su casa, ya que se encuentra ubicada cerca de una calle principal por donde transitan muchas personas que al ver lo que ofrece Ninfa se acercan provocado por lo deliciosas que se ven sus frutas y sus platos de comida. Para Ninfa, este trabajo es una forma de no sentirse sola, ya que siempre hay personas que la acompañan consumiendo sus productos. Su deseo a futuro es tener una bodega muy grande donde pueda vender más cómoda y mucha más variedad de productos. Este es su 4to crédito con MFP, y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que todos son solidarios y se siente en familia. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá comprando más frutas y bebidas, además de ampliar el espacio donde vende sus platos de comida.
texts.en:
Ninfa is 57 years old and is unmarried. She lives alone in her own house. For the past 4 years she has sold fruit (oranges, papayas, mandarines, etc.) and breakfast and lunch entrees. She also sells drinks during the whole day from the door of her house located close to a main street where a lot of people go to see Ninfas for the delicious fruit and plates of food that she sells. Ninfa's work helps her to not feel alone and isolated. She always has people to accompany her by buying her products. She wishes that in the future she can have a big store where she can have more room and will be able to offer a greater variety of products.

(Translated by Ashlee of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise and improve the space of her business

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Fe.
Maria es casada, tiene 52 años y 4 hijos, Maria junto a su esposo venden ropa variada en la selva ayacuchana a donde viajan cada 15 días. Además Maria vende comida por las tardes en la puerta de su casa.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 900 soles, dinero que será invertido para la compra de ropa variada.
Los sueños de Maria son mejorar sus negocios e implementar un nuevo negocio.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the community bank, Faith. Maria is 52 years old, and is married with four children. Maria and her husband sell clothing in the jungles of Ayacucho where they travel to and from every 15 days. Furthermore, Maria sells food at the font door of her house. Maria needs a loan of 900 Soles which is equivalent to $325 to buy various types of clothing. Maria's dream is to better her business and to one day start a new one.

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various types of clothing

loans.name: Alina Monica

texts.es:
Alina es socia del Banco Comunal Fe.
Alina es soltera, tiene 49 años y 1 hijos, Alina tiene una piñatería en donde vende regalos, artículos para fiestas infantiles, actividad que realiza todos los días, además Alina vende hamburguesas por las noches. Alina tiene proyectado implementar su negocio con la venta de jugos, postres.
Alina necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de una extractora.
Los sueños de Alina son tener una cafetería y terminar de pagar todas sus deudas.
texts.en:
Alina Monica is a partner of the Faith Communal Bank. Alina is unmarried, she is 49 years old and has 1 child, Alina owns a piñata shop where she sells gifts, kids party supplies, and hamburgers at night. She works at her shop every day. Alina is planning to begin to sell juices, and desserts. Alina needs a loan of 325 dollars money that will be invested in the purchase of a juicer. The dreams of Alina are to have a cafeteria and to finish paying all of her debts.

(Translated by Tyler of San Roque School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase of a juicer

loans.name: Gerardina

texts.es:
Gerardina es socia del Banco Comunal Fe.
Gerardina es casada, tiene 51 años y 4 hijos, Gerardina tiene un puesto en el mercado F. Vivanco en donD. venD. carne, los animales los adquiere en las diferentes ferias D. la región y los beneficia en el camal.
Gerardina necesita un préstamo D. 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. cerdos y ovino.
Los sueños D. Gerardina son mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Gerardina is a partner of a communal bank. She is married, has four children, and is fifty-one years old. Geradina has a stand in the marketplace called Vivanco where she sells chicken and other animal meats. She gets the animals from other marketplaces and then takes them to the slaughter house. Then she sells the meat. Gerardina needs to be loaned $325 which she will invest in buying pigs and cows. Her dream is to improve her business.

(Translated by Andrea of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in buying pigs and cows

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
Soledad S. joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and a Kiva partner in the Philippines, in 2008. Since then, she has had access to capital for her business. She used her first and second loans for sales of chicken and detergent soap. It has been great! The business is running smoothly and bringing in enough proceeds. Now on her third loan, Soledad is applying for 10,000 pesos as additional capital for her business.

Soledad is a 53-year-old mother of three. She hails from the beautiful city of Antipolo, Rizal Province in the Philippines. Her eldest son, Sonnyboy, is a 21-year-old elementary graduate. Her youngest, Anie Rose, is a 15-year-old elementary graduate. Soledad is married to 53-year-old Francisco, her partner in business.

She hopes that in the near future she can build a more durable concrete house. And she also dreams that some day she can send her youngest child to school up to college so she can find a good job. She is hoping to have more stock for retail.

loans.use: Additional capital for retail of chicken and detergent soap

loans.name: Neriza

texts.en:
Neriza F. is from the village of Cabunga-an, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old. Neriza is single and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Neriza owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, selling agricultural products. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling rice. Neriza has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 7,500 PHP a month from this actrivity.

In 2009, Neriza joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Neriza is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital to buy more rice to sell.

This loan will be the first taken out by Neriza from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to meet her family's needs and to pay for the children's education.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital to purchase rice

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly S. is from the village of Lower Langcangan, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old. Merly is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Merly owns and operates a business in the food sector, selling hot cake. The main source of income for her business comes primarily from selling hot cake within her local community. Merly has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Merly joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Merly has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC.

Merly is now requesting her second loan from GDMPC. She hopes for a loan in the amount of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase ingredients for making hot cake. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for making hot cake

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora E. is from the village of Cabunga-an, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 58 years old. Leonora is widowed and has one grown child. To make a living, Leonora owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, operating a "sari-sari" or general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Leonora has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Leonora joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Leonora is requesting a loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Leonora from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and obtain working capital

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en:
Bernardita T. is from the town of Katipunan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 59 years old. Bernardita is married and has 10 grown children. To make a living, Bernardita owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops and backyard animals. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Bernardita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Bernardita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Bernardita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

Bernardita is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizing materials such as manure. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Bernardita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Rolly

texts.en:
Rolly B. is from the village of Segatic Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 20 years old. Rolly is single. To make a living, Rolly owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Rolly has been engaged in his business for over ten years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for this activity.

In 2009, Rolly joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. He wanted to help improve his living situation and incrase his ability to engage in business activities. Rolly is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer for growing corn. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rolly from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for growing corn

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna D. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 39 years old. Edna is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Edna owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, running a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Edna has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Edna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. She wished to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Edna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Edna is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to obtain working capital. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Edna from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and obtain working capital

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia L. is from the town of Polanco, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 52 years old. Lilia is widowed and has four grown children. To make a living, Lilia owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, running a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Lilia has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Lilia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. She wished to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Lilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Lilia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Lilia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to put into savings as a reserve for future emergencies.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.
