Mến Thị Đào (no: 010102140025) was born in 1965. She lives with her husband and two sons. Her husband and her oldest son are building-workers.

Every day, she buys scrap-iron from other villages to resell. She wants to borrow 5,886,000 VND to buy more scrap-iron.

She is the group leader of one other member of her group: Ms. Sáng Thị Nguyễn (no: 010102140023) was born in 1958. She wants to borrow 4,578,000 VND to invest in her small business.

loans.use: To buy more scrap-iron to sell

loans.name: Peng

texts.en:
Cultivating a rice crop is a part of 60-year-old Mrs. Peng L.'s daily routine. On the other hand, she also buys natural produce at the cheapest price from people who live in the rural areas, and then sells that produce in the market to gain income.

Peng L. is a widowed mother since her husband died of senility a long time ago. She has six children: four are married and have already started new family homes, while the others are single and work with her on the farm.

Peng L. has been facing difficulty with transportation because she doesn’t own a vehicle for her driving needs. Therefore, she requested a loan from Kiva's partner HKL. She will use this loan to purchase a used motorcycle to ride to meet her business transportation needs.

loans.use: To purchase a used motorcycle to meet business needs

loans.name: Huong's Group

texts.en:
Hương Thị M. Nguyễn (no: 010102140043) was born in 1983. Her family has a cycle-repair shop. She wants to borrow 1,972,000 VND to invest in her shop.

There are 3 other Fund participants in her group:

Sinh Thị Thư Nguyễn (no: 010102140044) was born in 1983. She wants to borrow 1,972,000 VND to breed pigs and poultry.

Lan Tuyết Thị Phạm (no: 010102140045) was born in 1982. She wants to borrow 1,972,000 VND to raise chickens.

Nhung Thị Nguyễn (no: 010102140046) was born in 1976. She wants to borrow 1,972,000 VND to buy chickens to sell in the market.

loans.use: To invest in her cycle-repair shop

loans.name: Razia Yaqoob Masih Group

texts.en:
My name is Razia and I have been a citizen of the city of Borewala, Pakistan for the last 15 years. Borewala city is famous for its shrines. I have involved myself in the clothes embroidering business. I learnt this art from my mother and now this art is rewarding me with income. I save my money for rainy days. My husband, Y. M., drives a tractor to deliver crops from one place to another. I’m applying for a loan to pay off the remaining installments on my husband’s tractor so that he gets the whole income without paying the installments.

I’m the group leader of four other women from my locality. Sakina baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits and vegetables to sell. Sharifan baji wants a loan to buy leather to sell. Hamidan and Suraiya baji each want a loan to buy a donkey cart.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To complete payments on a tractor

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en: Remedios O. is from the city of Baikingon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 68 years old, married, and has four adult children. Remedios owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Remedios joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding her business. Remedios is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will also be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and to support the needs of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

location.town: Baikingon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Nusrat William Masih Group

texts.en:
Mukhtaran baji wants a loan to buy leather to sell.

Suraiya baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

Parveen akhtar baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading.

Nusrat baji is the group leader of these above-mentioned ladies. They are all very hardworking ladies and they handle their own businesses to manage their financial expenses. They all belong to a city named Borewala, Pakistan, which is famous for its shrines.

To earn income, Nusrat baji operates an embroidered-dress business. She prepares embroidered dresses on orders which she collects from the clothes shops. She saves her income for her rainy days. Her husband’s name is W. M. and he runs a leather-selling business. She is applying for a loan to buy leather to expand her husband’s leather-selling business.

loans.use: To buy leather for her husband's business

loans.name: Shamim Muhammad Aslam Group

texts.en:
Shamim baji's husband, M. A., is a delivery man by profession and delivers different items, like fruits and vegetables, from one place to another. He delivers the items on his donkey cart. Shamim baji is applying for a loan to buy a new donkey cart because her husband’s old cart is rough and rotted in different areas. Shamim baji also runs an embroidery business. She takes orders from her neighbors and charges them $3 per dress. She uses her income as needed. She has lived in the city of Borewala, Pakistan for the past 10 years. Borewala is famous for its shrines.

She is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Zareena baji wants a loan to buy ice to sell. Sumera baji wants a loan to buy items like chairs, mirrors and scissors for her barber shop. Ramzana baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. Zubaida baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
The two persons shown in the picture are Mrs. Sim P., 65, and her husband, age 61. They currently live in Siem Reap Province.

Sim P. earns a living by raising pigs in a pigpen behind her house. She raises them both for their offspring and for slaughter. In addition, she also cultivates a rice crop, while her husband works as a local carpenter. They have six children, four of whom are single and the other two are married; they also work with her in pig raising.

Presently, Sim P. faces difficulty with transportation in that she always hires a taxi when she needs transportation. To reduce the cost of transportation, she would like a $1200 loan in order to buy a new motorbike for her family's riding needs.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for her family's riding needs

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel B. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 65 years old. Isabel is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Isabel owns & operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from harvesting & selling river-caught fish in the local community. Isabel is just starting this business.

In 1999, Isabel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Isabel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 Philippine Pesos from PMPC. Isabel is requesting a new loan of 7,000 pesos which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Isabel from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment

loans.name: Sakina Ghulam Nabi Group

texts.en:
I. baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits to sell.

Naziran baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

Nasreen baji and Anwar baji each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shops.

Sakina baji is the group leader for the above-mentioned ladies and a citizen of a city named Borewala, Pakistan for the past 10 years. Borewala city is famous for its shrines. Her husband's name is G. N. and he runs a construction supplies business. He gets orders from building contractors and earns a profit. He has been doing this work for the past 5 years.

Sakina baji runs her embroidery business to earn income. She gets orders from her neighbors and relatives. She does this work so she can save for a rainy day. She is applying for a loan to buy construction supplies so that her husband can complete the orders of his customers.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies to sell

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena G. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 34 years old. Rowena is single. To make a living, Rowena owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Rowena has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 1999, Rowena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rowena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. Rowena is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the 12th loan taken out by Rowena from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her general living conditions. About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Parveen Younas Masih Group

texts.en:
Bushran baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

Naziran baji wants a loan to buy wood to sell.

Ramzana baji and Rubina baji each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shops.

Razia baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart to transport loads.

Jamila baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics to sell.

Parveen baji is the wife of Y. M. and they have been living in a city named Borewala, Pakistan for the past 10 years. Her husband runs a timber-selling business. He has 4 years of experience in this business. Parveen baji operates an embroidery business. She prepares embroidered dresses for her neighbors and relatives and earns income. She does this work to share the financial burden of her husband. She is applying for a loan to expand her husband’s timber-selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy timber to sell

loans.name: Bat-Erdene

texts.en:
Bat-Erdene A. lives with his wife and two children in Arhangay Province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. His son goes to a local university, and his daughter is a high-school student. 

Bat-Erdene has a small business as a butcher. With the help of his wife, he started his butchering business in 2003 with a loan of 300,000 MNT (approximately $220). He usually purchases carcasses from herders in the countryside and sells the meat in small pieces in his butcher shop. Compared to the start of his business in 2003, his business capital has more than tripled to 1,000,000 MNT, and he has gained significant experience in the business. 

In the future, he would like to expand his business and make sure to send their high-school daughter to the university of her choice. He requests a loan to purchase more carcasses for his business.

loans.use: To buy more carcasses for his business

loans.name: Davaasuren

texts.en:
Davaasuren J. lives with her husband and 20-year-old son in Arhangai Province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Their son goes to a local university. 

Davaasuren has a small retail business in clothing. She usually travels to Ereen, China, a border town from where many inexpensive Chinese products are exported, and purchases inexpensive yet attractive clothing for women and men.

She started her business in 2005 with a loan of 700,000 MNT (approximately $500). Within two years, she was able to buy a small car for her family with the business profit. Today, her business has expanded; business capital has exceeded 2,000,000 MNT. She says that she works hard on her business in order to make sure that her son receives a good education without any financial strains. 

She requests a loan to purchase more clothes from Ereen, China.

loans.use: To buy more men's and women's apparel from Ereen, China

loans.name: Jeryn

texts.en:
Jeryn S. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 32 years old. Jeryn is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Jeryn owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector selling home products. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling personal home products to tourists and local community members. Jeryn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Jeryn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jeryn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Jeryn is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Jeryn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
There are many Cambodians who make a living as rice cultivators; one of them is Mrs. S. who has been working in this sector since 1990. She and her husband grow rice on their own farmland that they inherited from their grandparents. From this business they can generate an income of around US$ 4 per day. This humble couple has three single children who are students.

This growing-rice season, the family planted rice two months ago but their rice is not growing well due to the lack of fertilizer. Because of this condition, S. needs a loan from Kiva in order to purchase fertilizer to improve her crops' yield.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer to improve her yield

loans.name: Maryam Muhammad Bashir Group

texts.en:
Maryam baji is the wife of M. B. and they have lived in a city named Lahore, Pakistan for the past 10 years. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and for its Punjabi foods. Maryam baji couldn’t get an education because her parents had few financial resources. She learnt the art of sewing clothes from her mother. Now she operates her own clothes-sewing business which gives her good income and gives her confidence to lead an independent life. Her husband has a business selling construction supplies. He fulfills the orders of building contractors and earns a profit. Nowadays he is out of stock so Maryam baji is applying for a loan to buy construction supplies to complete the orders of his customers.

She is the group leader for two other women from her locality. Gulzar baji wants a loan to buy a lathe machine. Asma Hanif baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies to sell

loans.name: Razia Muhammad Shafee Group

texts.en:
"My name is Razia and I come from a city named Lahore, Pakistan and have lived here for the past 15 years. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and for its Punjabi foods. I am an independent lady; I operate my own clothes-sewing business and earn income. I save my income in a "committee" and I have plans to renovate my house with the committee amount when it's my turn to receive it.

My husband's name is M. S. and he runs an electric shop in the community. He sells electrical supplies (wires, switchboards and switches) to his customers. I am applying for a loan to buy electrical supplies to expand my husband’s electrical supplies business."

Razia is the group leader for three other women from her locality. Bano baji wants a loan to buy repair tools for her vehicle repair business. Saima baji wants a loan to buy a welding machine. Zainab baji wants a loan to buy animals (goats) for her meat-selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy electrical supplies to sell

loans.name: Enecita

texts.en:
Enecita Y. is from the city of Baikingon, Cagayan de Oro. She is 36 years old. Enecita is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Enecita owns and operates a business in the agriculture sector; she is involved in banana and barbecue stick production. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling banana and barbecue sticks per order. Enecita has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Enecita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Enecita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to used to finance the business. Enecita is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to expand the business. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Enecita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business for the education of her children and to cover the needs of her family. About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Will be used to expand the business

location.town: Baikingon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Shahida Abdul Sattar Group

texts.en:
Shahida baji is the wife of A. S. and they have lived in a city named Lahore, Pakistan for the past 14 years. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and for its Punjabi foods. Shahida baji is an uneducated lady who couldn’t get an education due to the few financial resources of her parents. Her husband is a cobbler by profession. He takes orders from shoe companies and makes shoes to earn an income.

Shahida baji runs her embroidered clothes business to pay the utilities. They both are very hardworking; their businesses require lots of hard work. Shahida baji is applying for a loan to buy material (leather, nails and shoe polish) to expand her husband’s shoe-making business.

She is the group leader for three other women from her locality. Mumtaz baji wants a loan to buy material (a mirror, cosmetics and a dryer) for her beauty salon. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy paint to sell. Parveen baji wants a loan to buy beams for her shuttering business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy material for shoe-making business

loans.name: Nheng

texts.en:
S. was born in 1979; she is a married woman and blessed with three children. All three of them are students in the local public school. Her husband's name is Im, 30, and he works as a security guard for a customs service.

S. has built a pigpen behind her house where she raises many pigs to earn a living. Because the pig-raising business is a very profitable one for S. and her family, S. has requested a loan of US$ 500 in order to buy additional feed and piglets to raise for sale during the period when pork is commanding the highest price.

loans.use: To buy additional feed and piglets to raise for sale

loans.name: Erik

texts.en:
Erik and Shane seem an unlikely pair to run a board game shop.  Shane works as a behavioral specialist for people with disabilities at a local non-profit while Erik is a veteran of the Iraq War with a background in sales. But they share a love of board games, and opened Just Awesome to provide the community with a family-friendly game store. While serving in the Air Force, Erik learned a game from a young Iraqi which he developed into Just Awesome! He donates all of the proceeds from this game to Operation Iraqi Children. Just Awesome! will also pay to ship any board games to American troops serving overseas. 

With a thoughtful business plan and a passion for their product, Shane and Erik are new entrepreneurs poised for success. They will use their $7,500 loan for advertising and inventory.

Visit www.justawesomethewebsite.com

loans.use: Inventory, furnishings, and advertising

loans.name: Davaanyam

texts.en:
Davaanyam D. is a widow with two children. They live in the Bayanzurh province of Ulaanbaatar. Her 21 year-old son is a local police officer and her 18 year-old daughter is a senior in high school.

Davaanyam has a small retail business in second-hand clothing. She started her business in 2008 by renting a small stall in "Hasu," a local shopping mall. She usually travels to Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, to purchase imported second-hand clothes from the wholesale markets. Since the start in 2008, her business has been doing well and her business capital has increased from 350,000 to 800,000 MNT ($1 USD = 1,450 MNT).

In the near future, Davaanyam would like to expand her business because the demand for her clothes remains high in the local market. She requests a loan to purchase more second-hand clothes as she often runs out of inventory.

loans.use: To buy more used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Deeba Sadaqat Muhammad Latif Group

texts.en:
Deeba sadaqat baji is married to M. L. and they live in a city named Lahore, Pakistan for the back 10 years. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and for its Punjabi foods. Deeba baji operates a decorative embroidery business. She prepares embroidered dresses, on order, which she collect from the cloth shops. She completes a dress in 15 days and earns a good income. Her husband works in a factory on monthly wage. Deeba baji is applying for a loan to buy material (colored thread, cloth and sketches) for her decorative embroidery business.

She is the group leader of two other women from her locality. Zareena baji wants a loan to buy ingredients (lentils, cooking oil and spices) for her food selling business. Maqbool begum baji wants a loan to buy tools for her motor repair workshop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy material for decorative embroidery business.

loans.name: Parveen Abdul Hamid Group

texts.en:
PParveen baji is married to A. H. and they have both resided in Lahore, Pakistan for the past 15 years. They are a very hard-working and good-natured couple. They both handle their clothes selling business. Her husband goes to different cloth shops for selling clothes and she sells the clothes in her community. They have five years of experience in this business. Lately, they have been out of stock. Parveen baji is applying for a loan to buy clothes to expand their clothes-selling business. 

She is the group leader of two other women from her locality. Razia baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit selling business. Tahira naheed baji wants a loan to buy embroidery material (colored thread, clothes and sketches) for making embroidered dresses to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mey

texts.en: S., 48, lives in Pursat province, Cambodia. She has owned a plot of land since 1999. She grows both rice and vegetable crops. She can plant her crops twice a year, in the dry season and the rainy season--a skill she learned from her grandparents. She is a widowed mother who has given birth to six children: four are single, two are married, and they all work as rice farmers. This approaching rice season and after the rains fall, S. starts growing rice crop but she is still lacking equipment to support her business operation. Therefore, she would like a loan of 700 that will be used to purchase fertilizers, seeds, a cow, and piglets to raise. This will help her to achieve a higher income than the previous year.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, seeds, a cow, and piglets to raise.

loans.name: Olubisi

texts.en: Olubisi is 48 years old and married with a child. She sells medicine to make a living. She is requesting for a loan in the amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more medicine to sell. She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell.

loans.name: Nuon

texts.en: The strict faced woman shown in the picture is Mrs. Nuon N., age 41. She is a humble villager who lives in Pursat Province, where she earns a living as a local farmer. She was married, but divorced her husband when her kids were still minors. She has four teenaged children. All four of her children are employed in different occupations. Nuon N. will be using a loan money to buy food and pigs to begin raising in a small stall that she built behind her house. With the half of the loan she will hire a harvester to cut her crops.

loans.use: To buy food and pigs to begin raising.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more cattle to expand his business

loans.name: Busari

texts.en: Busari is 36 years old and married with 2 children. He sells rechargeable phones and cards. He is requesting the loan amount of N 80,000 to purchase more phones and rechargeable cards to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable phones and cards to sell

loans.name: Lusivina

texts.en:
Lusivina L. is from the city of Baikingon, Cagayan de Oro. She is 37 years old. Lusivina is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Lusivina owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling eggs to her respective customers. Lusivina has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lusivina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lusivina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Lusivina is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used as additional capital. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Lusivina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support education of her child and cover the needs of the family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: will be used as addtional capital

location.town: Baikingon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Oumou Hane Bocar

texts.fr: Oumou Hane Bocar S. est une vendeuse de tissus de chaussures etc.   Elle habite à Médine un quartier de la ville de Mbour qui se situe à 80 km de la capitale sénégalaise(Dakar). Elle s’active  dans ce milieu depuis trois ans .Elle n’a pas de cantine mais elle place ses  marchandises chez ses clients habituels pour une durée de 1 mois. Ces marchandises proviennent en général de la Mauritanie pays frontalier du Sénégal. . Ce prêt  lui servira d’acquérir plus de marchandises pour faire face aux besoins de sa clientèle
texts.en:
Oumou Hane Bocar S. sells fabrics, shoes, etc. She lives in Médine, a neighborhood of the town of Mbour, which is situated 80 km from the Senegalese capital (Dakar). She has been working in this sector for 3 years. She doesn't have a shop of her own, but she places her merchandise with her faithful customers for the period of one month. This merchandise comes in general from Mauritania, a border state of Senegal. This loan will allow her to acquire more merchandise so that she can meet her customers' needs.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Aminu

texts.en: Aminu is 65 years old and married with 4 children. He sells bags of yam flour. Yam flour is used for the making of "elubo", a local food eaten mainly in the western part of Nigeria. He is requesting the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more bags of yam flour to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders

loans.use: To purchase more bags of yam flour to sell

loans.name: Savri

texts.en:
K. Savri is an enterprising woman. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a taxi driver and his salary isn't stable, so sometimes debts accumulate. To help her husband, Savri decided to start her own business, designing and making traditional dresses for women. She began after her first child was born and started with a small machine she already owned.

Now, she has a small workshop in her house. The good service and fine quality she offers have made her business grow into a small company. Savri wants a loan of 500 USD to buy seasonal fabrics so she can fill her customers' orders. The loan will help her business grow and raise the quality of life for this family. Savri sincerely thanks you for your help.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing fabrics for sewing traditional dresses

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.en:
K. Jamshed has always been a hard-working man, who has made sure, from his young age, that his family never goes without their daily bread. He is married with two children. Jamshed has a grocery store where he sells different kinds of foodstuffs. With a starting capital of 100 USD, thanks to his perseverance and dedication, Jamshed began this enterprise 7 years ago.

By this time, he has expanded his business and today, this business has become a family affair, with his whole family engaged in the business. Today, Jamshed needs to buy additional foodstuffs to increase the range of his inventory. With this purpose in mind, he is requesting a loan of 800 USD. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: Purchasing foodstuffs to increase the range of his inventory

loans.name: Shomurod

texts.en:
S. Shomurod is a loving and self-sacrificing father. Ever since he was very young, Shomurod has been around people raising animals, and thanks to this experience, he dedicates himself to raising and selling cattle, work that he learned from his humble parents.

With experience gained over time in the purchase and sale of cattle, he has been able to bring stability to his family. The desire that Shomurod harbors in his heart is that of increasing his capital to invest in acquiring more animals. He requests 800 USD to buy more cattle so as to expand his business. Let’s get together behind the request of this devoted father to help him keep bringing well-being and security to the members of his family.

loans.use: Purchasing cattle and calves to expand the business

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica O. is from the city of Baikingon, Cagayan de Oro. She is 27 years old. Jessica is married and has 5 small children. To make a living, Jessica owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, operating a clothing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling used clothing to local community member. Jessica has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Jessica joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jessica has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Jessica is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her business. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Jessica from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children and the needs of the family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital for her business

location.town: Baikingon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Komiljon

texts.en:
Komiljon is a hard-working person, and he makes an effort to give his beloved children the best. He decided to stay in his homeland so that he could help develop it, and now he carries out his everyday chores with a lot of love and affection as he cultivates the land and feeds his animals.

With experience gained over 3 years in the purchase and sale of cattle, he has been able to bring stability to his family. He would now like to purchase more cattle that can create more income for his large family. For this reason he requests 800 USD. Komiljon thanks you very much for your caring for others.

loans.use: Purchasing cattle to expand the business

loans.name: Djalolkhon

texts.en:
D. Djalolkhon is a very hard-working and responsible entrepreneur. He and his family live in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. He is married and has two children. Djalolkhon works in the central city market selling men’s clothing and shoes. His business is characterized by stability and consistent growth. He has been working in the market for 4 years.

Djalolkhon likes to work for himself. His business has been the main source of income for his whole family. Today Djalolkhon would like to ask for a loan of 2500 Somoni to purchase new inventory. We believe Djalolkhon‘s drive for success will help this young entrepreneur succeed and thrive in business. You can be an important part of the growth of Djalolkhon’s business.

loans.use: Purchasing new men's clothing to sell

loans.name: Faizullo

texts.en:
The business activity from which K. Faizullo makes a living is the breeding of livestock. He started this business 10 years ago with a small number of livestock. As his business has developed, he has acquired greater quantities of animals for their eventual sale and he has gained from the profit. According to Faizullo, he works very hard so that he can maintain his children. For that reason, he is always looking for a way to improve the living of his family. Currently Faizullo needs a loan of Somoni 2500 in order to purchase more cattle. He will later resell the cattle, after breeding them. This will allow him to fully meet the needs of his family and educate all of his three children.

loans.use: Purchasing small cattle for business development.

loans.name: Tovmahmad

texts.en:
K. Tovmahmad is 54 years old. He is married with two children. From the time he was young, Tovmahmad learned to work in the small business of cattle breeding. After he married, he continued working in the same business, watching the business grow as a result of his hard work, and seeing his family progressing more and more. His hope is to continue expanding and improving his business to offer a better future for his children, and see them as professional, ethical and hardworking. For this reason he is asking for a loan that will allow him to buy additional livestock. Be an important part of the growth of Tovmahmad’s business.

loans.use: To purchase small cattle to expand the business.

loans.name: Bisolima

texts.en:
K. Bisolima is a 45-year-old widowed woman with two daughters. She assumed full responsibility of financing her children’s education when she lost her husband. Bisolima has owned and operated a seamstress shop for the past 22 years. She sews all forms of women’s national dresses in various styles that suit the tastes of her customers. Bisolima wants to use the loan to buy additional supplies to increase her output and efficiency. She hopes to raise a good income to provide her grandchildren with a quality education.

loans.use: Purchasing fabrics for sewing national dresses.

loans.name: Nening

texts.en:
Nening D. is from the city of San Simon, Cagayan de Oro. She is 20 years old. Nening is married and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Nening owns & operates a business selling bananas in their village. Nening is just starting this business.

In 2009, Nening joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Nening is requesting a new loan of PHP 8000 that will be used to invest in expanding the business.  This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Nening from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support education of children and to support the needs of the family. 


About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

location.town: San Simon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Nosiriddin

texts.en:
M. Nosiriddin lives in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. He is 41 years old, married and has a child. Nosiriddin is the sole provider for his family and earns his living by raising and selling cows and sheep at the local market. Every 2-3 months he purchases young animals from local villagers and raises them over an 8-9 month period and later sells the adult cows and sheep to local butchers. Today Nosiriddin is thinking about expanding his business, as his current earnings are not enough to provide for his family. He plans to purchase young cattle. That’s why he is requesting a loan of 3000 Somoni. Extend your solidarity to Nosiriddin so that he can move forth successfully and accomplish all of his goals.

loans.use: Purchasing young cattle to raise.

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en: For the past eighteen years, Yusuf has worked in agriculture, raising animals. He raises cattle which he cares for greatly since, thanks to them, he can cover his household expenses. Yusuf showed us his animals with great happiness as his cattle were about to be vaccinated against the various sicknesses that affect that type of livestock. For Yusuf, it is very important to work raising his animals which is why he is currently seeking a loan in order to purchase additional cattle so that in future he can earn more money. It will help his family to generate additional income. We appreciate your support for Yusuf’s projects. loans.use: To purchase more cattle to expand his business

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn M., or Josie as she is commonly called in their village, is 42 years old and still single. She is now taking care of her elderly parents and they are living in Sta. Maria, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya. Due to financial difficulty, she only finished a vocational course and is now doing her best to become a successful hog raiser.

Josie is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 as additional working capital for her business to enable it to grow. She utilizes her income in purchasing their daily needs and for feed supplies for her hogs. She hopes that someday, she will become a successful businesswoman as she believes that “Kung may tiyaga, may nilaga” meaning “Patience begets reward”.

loans.use: To use as business capital to expand her business

location.town: Sta. Maria Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Duong

texts.en:
The people shown in the picture are Mrs. Duong R., her husband, and their child, who live together in Siem Reap Province.

Duong R., 33, sells various kinds of vegetables in Psa Kroam Market, and earns approximately $3 profit a day. Besides her current work, she also raises a few pigs at her home.

She is married to Yin Yann, age 36, who shares responsibility for his family by driving a motor taxi. He runs his business very well because he has skills in communication which he uses with his customers. However, his income is not so much due to his motorcycle being too small to carry many passengers. That is why Duong R. has decided to ask for a loan of $1000 to buy a trailer to connect to the existing motorcycle so that her husband can use it to pick up more passengers than before.

loans.use: To buy a trailer to connect to her husband's existing motorcycle

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn has a hog-raising and poultry business. She is married to Floriano, who is a farmer. They live in a rural place located in Barangay Sta. Maria Dupax Del Norte of Nueva Vizcaya. Maribel hopes to give her children a better future  by doing her best in providing them with their basic needs and education.  According to Marilyn, her family is poor but they are doing their very best to rise from poverty. 

Aside from raising hogs, they also plant rice and vegetables as alternative sources of income.  She is requesting a loan of PHP6, 000 for her hog-raising and poultry business and hopes to generate a higher income.  She hopes to buy more piglets, and will also purchase grower feed for her hogs.  She strongly believes that someday somehow they will be successful in their business with the help and support of the microfinance institution ASKI, through the help of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Business Capital

location.town: Sta. Maria, Dupax Del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.en:
Guillermo Y. is from the city of San Simon, Cagayan de  Oro. He is 40 years old, is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Guillermo owns a farm; his main source of income is from planting & harvesting coconut and banana. Guillermo has been engaged in his business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Guillermo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation. Guillermo  repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI, which he used to expand the business. Guillermo is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will  also be used for additional capital.  He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of his children and provide for the needs of his family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To have additional capital for the business

location.town: San Simon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
“Poverty is not a hindrance to success” said Nenita.  She believes that determination to succeed does not require becoming rich first but requires hard work and patience.  

She is married to Pedro and blessed with two children: Rosita and Joniely. The eldest is a graduate of Education but chooses to work abroad while the youngest is a fresh graduate of the same course. Because of her desire to maintain her sari-sari store business, she now hopes to borrow PHP10, 000 as additional working capital.  She also sometimes assists her husband in farming, through labor and by financial assistance from her business income. She hopes to grow her business more for their future welfare.

loans.use: Business Capital

location.town: Sta. Maria, Dupax Del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
In the rural village of Sta. Maria (Dupax Del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya), Nimfa and Arben M. live happily with their four children.  All their children are in elementary school. Despite the hardships of life, they have a strong determination to send their children to college, because they want them to become successful someday. 
The couple works hard for their children so that they will able to give them a better future. Nimfa raises pigs while her husband tills their farm lot, where they usually plant rice and vegetables. Nimfa is requesting PHP10, 000 to sustain her hog-raising business. to buy their feed. She also hopes to buy at least 3 piglets to raise so that her business becomes big.

loans.use: Business Capital

location.town: Sta. Maria, Dupax Del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Jonayon

texts.en:
Jonayon D. is from the city of San  Simon, Cagayan de Oro. She is 25 years old, is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Jonayon owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. Her main source of income comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Jonayon is just starting this business.

In 2009, Jonayon joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation. Jonayon has repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI, which she used to purchase additional products to sell. Now she is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will also be used to expand her business. She plans to use the additional revenue to support he child's education. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: San Simon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Doung

texts.en:
Doung S., 47, is a widower and the father of three children. All three of them are still teenagers and attend school.

He has a job as a local barber and rents a small workshop, located in the market, to provide his service. Most of his clients are men who come to buy merchandise in the market. He normally generates an average of $5 profit a day and uses his income to meet all his children’s needs.

Doung S. has been renting the shop at an expensive rent for years. Right now, he wants to own a shop in the market but he hasn’t enough money to do so. Therefore, he has decided to look for a loan from Kiva to add to his savings in order to purchase a shop and some barbering tools.

loans.use: To purchase a shop and some barbering tools

loans.name: Kiria

texts.en:
Kiria lives within PMI Nkwen, Bamenda, in the northwest region. She is married: her husband’s name is Boba Malafa. They have six children, all under the age of 15. She intends to invest her loan in her roadside business of frying and selling puff-puff (fried dough) with beans. Specifically, she wishes to purchase one bag of beans, one bag of flour, and a tin of oil. She will also apply part of the loan toward her farming endeavors.

Kiria first heard about GHAPE in 2004, and this will be her fourth loan. She has repaid her previous loans satisfactorily. This loan will help her improve on her puff-puff business because she will have enough capital to expand on her business. She is convinced that her business will succeed because of her considerable experience in this work. Her business helps her community because she provides affordable food for people.

Kiria feels that her loans through GHAPE have benefited her because the method of repayment is comfortable and convenient, and because GHAPE provides training as well as proper follow-up after the loan is disbursed to ensure that the loan is properly managed.

About GHAPE

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her roadside puff-puff business, and to apply toward her farming work

loans.name: Atanga Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda is married with eight children, two of whom are below 15 years old. She lives at Mile 3 Nkwen, Bamenda, North West Province. Emelda plans to invest her loan in pig rearing and crop farming of crops. She will increase her pig style, buy more piglets, feed, and farm inputs.

This is Emelda’s fifth loan from GHAPE. She became a member in 2004 and since then her repayments have been satisfactory. This loan will help her expand her pig rearing business and cultivate a large portion of land for greater yields. She is convinced this business will succeed because she has experience in the business and it will help her community by providing food stuff.

She plans to use the profit from the loan to pay school fees for her children, cloth them, give them good medical attention, and even feed the family. She also intends to diversify her activities with a provision store in her house.

Emelda prefers to receive a loan from GHAPE because the method of repayment is comfortable and convenient, GHAPE offers training, and there is proper follow-up when the loan is disbursed to ensure it is properly managed.

About GHAPE

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy piglets, cement for a fence, pig feed, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Namen

texts.en:
G. is single with four children, two of who are under 15 years of age. She is living at Government Teachers training college (GTTC) street Nkwen Bamenda, North West Province. G. plans to invest her loan in two bags of groundnuts (peanuts), beans, corn, gari, and transportation. She will sell her food out to her community.

This is G.’s fourth loan from GHAPE. She came to know of GHAPE in 2004 and since then her repayments have been satisfactory. This loan will help her improve her business because she will have enough capital to expand. She is convinced this business will succeed because she is has experience. This business will help her community by providing food stuff.

She plans to use the profit from the loan to pay for her children's school fees, clothe them, give them good medical attention, and feed the family well.

G. prefers to receive loans from GHAPE because the method of repayment is comfortable and convenient, GHAPE offers training, and there is proper follow-up when the loan is disbursed to ensure it is properly managed.

loans.use: To buy beans, groundnuts (peanuts), corn, and gari and to pay for transport.

loans.name: Keb's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Keb C. is a borrower who has been chosen to be group leader by the other members of the loan group. Keb C. is 54 years old and a good father of three children. All three of his children are single and in school. He is married to Toun Pheap, who is 40 years old and sells a type of dessert in the village. Keb C. owns a motorbike and uses it to provide a taxi service around his community. He will be using this loan, along with his personal savings, to buy a new motorbike to replace his old one that is not attractive.

The other borrowers are jointly taking this loan. Mrs. S. is asking for a loan to increase his quantity of used clothing to sell. Mr. S. will use the loan to replace his old motor. Mrs. C. is a staff member at a restaurant and seeks a loan to buy a motorbike for riding to work.

loans.use: To replace an old motorbike.

loans.name: Kurbonbibi

texts.ru: Курбонбиби Эргашева более 15 лет занимается животноводством. Замужем, имеет 5 детей. Дети тоже работают и помогают своим родителям. Курбонбиби проживает в районе Турсунзаде. Возраст 56 лет. Клиентка просит у нас кредит, чтобы приобрести корову.
texts.en:
Kurbonbibi E. has been raising livestock for over 15 years. She is married and has five children. The children also work and help their parents. Kurbonbibi lives in the Tursunzoda district. She is 56 years old. This client is requesting a loan for purchase of a cow.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a cow

loans.name: Fru

texts.en:
Born in 1959, J. is married and has three children. All of his children are above the age of 15. He lives at Alamandom, Bamenda, North West Province. J. plans to invest his loan in pig and goat rearing and crop farming. He will buy three piglets and one young goat, three bags of feed seeds, and pay for labor to clear and till his farm.

This is J.’s seventh loan from GHAPE. He became a member of GHAPE on 5th September, 1999. Since then, he has benefited a lot and his repayments have been prompt. This loan will help him expand his pig and goat rearing business and will cultivate a large portion of land with good seeds for greater yields. He is convinced this business will succeed because he is experienced. This business will help his community by providing manure and food stuff.

He plans to use the profit from the loan to pay school fees for his children, cloth them, and give them good medical attention. He also intends to assist his late brother's children and build a house with part of the profit.

J. prefer to receive loans from GHAPE because the method of repayment is comfortable and convenient, GHAPE offers training, and there is proper follow-up when the loan is disbursed to ensure it is properly managed.

About GHAPE

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy three piglets, a goat, animal feed, and and pay for labor to clear and till the farm.

loans.name: Guloglan

texts.en:
A livestock breeder for 18 years, Guloglan M. is 43. He is married and responsible for four people including his wife and three children.

Very dynamic, serious, and entrepreneurial, he is proposing to expand his flock by purchasing more cattle. This will enable him to meet the needs of a rather large clientele from his village and its neighborhood.

With this goal in mind, Guloglan is requesting a loan that will serve him as business capital. The profit he will make from this business will allow him to improve the living conditions for his household and also make some investments.

loans.use: To purchase three baby calves

loans.name: Bay's Group

texts.en:
Bảy Thị Nguyễn was born in 1960. (no: 010102090013). She and her husband are farmers. They raise geese, groose and grow vegetables. There are four people in her family. Two of her sons are workers. They have a monthly income of about 4.000.000 VND. She wants to borrow 5.450.000 VND to buy food for domestic animals. There are three other Fund participants in her group. 
 Loan Thị Đỗ was born in 1973. (no: 010102090012). She lives with her husband and two children. Her loan  size is  4142 000 VND. She will use this loan to buy food for poultry and fish. 
 Bé Thị Nguyễn was 1961. (no: 010102090028). She is a worker. She wants to borrow 3.706.000 VND to repair her house.

loans.use: To buy food for domestic animals

loans.name: Eldar

texts.en:
Eldar B. is a hard-working farmer because he knows that the only way he can support and provide for his loved-ones is through hard work and dedication. Consequently, he leaves home every day at dawn to work on his farm and to look after his cattle. Eldar is married and has three children who are meaning of his life.

Eldar wishes to expand his business by purchasing young cattle and fodder for them. That is the reason that he is asking for a loan. Eldar will always cherish the memory of all those who gave him a helping hand when he needed it by granting him his request.

loans.use: Purchase two calves and fodder

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en: Zarina O. is 41 years old. She is married with three children. Zarina is a devoted mother who struggles day after day to provide the best for her family. Fifteen years ago, she got the idea to start raising cattle to contribute to the family finances, taking advantage of the space she had available in her house for this business. Her son and husband help her with the business. With an endless list of requests, she has finally decided to increase the number of animals she keeps and for this reason, she is requesting a loan of 1200USD.

loans.use: To purchase two calves and fodder

loans.name: Thoa

texts.en: Thoa C. Thị was born in 1958. ( no: 010102090031). Her main job is farming. She raises pigs and sells vegetables in the market. She lives with her son. Her son is a worker. She has a monthly income of about 2.500.000 VND. She wants to borrow 1.972.000 VND to buy food for her pigs.

loans.use: To buy food for her pigs

loans.name: Abdulmumin

texts.ru: Эргашев Абдумумин проживает в районе Турсунзаде. Возраст 36 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Абдумумин более 10 лет занимется животноводством т.е. откормом и перепродажей скота. Ему по бизнесу помогают дети. Клиент просит кредит, чтобы купить скотину.
texts.en:
Abdulmumin E. lives in the Tursun-zoda district. He is 36 years old, married, and has three children. Abdumumin has raised livestock for over 10 years, specifically he feeds and resells animals. His children help with the business. This client is requesting a loan to use to purchase animals.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock purchase

loans.name: Hoa's Group

texts.en:
Hoa T. K. N. was born in 1964. (no: 010102140024). She has four children who are going to school. Her husband sells fish in the market. She raises geese and grows rice. She is a group leader. They have a monthly income of about 3.000.000 VND. She wants to borrow 6.322.000 VND to buy fish and food for her geese. There are four other Fund participants in her group. 
 Hoa T. B. was born in 1981. (no: 010102140041). She needs 2.398.000 VND to breed pigs and poultry.
 Nam T. D. was born in 1961. (no: 010102140039). She needs 4.578.000 VND to buy scrap iron.
 Khien T. N. was born in 1960. (no: 010102140040). She wants to borrow 4.578.000 VND to buy fish and food for pigs.
 Nam V. C. was born in 1972. (no: 010102140037). He wants to borrow 4.578.000 VND to buy food for pigs and to buy scrap- ion.

loans.use: To buy fish and food for pigs

loans.name: Sok's Group
loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment

loans.name: Khanh's Group

texts.en:
Khanh Thị Hoàng was born in 1975.( no: 010102090016). She has a bazaar at home. There are 4 other people in her family: her father in- law, her husband, and 2 children. Her husband is a worker.  She has a monthly income of about 3.500.000 VND. She wants to borrow 1.972.000 VND (or 110 USD ) to invest in her bazaar. There are 2 other Fund participants in her group . 
Ngát Thị Nguyễn  was born in 1982. ( no: 010102090015). She sells fish in the market. She has 2 children, one goes to school. She wants to borrow 3.132.000 VND (or 175 USD) to invest in her small business.
Hải Thị Nguyễn was born in 1976. ( no: 010102090019).  She sells fish in the market. She has 2 children. She needs 2.204.000 VND (or 125 USD) to buy fish to sell.

loans.use: to invest in her bazaar

loans.name: Abdurahmon

texts.ru: Абдурахмон Эргашев проживает в районе Турсунзаде. Возраст 35 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Клиент просит кредит, чтобы купить скотину для откорма и продажи. Этим видом бизнеса занимается более 10 лет. В этом ему помогают его дети.
texts.en:
Abdurahmon E. lives in the Tursun-zoda region. He is 35 years old, is married and has 4 children. The client is asking for a loan to purchase livestock to fatten and sell. He has been in this business for more than 10 years. His children help him.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: Shukufa

texts.en:
Shukufa Q. is from Agsu city, Azerbaijan. For the last 20 years she and her husband have been dedicated to her sheep breeding  business, a popular enterprise that is characteristic of the region. She is the mother of five children who she cares for and has the responsibility of educating.

It’s important to note that Shukufa is very conscious of her duty to support her family financially. It’s for this reason that she turned to AqorInvest Credit Union to obtain a loan to purchase some sheep to help her increase their income. With your help, Shukufa will be able to make her business succeed and support her family.

loans.use: purchase 10 sheep and fodder

loans.name: Novruz

texts.en:
Novruz M. is 24 years old. He is married and has one adorable daughter. After getting married, he arduously dedicated himself to sheep breeding. When he recognized the need to invest in his work, Novruz decided to construct a place to start an animal breeding business. He started with only two sheep, but now he has 10 sheep.
Now, Novruz wants to expand his business and to buy 10 more sheep and fodder. Your support will really help Novruz and his family to get ahead.

loans.use: purchase 10 sheep and fodder

loans.name: Agadadash

texts.en: Agadadash T. has been dedicated to cattle farming for the past three years, and has vast experience in the field, as it is the only business he is in. He is married and waiting for a baby. His wife is also engaged in his business. This work is satisfying, and it enables Agadadash to purchase goods for his home. He provides the markets with meat and his family with the necessary food. Agadadash wants to buy more cattle, so he decided to apply for a loan of 1200 USD. He is counting on your help and expresses his gratitude for your generous heart.

loans.use: purchase three baby calves

loans.name: Gaibullo

texts.en:
Gaibullo I. is young and full of energy. He tries every single day to make the life of his family better. Gaibullo started his business 3 years ago. He continued the business of his father, who is a pensioner. Gaibullo has great experience in cattle breeding because he observed it from his childhood. Gaibullo would like to expand his business and purchase more calves. This will help him to increase income and improve life conditions. We wish him good luck and appreciate your help!  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing  cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
P. Halima is a hardworking and responsible woman. Twenty years ago she decided to start her own business to provide for her family. Ever since, she has been selling Tajik national dresses for women. This activity has also permitted her to make time available to be with her children. To increase her sales, Halima requests a loan of $700 to buy merchandise that is on sale, which she will then sell at a special price to her customers. This will allow her to grow her customer base. You can be an important enabler of Halima's accomplishments. She needs your help to grow her business and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: Purchasing Tajik national dresses for women in order to increase her range of goods

loans.name: Thơm's Group

texts.en:
Thơm Thị H. (no. 010102040002) was born in 1946. She has one daughter. Her main job is farming – she grows vegetables and sells them in the market. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 VND. She works very hard, and everybody in her village loves her. She needs 4,142,000 VND to trade in vegetables.

Thơm Thị H. is the group leader. There are three other fund participants in her group. Thoa Thị H. (no. 010102040005) was born in 1956. She wants to borrow 4,578,000 VND to buy meat to make pork pies. Thảo Thị Nguyễn (no. 010102040003) was born in 1962. She needs 4,578,000 VND to buy building materials to resell. Vân Thị H. (no. 010102040004) was born in 1958. She wants to borrow 4,578,000 VND to buy vegetables to sell in the market.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables to sell

loans.name: Asyaxanım

texts.en: Asyaxanım Y. and her husband regard education as the most important inheritance they can give their four dear children. They are both very responsible parents, and work hard in farming so that they can give their children the opportunity to finish school – an opportunity they never had due to poor finances. Asyaxanım is a happy mother who has been working in agriculture since getting married. With the unconditional support of her husband and elder son, she buys and sells cattle in order to cover the family’s most urgent needs. She now finds herself with more expenses, and she would like a loan in order to enlarge their capital by increasing the number of cattle they own. Asyaxanım and her family are awaiting your support.

loans.use: To purchase three baby calves

loans.name: Mukaram

texts.en:
T. Mukaram is a married mother of two children. She sells women’s clothing in the central market of Istaravshan, and has been in this business for ten years. She has a wide variety of merchandise, which she sells at reasonable prices. Mukaram is trying to do everything she can to provide for her family and give her children a decent education. That is why she wants to continue expanding her business by increasing the number of her vending locations. Mukaram is requesting a loan of 2500 TJS to sustain her business and ensure it continues to provide enough income on which to live. More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.
