loans.use: To purchase goods in order to increase stock

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.en:
N. Shuhrat is 37 years old. He is married with 4 children. Shuhrat is dedicated to his agricultural business. Having little knowledge in the beginning, he had to learn a lot about farming. As of now, he has acquired fair experience in agriculture. Currently, Shuhrat is very happy and his 4 children are the motivation for his desire to grow his business. He approached IMON International to obtain a loan to buy more ingredients, including seeds and fertilizer to sow a good harvest to help him take care of his children and home.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Dakan (Le Destin) Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du  groupe Dakan sont au nombre de sept toutes mariées et monogames, vivant dans le quartier Angoulême de la ville de Ségou (4ème  Région administrative de la république  du Mali) avec en moyenne 42 ans et 6 enfants. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de mariage, de voisinage, de leurs activités commerciales et d’appartenance à une même association traditionnelle. Elles  font comme activités l’achat et la vente d’articles divers, du riz, du charbon  de bois, du bois de chauffe, la fabrication des boissons non alcoolisées, la préparation de beignets, etc. 
Afin d’augmenter le volume de leurs activités génératrices de revenus, elles se sont organisées pour adhérer au programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire. Les cinq prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
 Ce nouveau  sera utilisé pour acheter, 4 sacs de riz, 2 sacs de haricot (qui seront transformés en beignets avant la vente), 660 noix de coco, un sac de sucre, un  panier d’oseille de Guinée, 40 kg de gingembre, un panier de tamarin, un carton d’essences, un rouleau d’emballage de sachets plastiques pour emballage.
Elles se ravitaillent à la foire hebdomadaire du grand marché de Ségou en ces matières premières et effectuent toutes leurs ventes en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à domicile, en ambulant dans les quartiers et dans les écoles fondamentales à une clientèle composée d’hommes, de femmes et d’enfants. 
Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 36.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et la participation aux évènements sociaux (mariage, baptême et décès). 
Elles ont pour ambition de devenir grossistes à travers le partenariat qu’elles entretiennent avec Soro Yiriwaso.
Albertine C. était lors de la prise de la photo au chevet de son enfant mortellement blessé par des bandits. Finalement nous venons d’apprendre que l’enfant vient de décéder.
texts.en:
The women of the group Dakan are seven in number and are all married, monogamous, and living in the Angoulême district of Ségou City (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The group members have an average age of 42 and six children. They know one another through ties of marriage, community, and membership in the same traditional association. Their businesses involve buying and selling various goods, rice, charcoal, and firewood, and they make soft drinks, beignets, etc. To increase the volume of their income-generating businesses, they became organized in order to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. They are now on their sixth solidarity loan. The five preceding loans have been correctly repaid. This new loan will be used to buy four sacks of rice, two sacks of beans (which will be made into beignets and then sold), 660 coconuts, a sack of sugar, a basket of dried hibiscus flowers, 40 kg of ginger, a basket of tamarind, a box of flavorings, and a roll of plastic bags for packaging purposes. Supplies of these essential items are gotten at the weekly fair of the grand marketplace of Ségou. Sales are made at the retail level, cash or credit accepted, at the house, by going door-to-door in the area, and at primary schools. Their customers are composed of men, women, and children. The group members each hope to realize an average monthly profit of 36,000 francs CFA that will be used to repay the loan and to assist with societal events (marriages, baptisms, and funerals). Their ambition is to become wholesalers through the partnership they maintain with Soro Yiriwaso. At the time this photo was taken, Albertine C. was at the bedside of her child, who was mortally wounded by bandits. We just learned that the child ultimately died.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Jamaladdin

texts.en: Jamaladdin F. is 42 and married with three children. He sells confections, such as candies, cookies, pastries, and fruit jelly. In business for eight years, Jamaladdin sells the goods from the market in the small village of Agsu city. The generated income allows him to support his family, for whom he is the sole income earner. Today he is requesting 1200 USD to increase the range of goods he carries. Jamaladdin thanks all for their support and promises to repay the loan in time.

loans.use: purchase more goods for store

loans.name: Sojida

texts.ru: Сафарова Сочида более  лет занимается пошивкой одежды. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 6 лет. Замужем, детей не имеет. Проживает в районе Турсунзаде. Возраст 28 лет. Клиентка просит у нас кредит, чтобы купить швейную машинку и производить другой вид одежды.
texts.en:
Sojida S. sews clothing. She has been in this business for more than 6 years. She is married and does not have children. She lives in the Tursun-zoda region. She is 28 years old. The client is asking us for credit in order to purchase a sewing machine and to produce a different type of clothing.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sewing machine

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Danaya est composé de 2 polygames, 2 monogames et d’une veuve  soit au total 5 femmes  vivant toutes dans le quartier Angoulême de Ségou (4ème  Région administrative du Mali) et ayant  en moyenne 46 ans et 6 enfants. 
Elles se sont connues à travers de liens de voisinage, de leurs activités commerciales et d’appartenance à une même association traditionnelle d’entraide.
Elles  font le commerce d’articles divers avec la vente de pagnes wax,  du bois de chauffe, de savons, la préparation et vente des boissons locales et de l’encens. 
Dans le souci de pérenniser leurs activités génératrices de revenus, elles ont décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 7ème  prêt solidaire. Tous les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
Ce nouveau prêt  sera utilisé pour acheter : 6 pièces de pagnes wax, 13 cartons de savons, 50 kg de n’guéni, 3 kg de magnonkissèni, 10 flacons d’eau de Cologne et parfums, 1 sac de sucre, 1 panier d’oseille de Guinée, 40 kg de gingembre, 1 panier de tamarin, 1 carton d’essences, 1 paquet de sachets en plastique pour emballage. Elles se ravitaillent à la foire hebdomadaire du grand marché de Ségou en ces matières premières et revendent toutes leurs marchandises au comptant, en détail et à crédit  à domicile, en ambulant dans les quartiers, dans les foires hebdomadaires de Konodimini, de Zambougou et dans les villages de N’Gara et de Banankoroni à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elles espèrent  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et augmenter le volume de leurs activités. 
Elles  ambitionnent acheter d’autres congélateurs et devenir grossistes dans les activités qu’elles mènent.
texts.en:
The group Danaya is composed of two polygamous women, two monogamous women, and a widow, thus a total of five women living in the Angoulême district of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They have an average age of 42 and six children. The group members know one another through ties of marriage, community, commercial businesses, and membership in the same traditional mutual-aid association. Their businesses include commerce in various goods with the sale of Wax pagnes (colorful West African cloth), firewood, and soaps. And they make and sell local beverages and incense. Concerned about perpetuating their income-generating businesses, they became organized in order to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. They are now on their seventh solidarity loan. All the previous loans have been correctly repaid. This new loan will be used to buy: six bolts of Wax pagnes, thirteen boxes of soap, 50 kg of n’guéni (seeds of a wild plant), 3 kg of magnonkissèni (seeds of another wild plant), ten bottles of eau de cologne and perfumes, a sack of sugar, a basket of dried hibiscus flowers, 40 kg of ginger, a basket of tamarind, a box of flavorings, and a packet of plastic bags for packaging. Supplies of these essential items are gotten at the weekly fair of the grand marketplace of Ségou. Sales of their merchandise are all made at the retail level, cash or credit accepted, at the weekly fairs of Konodimini and Zambougou and in the villages of N’Gara and Banankoroni. Their customers are composed of men and women. The group members hope to realize an average monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA that will be used to repay the loan and to increase their business volume. Their ambition is to buy more freezers and to become wholesalers in the businesses they operate.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth, soap, and ingredients for making incense and juice drinks

loans.name: Doh Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is married to two wives and has seven children. His greatest wish is to see his children become responsible citizens in the future, so he toils relentlessly to make this wish a reality. He joined GHAPE in 2007 and received his first loan of 40,000FCFA ($40) which he invested in pig farming. Realizing that pig farming is a lucrative business, there is need for expansion.

If given this new loan, Patrick plans to expand his pig farm by buying four piglets, pig feed and materials to repair the pig house. The profit he gets from the loan will be used to educate his children and repair his house.  

About GHAPE
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.

loans.use: Four Piglets and Materials for Pig Sty Repairs

loans.name: Tièssiri Ton Group

texts.fr:
Les six  femmes du  groupe Tièssiri Ton  sont mariées majoritairement dans des familles polygamiques avec en moyenne 43 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Banankoro - Ségou (4ème  Région administrative de la république du Mali) et se sont connues à travers de liens de mariage, de voisinage, d’amitié et professionnel.
Elles font diverses activités qui sont entre autres les ventes de poissons, des fruits et légumes, des céréales, de l’encens, des tubercules, du thé vert  etc. 
En vu d’augmenter leur fonds de commerce elles se sont organisées pour intégrer le programme crédit  de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont  à leur 2ème prêt solidaire après avoir correctement remboursé le premier.
Ce prêt sera utilisé pour acheter, un sac de haricot, un chargement de charrette en mangues, 3 sacs de patate douce, un carton de thé, l’encens et 80 kg de poisson qui seront frits d’abord avant la vente. Elles se ravitaillent en poisson au bord du fleuve dans le village et quant aux autres produits à la foire hebdomadaire du village. Elles revendent toutes leurs marchandises au comptant, en détail et à crédit  à domicile, en ambulant et dans la foire hebdomadaire du village à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles envisagent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 37.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et comme épargne.
texts.en:
The six women of the group Tièssiri Ton are all married, live in polygamous families for the most part, and have an average age of 43 and four children. The group members all live in the village of Banankoro - Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali), and they know one another through ties of marriage, community, friendship, and profession. Their businesses include selling fish, fruit, vegetables, grains, incense, tubers, green tea, etc. With the aim of augmenting their working capital, the group members became organized in order to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. They are now on their second after having correctly repaid the first one. The current loan will be used to buy: a sack of beans, a cart-load of mangoes, three sacks of sweet potatoes, a box of tea, incense, and 80 kg of fish, which will first be fried and then sold. Supplies of fish are gotten at the riverbank in the village. As for the other goods, these are gotten at the village’s weekly fair. Sales of their merchandise are all made at the retail level, cash or credit accepted, at the house, by going door-to-door, and at the village’s weekly fair. Their customers are composed of men and women. The group members envision realizing an average monthly profit of 37,000 francs CFA that will be used to repay the loan and to be put into savings.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru: Отабаева Мавлюда проживает в районе Турсунзаде. Возраст 30 лет. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Муж находится в России на заработках. Мавлюда более 6 лет занимается пошивкой одежды. Ей в этом помогают две дочки. Клиентка просит у нас кредит, чтобы купить семена и удобрения для посева. Погашать будет за счет своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Mavluda O. lives in the Tursun-Zoda region of Tajikistan. She is 30 years old, married and has 4 children. Her husband is away, working in Russia. Mavluda has been sewing clothes for the last six years. Her two daughters help her in this business. Mavluda is planning to use the loan money to buy seeds and fertilizer for her fields. She will be paying back the loan using profits from her sewing business.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Agwe Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah is married and has six children. Unable to meet the demands of his family, he sought assistance from GHAPE in the form of business capital when he became a member and received his first loan of 40,000FCFA ($80) in the year 2007. He invested this money in the rearing of pigs and fowl. Given the high demand for pigs and fowl in his community, there is need for expansion.

With this new loan, Jeremiah plans to buy 50 day-old chickens, feeders, animal feed, and medication, and repair his pigsty. Jeremiah has been in this business of pig- and fowl-rearing for a long time but has never had the opportunity to produce on a large scale because of limited resources. The profit he gets from this loan shall be used to increase the standard of living of his family and help pay for his children’s education.

About GHAPE
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.

loans.use: Day-Old Chickens, Animal Feed, Vaccinations and Pig Sty Repairs

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Benkadi 1  (L’Entente Est Bonne). Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi 1 est un regroupement de femmes mariées du village de Sirakélé de la ville de Koutiala (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec  en moyenne 35 ans et au moins  5 enfants.
Elles   se sont spécialisées uniquement  dans la culture l’arachide.
Dans le souci de rentabiliser ces exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe Benkadi 1 ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant cinq ans. Après avoir correctement remboursés  les quatre   prêts précédents, elles sont à leur cinquième  prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter, de la semence d’arachide et  des intrants, exclusivement  au grand marché de Koutiala. Elles effectuent leurs ventes au moment où les produits ont de la valeur  au grand marché de Koutiala et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant à une clientèle diverse et variée.
Les membres du groupe Benkadi 1 comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 50 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Benkadi 1 ("understanding is good") group is made up of married women from the village of Sirakélé, town of Koutiala (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in big traditional extended families and have an average age of 35 and at least 5 children. They are specialized completely in the cultivation of peanuts.

In the hope of making their agricultural businesses profitable, the members of the Benkadi 1 group decided to join the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso 5 years ago. After having correctly reimbursed the four preceding loans, they are on their 5th rural loan.

This loan will be used to buy peanut seeds and intrants, exclusively in the big open-air market of Koutiala. They sell their crops at the moment when they are valuable at the big open-air market of Koutiala and in the surrounding markets, retail (often wholesale), for cash, to a diverse and varied clientele.

The members of the Benkadi 1 group each expect to make, after the sale of their crops, a profit of 50,000 F CFA which will be used to reimburse the loan and for current family expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of intrants and seeds

loans.name: Pardohol

texts.ru: Пардохол Умарова проживает в районе Турсунзаде. Возраст 39 лет. Замужем, детей не имеет. Муж работает на заводе. Пардохол более 10 лет занимается торговлей. Она торгует сухофруктами. Клиентка просит унас кредит, чтобы увеличить товараоборот.
texts.en:
Pardohol U. lives in the Tursun-Zoda region. She is 39 years old, married and has no children. Her husband works at the local factory. Pardohol has been selling dried fruits at the market for the last 10 years. She is planning to use the loan to expand her inventory of fruit.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding inventory to increase profits

loans.name: Benkadi  2 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi 2 est un regroupement de femmes mariées du village de Sirakélé de la ville de Koutiala région de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec  en moyenne 35 ans et au moins  5 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes de Benkadi 2  a opté uniquement pour la culture  de l’arachide.
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, elles  ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant cinq ans. Après avoir correctement remboursés  les quatre prêts précédents, elles sont à leur cinquième  prêt de campagne.
Elles comptent utiliser ce nouveau prêt pour acheter, des semences d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture, exclusivement  au grand marché de Koutiala. Elles effectuent leurs ventes quant l’arachide aurait de la valeur, à une clientèle composée de revendeurs, de ménagères et  d’autres consommateurs.
Les membres du groupe Benkadi 2 comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 65 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du  prêt de Soro Yiriwaso  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Benkadi 2 group is made up of married women from the village of Sirakélé, town of Koutiala (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in big traditional extended families and have an average age of 35 and at least 5 children. This group of Benkadi 2 women have chosen to specialize completely in the cultivation of peanuts. In the hope of making their agricultural businesses profitable, they decided to join the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso 5 years ago. After having correctly reimbursed the four preceding loans, they are on their 5th rural loan. They intend to use this new loan to buy peanut seeds, minor agricultural material, and intrants for their crops, exclusively in the big open-air market of Koutiala. They sell their crops at the moment when they are valuable to a clientele composed of middlemen, housewives, and other consumers.

The members of the Benkadi 2 group each expect to make, after the sale of their crops, a profit of 65,000 F CFA which will be used to reimburse the interest on the Soro Yiriwaso loan and for current family expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of intrants, seeds, and minor agricultural materials

loans.name: Benkadi 4 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi 4 est un regroupement de femmes mariées du village de Sirakélé de la ville de Koutiala  région de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs enfants, maris, beaux parents, belles sœurs  etc. Elles ont en moyenne 40 ans et au moins  5 enfants.
Elles cultivent uniquement  de l’arachide.
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe Benkadi 4 ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant cinq ans. Après avoir correctement remboursés  les quatre   prêts précédents, elles sont à leur cinquième  prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter, des semences d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture, au grand marché de Koutiala. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Koutiala et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe Benkadi 4 comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 65 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du  prêt de Soro Yiriwaso  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Benkadi 4 group brings together married women of the village of Sirakélé, town of Koutiala, region of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in big traditional extended families with their children, husbands, parents-in-law, sisters-in-law, etc. They are 40 on average and have at least 5 children. They plant only peanuts.

In the interest of making their agricultural businesses profitable, the members of the Benkadi 4 group decided to join the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso five years ago. After having correctly reimbursed the four preceding loans, they are on their fifth rural loan.

This loan will be used to buy peanut seeds, small agricultural materials, and intrants for this crop in the big open-air market of Koutiala. After the rainy season, the harvest is stockpiled for a certain time until it gains value before being sold at the big marketplace of Koutiala and in surrounding markets, retail (often wholesale) and for cash, to a clientele mostly coming from the big cities.

Each of the members of the Benkadi 4 group expect to make, after their crops have been sold, a profit of 65,000 F CFA which will be used to reimburse the interest on the Soro Yiriwaso loan and for current family expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of intrants, seeds, and minor agricultural materials

loans.name: Naimjon

texts.en:
Naimjon is 32 years old and lives with his wife and three kids. From a young age, he demonstrated a talent for agriculture. Naimjon has always tried to be very responsible and very content with his farm work. When he finishes caring for his crops, he goes to help his father, because he wants to repay his father’s efforts. What his father likes best out of the whole agricultural process is the marketing, because he always hopes to get a good price for his crops. But once he gets to the market, he gets a little clumsy and sometimes loses track of the accounting. Naimjon always tries to help him out with some pointers. The loan Naimjon now is asking for is to purchase seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants for his varied crops. The loan will greatly improve Naimjon’s income and his family's living standards.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds, mineral fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Agasef

texts.en:
Agasef F. is a married father with three children. Agasef has been a farmer for the last 18 years. Farming is a passion for him. He practices both dairy farming and mixed-crop farming. He says he has chosen farming as a career because the produce from his farm has a ready market. His challenge at the moment is that he is not fully utilizing his land; this is because he used up all his proceeds from the last harvest to pay his children's school fees and was not able to buy the seeds and fertilizers needed to plant all his land. 

Agasef is requesting a loan of 1200 USD to be able to purchase the resources needed to plough the whole farm for the next planting season. He will purchase assorted fertilizer stock and seeds.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer stock and seeds

loans.name: Habib

texts.en:
Habib is a 45-year-old married man with four children. He has been a farmer and vegetable grower for 12 years. Farming is the only thing Habib knows how to do and it is what he likes most. For him, there is nothing better than being in touch with nature and watching the crops of his labor grow year after year. In addition, Habib raises cattle and his family helps him with this business. Now Habib wants to borrow money to purchase seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants in order to grow seasonal vegetables. This is Habib's first loan from Kiva partner, IMON International, and he promises to repay the current loan without any violations. He thanks all Kiva lenders for their support.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seed, mineral fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Zikrillo

texts.en:
Zikrillo, 37, has been married since the age of 24 to the mother of his four children. Zikrillo has worked in agriculture since he was a young, his father having taught him how to responsibly work with each crop, and now, with the help of his wife and adult children, he derives a sense of dignity from his work. As a consequence, he treats each plant with affection and care until they are ready for harvest, at which point he takes them to sell in the market.

Zikrillo would very much like to buy a house in the city to ensure the well-being and tranquility of his children, and in this way improve their quality of life. The money that he is soliciting is for the purchase of seeds, chemical fertilizers, fuels and lubricants. Let’s support this hard-working and talented man so that he can obtain his goals!

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes: its role as a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment, forcing hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

loans.use: Purchasing of seeds, mineral fertilizer, fuels and lubricants.

loans.name: Klichboy

texts.en:
T. Klichboy is a 42-year-old married man who lives with his wife and four children. He has been a farmer for the past five years. He began farming with the goal of supporting his household and, above all, to satisfy the needs of his children. Klichboy enjoys working in agriculture and, in particular, he likes vegetable production as it is easy to cultivate vegetables and the product is profitable in season, which is annual. His earnings are greater when buyers purchase the crop in large quantities and come to harvest and take it away themselves allowing Klichboy to avoid the expense of transport costs. Now Klichboy wishes to borrow money to invest in seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants. Be an important part of the growth of Klichboy’s business. He is sincerely grateful to all Kiva lenders.

texts.en: Z. Zoir is a young married man with two children. Faced with high unemployment in his country, it proved very hard to find a job and he thus began to start his own business of selling teenagers’ clothes. Fortunately, he made good sales and his business is growing, thanks to the quality of his products and the good service he provides. Zoir now needs a $2000 loan which he will use to buy goods to respond to his customers’ demands. He is very thankful to you for helping him improve his service and the quality of life of his family. loans.use: To purchase new summer clothing

loans.name: Akuvi Dzidzo

texts.fr: Cette jeune femme exerçait comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de produits de première nécessité mais cette activité ne lui réussissait pas, elle s’est alors lancée dans le commerce de pagnes. cette nouvelle activité marche bien pour elle,sa clientèle est grandissante, elle veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 20 pagnes de qualité «HI Target » 10 pagnes « phoénix » et 5 pagnes « WAX »
texts.en:
This young woman had been selling staple goods but that business was not very successful, so she began to sell "pagnes" (lengths of brightly printed African cloth). This second business is going well; her clientele is growing and she wants to refurbish her stock, so she has come to WAGES to request her first loan to buy 20 "pagnes" (HI Target brand), 10 "pagnes" (Phoenix brand) and 5 "pagnes" (Wax brand).

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of "pagnes" for resale

loans.name: Ramiz

texts.en: Ramiz A. supports his parents with a small business selling men’s clothing and shoes. He operates from a little space at the central market in Agsu, Azerbaijan, where he maintains a nice variety of clothing from which to choose. Ramiz has been in business for 20 years. With good quality products and affordable prices, he has developed a solid customer base, and his business continues to grow. Ramiz has requested a loan to increase his working capital and allow him to purchase new inventory. This loan will help Ramiz to be prepared for the busy summer season so he can maximize his profits and provide for his family.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to enlarge the business

loans.name: Teko

texts.fr: Monsieur A. teko  exerce dans la vente de boissons, étant célibataire il a très tôt commencé ce commerce afin de pouvoir subvenir à ses besoins. Présentement le congélateur qu’il utilise est insuffisant pour refroidir toutes ses boissons, il sollicite de WAGES alors son premier crédit  pour acheter 1 congélateur.
texts.en:
Mr. A. Teko sells drinks. As a single man, he began this business early on so that he could support himself. Presently, the freezer that he uses is insufficient to cool all his drinks. He is requesting his first loan from WAGES to buy a freezer.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of a freezer

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Madame Adama T. est une femme mariée de 31 ans et mère de 2 enfants qui  vit avec son mari et ses enfants dans le quartier Torakabougou  de la ville de Bougouni.(troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Après les études secondaires, Madame Adama T. est restée très longtemps sans emploi. Elle  se lança dans les activités génératrices de revenus mais sans succès. Elle décida ainsi d’apprendre le commerce d’articles divers auprès de sa sœur jumelle. Par finir, elle se spécialisa dans la vente de pagnes wax  et  de mèches pour la coiffure. Avec une expérience de 7 ans Adama T. maîtrise cette activité et est très sollicitée.
Pour améliorer son activité en diversifiant ses articles, elle décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est à son premier prêt individuel.
Elle compte acheter des pagnes wax et des mèches de différentes sortes  à Lomé et à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) auprès des grossistes.  Ses marchandises sont vendues au comptant, en détail et à crédit  dans le quartier et dans les structures aux salariés de la place. Avec une clientèle essentiellement  constituée de femmes,  sa période propice de vente est surtout les fêtes religieuses et les événements sociaux.
Avec ce prêt, Madame Adama T. compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40 000 FCFA qui servira à agrandir son activité et ouvrir une boutique au grand marché de Bougouni.
texts.en:
Ms. Adama T. is a 31-year-old married woman and the mother of two children. She lives with her husband and children in the Torakabougou district of Bougouni City (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After secondary school, she remained without employment for a long time. She got started in income-generating work but unsuccessfully. She therefore decided to learn about commerce in various goods with the help of her twin sister. In the end, she became specialized in selling Wax pagnes (colorful West African cloth) and hair extensions for hairdressing. With seven years of experience, Adama has a command of this business and is in high demand. To improve her business through diversifying her merchandise, she decided to collaborate with avec Soro Yiriwaso and is now on her first individual loan. She intends to buy Wax pagnes and hair extensions of different sorts in Lomé and in Bamako (capital of Mali) from wholesalers. Her merchandise is sold retail, cash or credit accepted, in the area and in local organizations to salaried workers. She has a customer bases composed essentially of women, and her favorable instances for making sales are especially during religious holidays and societal events. With this loan, she intends to realize a monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA that will be used to expand her business and to open a shop at the grand marketplace of Bougouni.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth and hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To finish construction of her store.

loans.name: Djelika

texts.fr:
Madame Djelika B. est une femme mariée de 32 ans et mère de 3 enfants qui  vit avec son époux et ses enfants dans le quartier  Médine  de la ville de Bougouni.(troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elle a très tôt abandonné  l’école pour mener des activités génératrices de revenus et  finit par opter pour la restauration apprise auprès de sa mère. Avec 10 années d’expérience, Madame Djelika B. maîtrise bien la restauration. Elle a son restaurant est situé à la  gare routière de Bougouni.
Pour améliorer son restaurant elle décida de rejoindre Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est à son premier prêt individuel.
 Elle compte  acheter  tous les jours du poisson d’eau douce,  de l’huile alimentaire et de divers petits condiments alimentaires au grand marché de Bougouni et  de Yanfolila. Sa clientèle est composée de résidents mais aussi de routiers.
Avec ce prêt, Madame Djelika B. espèrent  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 35 000 FCFA qui lui permettra de d’améliorer son entreprise,  payer les intérêts du prêt et acheter un congélateur.
texts.en:
Ms. Djelika B. is a 32-year-old married women and the mother of three children. She lives with her husband and children in the Médine district of Bougouni City (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). She soon dropped out of school to earn an income and finally opted for the restaurant business, which she learned from her mother. With ten years of experience, Djelika has a good command of the business. She has a restaurant located at the Bougouni bus station. To improve her restaurant, she decided to join Soro Yiriwaso and is now on her first individual loan. She intends to buy freshwater fish each day, cooking oil, and sundry condiments at the grand marketplaces of Bougouni and Yanfolila. Her customers are composed of residents but also vehicle drivers. With this loan, she hopes to realize a monthly profit of 35,000 francs CFA that will enable her to improve her enterprise, to make loan interest payments, and to buy a freezer.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish and condiments

loans.name: Ayélé

texts.fr: Cette jeune femme est une célibataire qui travaille dur pour pouvoir subvenir à ses propres charges. L’activité génératrice de revenu qu’elle exerce est la vente d’œuf, elle a commencé ce commerce  seulement l’année dernière. Elle vend ses œufs aux restaurateurs. La demande actuelle de sa clientèle a augmenté, c’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 100 plateaux de 30 œufs.
texts.en:
This young woman is single and works hard to support herself. She sells eggs, a business she began just last year. She sells her eggs to food service providers. The demand of her clientele has increased and that is why she is asking WAGES for her first loan to buy 100 trays of 30 eggs each.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of eggs for resale

loans.name: Stanley

texts.fr:
Ce jeune célibataire pour pouvoir subvenir à ses besoins a eu la bonne idée d’entamer le commerce de mèches et de perruques. Cette  activité est très souvent exercée par les  femmes, il a une façon très attirante d’accueillir ses clients. Afin de réaliser une plus grosse marge bénéficiaire sur ses marchandises, il s’approvisionne au GHANA et au NIGERIA.
Il est en rupture de stock et veut  se réapprovisionner, il sollicite alors de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 40 cartons de mèches et 40 cartons de perruques.
texts.en:
This young, single gentleman, in order to support himself, had the good idea to begin selling hair extensions and wigs. This is mostly a business run by women, but he has a very attractive way of welcoming his customers. So that he can have a bigger profit margin on his merchandise, he buys his wares in Ghana and in Nigeria.

He is presently out of certain items and wants to replenish his inventory, so he is requesting his first loan from WAGES to buy 40 cases of hair extensions and 40 cartons of wigs.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of hair extensions and wigs for resale

loans.name: Đỗ Thị

texts.en:
K. Đỗ Thị (539081702) is a 49-year-old female living in the town of Ý Yên. She is married and has two adult children. To make a living, K. owns and operates an agricultural business raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising chickens for sale. K. has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 4,100,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2007, K. joined Kiva partner, TYM Fund, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. K. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business. K. is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. The loan will be her second from TYM Fund. K. plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling clothing and shoes in the local community. loans.name: Mapinduzi Group

texts.en:
Jumanne M., age 65, is married with three children, ages 28, 24, and 21. He has a "Genge" (Kiswahili for a stand selling fruits and vegetables) business which he started six years ago. He works daily from 5 am until 7:30 pm and is able to earn a monthly profit of around US$ 105.

This will be Jumanne’s 7th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to expand the business by buying more fruits and vegetables; he paid school fees and has paid back his loan successfully. He wants a new loan to further increase his stock in the "genge".

Jumanne will share this loan with his loan group, Mapinduzi, which totals 15 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Jumanne is the 1st on the right in the blue shirt.

loans.use: To increase his stock of fruit and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Julia

El crédito que solicita es para comprar una nevera y algunas mesas para darle un lugar mas profesional y agradable a su negocio.

Es cliente de Impro desde el año 2005 y pagó muy bien sus anteriores créditos, por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:

The loan that she is requesting will be used to purchase a freezer and some tables to make her business look more pleasant and professional.

She has been a member of Impro since 2005, and she has satisfactorily repaid her previous loans, which qualifies her for a new one.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase freezer and tables for small restaurant

Es cliente de Impro desde el año 2004 y pagó muy bien sus anteriores créditos, por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

The loan is to continue his studies in order to improve his income. He has been a client of Impro since 2004. He made his previous loan payments well, and he is qualified for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
El señor Javier vive en casa de sus padres en la calle A de la zona de LLojeta de la ciudad de La Paz; tiene un taller de mecánica en el camino a Viacha de la ciudad de El Alto donde trabaja como mecánico y con esta actividad  se mantiene ya que esta es  su único medio de ingresos. El crédito que solicita es para comprar una maquina soldadora para su negocio.

Esta es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo a través de Impro; el analisis de flujo de caja lo califica para obtener un crédito.
texts.en:
Javier lives in his parents’ house on the Calle A in the Llojeta zone in the city of La Paz. He has a merchanic’s shop on the road to Viacha in the city of El Alto. He works there as a mechanic. This work supports him as it is his only form of income. The loan is to buy soldering equipment for his business. This is the first time he has asked Impro for a loan. The analysis of his cash flow qualifies him for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soldering equipment for his mechanic's shop

loans.name: Lê Thị

In 2001, M. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. M. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000,000 dong from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. loans.name: Paola

texts.es:
La señora Paola vive en alquiler con su esposo en la calle Ángel Gómez de la zona de Alto san Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que ella realiza es la elaboración de cotillones, como ser piñatas, canastitas, sombreritos, etc. En esta actividad le ayuda el esposo y juntos generan sus ingresos para el hogar.

El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital, de manera que pueda comprar más materia prima (papel de colores, goma de pegar, cartón, etc.), elaborar mas productos para la venta y así obtener mejores ingresos.

Esta es la primera vez que acude a Impro para solicitar un préstamo y consideramos que, una vez analizado el flujo de caja y la evaluación social puede acceder a un crédito.
texts.en:
Paola lives in a rented house with her husband on Ángel Gómez Street in the Alto San Pedro zone in the city of La Paz. She makes gift bags, piñatas, baskets, hats, etc. Her husband helps her with this business. Together they generate income for their home. The loan is to buy raw materials (colored paper, glue, cardboard, etc.) to make more products to sell and obtain better income. This is the first time she has asked Impro for a loan. We think that once the cash flow is analyzed and the social evaluation is completed, she will qualify for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materiels, colored paper, glue, cardboard, etc. for making piñatas, hats, baskets, etc.

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

In 2001, T. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.

T. is now requesting a new loan of 10,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. The loan will be her 8th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

texts.es:

Esta es la primera vez que requiere de Impro para solicitar un préstamo y por el carácter social  y el análisis financiero puede acceder a un crédito.
texts.en:

The loan that he is requesting is to purchase a communication radio, tires, and to make sure that his vehicle is in good shape given that it is his only source of income. This is the first time that he has requested a loan from Impro, and because he has met the financial analysis criteria and is of good character he is able to request a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a communication radio, tires, and to pay for the cost of maintenance on his vehicle.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es:
El señor Ernesto T. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de San Pedro de ciudad de La Paz.
El señor Ernesto es empleado jubilado del sector comercial. 
Su vivienda se encuentra deteriorada por la antigüedad de la construcción y requiere reparaciones principalmente en las paredes interiores.
El crédito solicitado es para la refacción de los muros interiores de su vivienda.
Esta es la tercera vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Ernesto T. lives in his own house in the San Pedro zone in the city of La Paz. Ernesto is a retired worker from the commercial sector. His home is in poor conditions due to the old construction and requires repairs mainly in the interior walls. The loan that he is requesting to refurbish the interior walls of his home. This is the third time that he has requested a loan, and because he has favorably met the financial analysis criteria he has been approved for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay to refurbish the interior walls of his home.

loans.name: Salustio

texts.es:
El señor Salustio Pérez vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Las Lomas, área periférica de la ciudad de La Paz, con su hermano.
El señor Salustio trabaja como electricista, realizando instalaciones en viviendas particulares.
Con anteriores préstamos realizo la construcción de su vivienda en obra gruesa, la que ya tiene habilitado un dormitorio en el que actualmente vive.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de una sala, mas una cocina, en su vivienda.
Esta es la cuarta vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Salustio Pérez lives in his own home in the Las Lomas zone, an area adjacent to the city of La Paz with his brother. Salustio works as an electrician, carrying out installations in individual homes. With previous loans he had carried out mayor construction on his home and has built a room in which he currently lives. The loan that he is requesting is to start construction on a living room and a kitchen in his home. This is the fourth time that he has requested a loan and because he has favorably met the financial analysis criteria he has been approved for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To start construction on a living room and a kitchen in his home to be able to live more comfortably.

loans.name: Ever

texts.es:
El señor Ever M. G. vive en casa en alquiler, en la zona  de Llojeta, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz.
El señor Ever es constructor, realizando trabajos en construcciones particulares con los que se mantiene.
Sus ingresos no son muy buenos y el pago de alquileres mensuales hace que no pueda ahorrar. 
El crédito solicitado es para la adquisición de un anticretico de una habitación, que le permitirá pagar menos que el alquiler mensualmente y que al cabo de un año tenga ahorrado el monto del anticretico.
Esta es la primera vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Ever M. G. lives in a rented home in the Llojeta zone on the east hillside of the city of La Paz. Ever is a construction worker and supports himself by working on particular construction jobs. He does not earn a lot and his monthly rent payments make it so that he cannot save. The loan that he is requesting it to acquire a room on anticredito (a system by which the tenant pays a fixed sum considered a loan to the property owner which they receive back in full when the rental period is over); this will allow him to pay less than the monthly rent and after a year he will have saved the anticredito amount. This is the first time that he has made a loan request and because he has favorably met the financial analysis criteria he has been approved for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The loan will be used to acquire a room on anticredito, which will allow him to not have to pay rent and to be able to save.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
La señora Angélica García vive en casa propia, en la zona  de las Lomas, área periférica de la ciudad de La Paz, con sus dos hijas.
La señora Angélica es comerciante, vendiendo textos escolares en un puesto de venta ambulante.
Su vivienda, por la antigüedad de la construcción presenta fisuras en su patio, lo que ocasiona filtraciones de agua en los cimientos en época de lluvia.
El crédito solicitado es para el vaciado de carpeta de hormigón en el patio de su vivienda.
Esta es la novena vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Angélica García lives in her own house with her two daughters in the Llomas zone, an area adjacent to the city of La Paz. Angélica is a merchant; she sells schoolbooks as a street vendor. Her home, due to old construction, now has cracks in the patio, which causes water to filter to the foundation during the rainy season. The loan that she is requesting is to drain and excavate the layer of concrete that is damaged on the patio of her housing. This is her ninth loan request and because she has favorably met the financial analysis criteria she has been approved for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for the cost of purchasing cement and sand, plus the cost of labor to make the improvement to her house’s patio.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel H. C. es una joven de 20 años de edad. Vive con sus padres y un hermano, en una comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada Mollejones de Platanares, Pérez Zeledón. Mollejones es una comunidad ubicada a 150 kilómetros al sur de la Provincia de San José, la capital de Costa Rica. Se encuentra a 850 metros  sobre el nivel del mar. Ahí se cultivan hortalizas, café y además se desarrollan otras actividades como la crianza de ganado de engorde y de cerdos. Existen también algunos proyectos de agricultura orgánica y hortalizas en hidroponía. Además de la agricultura en la comunidad hay talleres mecánicos, un supermercado, pequeños restaurantes (sodas) y una mueblería.

Miguel trabaja en una constructora y además estudia en el colegio. Dice que ambos lugares están muy lejos de su casa y que se le dificulta la manera de llegar hasta ellos, ya que los caminos no están en muy buen estado y además hay muy poco transporte público. 

Por lo cual Miguel ha decidido comprar una moto para poder transportarse mejor y así agilizar  la forma en la que viaja y poder ahorrar y aprovechar más  el tiempo. Por lo tanto requiere un préstamo de ¢400.000 (cuatrocientos mil colones) para comprar la moto y así poder tener un vehículo propio que le permita seguir adelante  y facilitarle su modo de viajar.

Miguel forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Bancruce, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo pero Miguel  destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Miguel H. C. is a young 20-year-old man. He lives with his parent and a brother in a rural community in Costa Rica called Mollejones de Platanares, Pérez Zeledón. Mollejones is community located about 150km south of the Province of San José, the capital of Costa Rica; it’s 850 meters above sea level. There they cultivate vegetables, and coffee, and also carry out other activities such as raising cattle and pigs to fatten. There also exist some organic agriculture projects, and hydroponics vegetable gardens. In addition to agriculture in the community you can also find mechanics’ garages, a supermarket, small restaurants (known as sodas), and a furniture store. Miguel works for a construction company and is also in school. He says that both places are very far from his house and it is difficult for him to get to them given that the roads are not in very good condition and there is also poor public transportation. Because of this Miguel has decided to purchase a motorcycle to be able to ease the way he travels and to be able to save time and make the most of it. For this he needs a loan of 400,000 CRC to purchase the motorcycle and in that way have his own vehicle that will allow him to continue moving forward and will facilitate his way of travel. Miguel is part of the Bancruce Communal Finance Institution, one the 100 organizations that are members of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his first loan, however, Miguel states that thanks to this kind of organization that serve as a means of facilitating loans he can dedicate more of time to productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
Juan Pablo P. es una joven de 22 años de edad. Vive con sus padres y sus cuatro hermanos, en una comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada Mollejones de Platanares, Pérez Zeledón. Mollejones es una comunidad ubicada a 150 kilómetros al sur de la Provincia de San José, la capital de Costa Rica. Se encuentra a 850 metros  sobre el nivel del mar. Ahí se cultivan hortalizas, café y además se desarrollan otras actividades como la crianza de ganado de engorde y de cerdos. Existen también algunos proyectos de agricultura orgánica y hortalizas en hidroponía. Además de la agricultura en la comunidad hay talleres mecánicos, un supermercado, pequeños restaurantes (sodas) y una mueblería.

Juan  Pablo trabaja en la Fuerza Pública en Dominical de Osa como policía; comenta que su trabajo está muy lejos de su casa y que se le dificulta la manera de llegar hasta él, ya que los caminos no están en muy buen estado y además hay muy poco transporte público. 

Por lo cual Juan Pablo ha decidido comprar una moto para poder transportarse mejor y así agilizar  la forma en la que viaja y poder ahorrar y aprovechar más  el tiempo. Por lo tanto requiere un préstamo de ¢300.000 (trescientos mil colones) para comprar la moto y así poder tener un vehículo propio que le permita seguir adelante  y facilitarle su modo de viajar.

Juan Pablo forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Bancruce, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo pero Juan Pablo  destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
JJuan Pablo P. is a young, 22-year old man. He lives with his parents and his four siblings in the rural Costa Rican community of Mollejones de Platanares, Pérez Zeledón. Mollejones is a community located 150 kilometers south of the province of San José, the capital of Costa Rica, and is 850 meters above sea level. In this area, people grow vegetables, coffee, and also carry out activities related to raising livestock and pigs. There also exist several projects related to organic farming and hydroponics (a technique of growing plants, without soil, in nutrient-rich water). In addition to the agricultural pursuits of the area, there are also auto repair shops, a supermarket, small restaurants (sodas) and a furniture store. Juan Pablo works as an officer for the State Police force; he comments that his work is very far from his home, and it is difficult for him to travel there as the roads are in disrepair and there is little access to public transportation. For this reason, Juan has decided to buy a motorcycle in order to be able to travel to work. It will also help him save time and money. He needs a loan of 300,000 Costa Rican colones ($550USD) to buy a motorcyle. Having his own vehicle as his primary mode of transportation will allow him to continue to progress. Juan Pablo is part of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Bancruce, one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his first loan but Juan Pablo stresses that, thanks to these types of organizations and credit facilitators, he can dedicate more time to activities that are productive.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Prodige Plus Group

texts.fr: Isabelle est une dame qui est mieux connue dans son quartier situé à l’est de Kinshasa par son amour du travail, la bonne qualité des poissons salés ainsi que des babouches qu’elle vend. Elle est aussi caractérisée par un courage et détermination particuliers. Elle est toujours prête à servir ses clients. Quand il y a un nouvel arrivage de ses marchandises, elle fait un tour dans le quartier pour les informer de l'arrivage. Elle a commencé le commerce en 1990 en vendant des poissons fumés avec un capital initial de $75. Après avoir acquit une solide expérience, elle a durement travaillé avec une bonne gestion, les bénéfices accumulés lui ont procuré en 2004, un capital de plus de $400. De 2004 à 2007, la dépréciation monétaire ainsi que la hausse des prix ont perturbé l’évolution de son activité et lui ont causé une baisse. En aout 2008, Isabelle décide de rejoindre un des groupes de Hope RDC dénommé « Prodige » dans le but de renforcer son capital et d’avoir un appui financier permanent. Elle est une cliente fidèle qui a reçu des crédits chez Hope RDC et les a totalement remboursés à temps. Le crédit qu’elle a obtenu ce mois de juin lui a servi d’acheter  des poissons salés ainsi que des babouches à revendre en vue d’accroitre son revenu. Actuellement, son capital propre est de $150. Son rêve est d’ouvrir un jour une boutique générale. Isabelle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants dont leurs âges varient entre 2 et 20 ans. Cinq d’entre eux étudient. Elle est fière d’être micro-entrepreneur
texts.en:
Isabelle is a lady who is best known, in her neighborhood situated in the east of Kinshasa, for her love of work and for the good quality of the salted fish and flip-flops she sells. She is also characterized by particular courage and determination. She is always ready to serve her customers. When she gets a new shipment in, she goes around the neighborhood to let folks know.

Isabelle began this business in 1990, selling smoked fish, with an initial capital of US$ 75. After having acquired a solid experience, she worked hard and managed her business well, and the profit she put aside amounted to a capital of more than US$ 400 in 2004.

From 2004-2007 the currency depreciation and price hikes perturbed her business and caused it to decrease. In August 2008, Isabelle decided to join one of the groups of Hope RDC called "Prodigy", intending to increase her capital and find permanent financial support. She is a faithful client who has received several loans from Hope RDC and has reimbursed them on time. The loan she has received this month of June allowed her to buy salted fish and flip-flops to resell so as to increase her revenue. Presently, her personal capital stands at US$ 150. Her dream is to open a general store.

Isabelle is married and the mother of 7 children, whose ages vary between 2 and 20. Five of them are enrolled in school. Isabelle is proud to be a micro-entrepreneur.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing flip-flops and salted fish to resell

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi 3 est un regroupement de femmes mariées du village de Sirakélé de la ville de Koutiala  région de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs enfants, maris, beaux parents, belles sœurs  etc. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et au moins  4 enfants.
Elles cultivent uniquement  de l’arachide.
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe Benkadi 3 ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant cinq ans. Après avoir correctement remboursés  les quatre   prêts précédents, elles sont à leur cinquième  prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter, des semences d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture, au grand marché de Koutiala. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Koutiala et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe Benkadi 3 comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 65 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du  prêt de Soro Yiriwaso  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Benkadi 3 is a group of married women of the Sirakélé neighborhood in the city of Koutiala (Sikasso Region, third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in large extended traditional families with their children, husbands, in-laws, etc. They average 35 years of age and have at least 4 children. Their businesses consist in growing peanuts. Eager to make their farming activities profitable, the members of the Benkadi 3 group decided to join the loan program of Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, five years ago.

After four loans that were repaid without problems, they are now seeking their fifth farming loan, which will be used to buy, at the grand market in Koutiala, peanut seeds, small material, and fertilizers for the fields. After the rainy season, the crops are stored for a while to increase their market value, before being sold at the grand market in Koutiala and in the surrounding villages, retail (often wholesale) and for cash, to a clientele usually coming from the larger cities.

After the sale of their production, the members of the Benkadi 3 group count on turning a profit of XOF 65'000 (ca US$ 140) each, to be used to repay the loan and to pay for the daily expenses of their families.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy peanut seed, small material, and fertilizers for the fields

loans.name: Ana Mercedes

texts.en:
Ana is 33 years old and is married to Gustavo Maldonado Palacios, with whom she adopted a child. She works making clothes for men and women, as well as uniforms for school and offices as they are ordered. She has been working in this industry since 2006.

The couple works every day with the three sewing machines they have. The credit will be used for the purchase of fabric for the making of a batch of uniforms for the nursing school, from whom they receive a large amount of orders. Their greatest wish is to expand and improve their workshop with other types of garment-making in order to have a good future and an education for their daughter.

loans.use: To purchase fabric to make uniforms

loans.name: Antonio Florencio

texts.en:
Antonio, a long-time client of the Fundación Paraguaya, is 64 years old, married with six older children and fourteen grandchildren. Three of his children work in Spain. He lives 10 kilometers outside of San Lorenzo and comes to the city every day to buy merchandise for his small grocery store. He owns the oldest grocery store in the neighborhood, which has been very successful.

Antonio does not wish to expand anymore or call attention to his store, as he lives in a dangerous neighborhood. He is very thankful to the Fundación Paraguaya for his loan, as it has supported his business and helped it grow.

loans.use: purchase of merchandise (dairy products, breads, beverages in general)

loans.name: Evarista

texts.en:
Evarista is 52 years old and is married to Wilfrido B. Almada, with whom she has two children. They own a small grocery store that they have been running out of their home since 1995. Additionally, they own a bus that her husband drives as a chauffeur as a business.

The credit will go to the purchase of merchandise for the small grocery store, some products in bulk and others for basic consumption. The demand for her products has increased.

The couple wishes in the future to be able to expand their small grocery store and convert it to a larger mini-supermarket. They also want to be able to acquire another bus that will help increase earnings as well for the benefit of the family.

loans.use: to purchase bread, rice, noodles, herbs, eggs, sodas, cleaning products, etc.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis T. is 32 years old. He is married and the father of three children. Currently, all his children are in school. Francis is a very hard-working young man who works hard to provide for his family especially in the area of education. He sells palm nut fruits in large quantities to companies who produce cooking oil in bulk. He takes delivery from the farmers in the communities where he lives.

Fortunately Francis has a truck that conveys that palm fruits to his customers. He also uses the truck for commercial purposes which generates extra income to support the family. He is therefore requesting a loan to enable him to purchase increased stocks of palm nut fruits. With his 14 years' experience, he believes he can work very hard to repay the loan on time. He belongs to the village bank called ‘Papaye’ which means Goodness.

loans.use: To purchase increased stocks of palm nuts for resale

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort S. is 39 years old; she is married and a mother with five children. Currently all her children are in school. She lives at Suhum in the eastern region of Ghana. She is a petty trader who sells assorted products like cooking utensils and plastic bowls, lunch boxes, etc. She mostly sells through hawking, that is, house-to-house selling. She has been selling goods for eight year now.

Comfort has attracted lots of customers who purchase from her. She treks to Accra to purchase her stock of goods. Recently she has been facing challenges in her business as a result of inadequate funds to buy stock. She requests a loan to buy more of the products like cooking utensils and others which are frequently demanded by her numerous customers. With the loan she believes she will be more resourced to make lots of profits to build a store to reduce the frequent walking through the streets to sell. She would be grateful for your assistance. Comfort belongs to a village bank called ‘Onoa Do’.

loans.use: to increase her stock of inventory

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel M. is forty-two years old. He is married and has one child, a girl, who is currently in primary school. Samuel lives with his wife and daughter in a rented apartment in a town in Ghana called Suhum. Suhum is a busy business centre in the Eastern Region. The majority of the inhabitants are in one particular type of business activity or the other.

Sammy, together with his wife, runs a provision store by the roadside in their community. The couple procures groceries such as tins of milk and Milo (cocoa powder), bags of sugar, candies, soap, etc. from big supermarkets in the surrounding towns and also from vans that come round to distribute. Samuel has been in business for three years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to increase his stock.

loans.use: To buy provisions for re-sale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth D. is a 45-year-old petty trader. She is married with four children. She lives with her husband and the children at Suhum in the eastern region of Ghana. She has been selling used clothes in the local market of Suhum for two years now. With income from her business, Elizabeth pays school fees for all her kids in junior and senior high school. Her major business challenge over the years has to do with funds to scale up the business.

Elizabeth has lots of marketing experience and is very confident that the loan would enable her to achieve remarkable business progress. She wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothes to serve her customers. She hopes to save enough to support her kid’s complete schooling. She belongs to the village bank ‘Nkunimde’ which means victory.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Rumbo al Desarrollo”, vive en el Psje. Callao Nº 150, Distrito de Morales, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Viuda, tiene 54 años y 3 hijos: 02 mujeres y 01 varón.

Con el fin de implementar y ampliar su negocio; ya que se dedica al alquiler  de habitacionres, puso mucho empeño para seguir adelante, y cumplir con las metas que se propuso.
Nos cuenta que anteriormente contaba con el apoyo de su esposo y después que falleció sufrió mucho pero nunca se dejo vencer y tuvo que salir adelante sola, para poder dar estudios a sus tres hijos y cumplir con lo que se propuso. Poco a poco, fue mejorando y construyendo sus habitaciones  para su respectivo alquiler.
Hoy en día se siente muy contenta con lo logrado, genera sus propios ingresos mensuales.

Ahora cuenta con 05 cuartos, que los alquila a estudiantes y docentes, le conviene mucho ya que vive cerca de una universidad. Hoy continúa con el mismo negocio ubicado en su misma casa.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,800.00, comprará materiales de construcción, como: 02 sacos de cemento y arena, para mejorar su pasadizo y bolsas de pintura para darle una mejor decoración. 

Rosa, tiene carisma, es alegre y es amiga de sus clientes, tiene confianza con ellos y son puntuales con sus pagos.
Comenta que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos como organización ayuda a las mujeres a desarrollarse y progresar con la misma oportunidad que el varón.
texts.en:
Rosa belongs to the Communal Bank “Women Bound for Development”, and she lives in the Morales District, San Martin Province, Department of San Martin. She is widowed, 54 years old, and has 3 children: 2 girls and 1 boy. Rosa dedicates herself to renting out rooms, and with the aim of expanding her business she puts a lot a work into continuing to get ahead and reaching the goals that she has set for herself. She tells us that she had previously relied on the support of her husband, and when he passed away she suffered greatly but never allowed it to defeat her. She had to move forward alone to provide her three children with an education and to fulfill the goals that she set for herself. Little by little, she continued improving and building her rooms to then rent. Today she feels very happy with what she has accomplished, and generates her own monthly income. Currently she has 5 rooms that she rents to students and university lecturers; this is very convenient given that she lives near the university. At present she continues in this same business located in her own home. With this loan of 1,800 PEN she will purchase construction materials, such as: 2 cement and sand bags to improve her passageway, and paint to improve the decor. Rosa has charisma, is happy, and is a friend to her clients, she has their trust and they are punctual with their payments. She comments that the Manual Ramos Movement as organization helps women to develop and progress with the same opportunities as men.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer
