loans.use: To purchase materials to improve her rooms for rent.

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia A. is thirty-six years old. She is a divorced mother of three children – one daughter and two sons. According to her, they are in junior high and primary school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Suhum in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Afia is a food vendor. She cooks and sells rice with stew. She prepares the food in her house and sells on a table top by the roadside. She sells from morning till evening. Afia buys bags of rice and other ingredients from the community market. Afia has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She is hopeful to send all her children through school.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice, etc. in bulk

loans.name: Luz Rosenda

texts.es:
La señora Luz Rosenda pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Rumbo al desarrollo”, vive en la Av. Perú Nº 284, Distrito de Morales, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 49 años, tiene 01 hijo que aun depende de ella.

Luz Rosenda, es una mujer luchadora que le gusta trabajar y depender de ella misma, por eso nos cuenta que desea implementar su propio negocio, y se dedica a vender productos naturales de la marca Omnilife.

Cuenta con un pequeño local, bien ambientado; ubicado en su misma casa, donde atiende al público en general, amigos y familiares.
Nos cuenta que se inició primero con una botica, y después implementó su negocio al que ahora actualmente se dedica. 
Hoy en día se ha convertido en una gran empresaria y ya es conocida por sus clientes.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1000.00, comprará mas productos naturales Omnilife en cajas para su stock. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá comprando una vitrina, para poner sus productos y así mostrar a sus clientes.

Luz Rosenda, esta muy segura que su negocio prosperará mas y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Luz Rosenda belongs to the Communal Bank “Women Bound for Development”, and she lives in the Morales District, San Martin Province, Department of San Martin. She lives with her partner, is 49 years old, and has 1 child that depends on her. Luz Rosenda is a determined woman who likes to work and depends on herself, because of that she tells us that she hopes to expand her own business in the sale of Omnilife brand natural products. She has a small locale, with a great environment, located in her own home where she attends to the general public, friends, and family members. She tells us that she first began with a small pharmacy and later expanded her business to that to which she currently dedicates herself. At present she has become a great businesswoman and is now well known by her clients. With this loan of 1,000 PEN she will purchase boxes Omnilife natural products for her stock. Part of the money will also be invested in the purchase of a display case in which to place her products to show to her clients. Luz Rosenda is very certain that her business will prosper even more, and thanks the Manuela Ramos Movement organization for contributing to her being able to fulfill her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more natural products.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris G. is 43 years old and a married mother with three kids. All the kids are currently in school. She says selling of lingerie, jewelry, and slippers, especially for women, is very profitable and therefore she has been selling ladies' lingerie, slippers, jewelry, and clothes in the local market for two years to help her husband take care of the family’s needs.

With the loan, Doris wants to buy bales of lingerie, slippers, clothes and jewelry to increase her inventory and sales for good income. She believes this loan would help her save some money to start paying part of the children's school fees and the utility bills. She is a member of the group called ‘Nkunimde’ which means victory.

loans.use: To buy bales of lingerie, jewelry, slippers etc.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La señora Julia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen del Rosario”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad D. Queñuani, distrito D. Yunguyo, Provincia D. Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 42 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, con 02 hijos (01 a su cargo), y tiene estudios D. primaria incompleta (3ro D. primaria), vive en el Barrio San Martín.

Trabaja con el Mmovimiento Manuela R. hace ya 8 años,  con un préstamo inicial D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles  pudo invertir en su negocio D. compra y venta D. sacos D. polietileno (plásticos).  

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo D. S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, para poder invertir en su actual negocio, dicho producto luego lo distribuirá en las ferias D. yunguyo.

Su deseo es tener capital para la compra D. ganado mayor para mejorarlo.

A ella le gustan las reuniones, lo ahorros, los encuentros que organiza Manuela R..
texts.en:
Julia belongs to the Communal Bank “Virgin of the Rosary” which is located in the Queñuani Community, Yunguyo District, Province of Chucuito, Department of Puno. She is 42 years old, is married, and has 2 children (1 still under her care); she didn’t finish her primary school studies (finished up to 3rd graD.), and lives in the San Martín neighborhood. She has worked with the Manuela R. Movement for the past 8 years; her first loan was of 300 PEN, which she invested in her business in which she purchases and sells bags of polyethylene (plastic). At this moment she is requesting a loan of 3,000 PEN to be able to invest in her current business, a product that she will later distribute in the market of Yunguyo. Her hope is to have the capital to be able to purchase large cattle to later fatten. She enjoys the meetings, saving, and the gatherings that the Manuela R. organization organizes.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase bags of polyethylene (plastic).

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace K. is 32 years old. She is married and has two children – one daughter and one son, both of whom are currently in primary school. Grace lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Suhum in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Grace and her husband both work to provide for the family. Her husband is a teacher by profession and she is a trader. She sells polythene bags of all kinds and sizes. She buys the bags from Accra and hawks them in her community. Grace says she also distributes some to other retailers in her community. She has been in business for four years and wants a loan buy polythene bags in bulk so she can increase her stock. Grace is hopeful to sponsor her children through school.

loans.use: To buy polythene bags in bulk

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet A. is 41 years old. She is married and has three children who are currently in school. She has two boys and one girl. They were all happy when we were chatting with their mother. For the past six years, Janet has operated a clothing shop where she sells jeans, blouses, skirts, jewelry, women's slippers, dressing bags, and headscarves. She sometimes sells through hawking, depending on the market condition for the day. 

Janet's business is constrained by a lack of funds. She needs a loan to enable her to inject more working capital into the business. She believes the loan will help her to increase the quality and quantity of her inventory. She wants to use the loan to purchase jeans, ladies wear, headscarves, and slippers. She belongs to the village bank called ‘Onoa Do’.

loans.use: To purchase jeans, ladies wear, jewelry, and slippers

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Juana, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Vista Alegre”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad D. Queñuani, distrito D. Yunguyo, Provincia D. Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 59 años D. edad es casada y madre D. 06 hijos,  no tiene estudios, y vive en el Barrio  Río D. la plata.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace ya 9 años aproximadamente.  Su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, este dinero lo uso para la compra D. ganado menor. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo D. S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, D. los cuales ella invertirá S/. 1200.00 nuevos soles  para comprar D. ají y S/. 1800.00 nuevos soles para la compra D. ganado menor (ovejas).  Nos comenta que está enferma D. la vesícula y se trata con medicina natural.

Su mayor sueño es continuar trabajando.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y los encuentros.
texts.en:
Ms. Juana C. is a member of the “Virgen del Rosario” Microfinance Institute, located in the Queñuani community, district of Yunguyo, province of Chucuito, Department of Puno. She is a 59-year-old married mother of 6 children. She did not receive any formal schooling, and she lives in the Rio D. la Plata neighborhood.

She has been been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for approximately 9 years. Her first loan was for 300.00 PEN, which she used to purchase small breed livestock.

At this time, she needs a 3,000.00 PEN loan, 1,200.00 of which will be used to purchase chili peppers, and 1,800.00 of which will be used to purchase livestock (sheep). She states that she has gallbladder problems that she is treating with natural medicine.

Her biggest dream is to continue working.

She likes the institute's meetings and the savings that she has been able to set asiD..

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock and chili peppers

loans.name: Clinton

texts.en: Clinton S., 28, is single and has one child who is in school. He is a very resourceful young man and father who works hard to support his family. Clinton supports his child and and meets his other family responsibilities by selling used clothing. He has a store in the market where he hangs and arranges the used clothing. Selling used clothing is very popular in Ghana because new cloths are very expensive. Clinton wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothing to increase his inventory. He believes this loan will help him save for his child's future education and also to rent a permanent store for his business. He is member of the group called “Aba Ba” meaning "Good Seeds." He would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy used clothing

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana A. is 37 years old. She is divorced and has four children – all girls. All her children are currently in school. Some are in the senior high while others are in the junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Suhum in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Juliana works very hard to provide for the family. She runs a grocery store in her community. Her shop is on one of the streets. She buys the groceries from Accra and other big shops in her community. Juliana says she also sells textile materials. 
She has been in business for over 13 years, and she wants a loan buy provisions in bulk so she can increase her stock. Juliana is hopeful to sponsor her children in school to higher levels.

loans.use: To buy groceries in bulk

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
La señora Flora, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen del Rosario”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad D. Queñuani, distrito D. Yunguyo, Provincia D. Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno.  Ella tiene 70 años D. edad y es madre D. 06 hijos, (solo dos viven con ella y están estudiando), D. estado civil casada, y tiene estudios D. Secundaria completa.  Vive en el Barrio Central.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. la fundación del Banco Comunal (hace 10 años aproximadamente).  Su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, este dinero lo utilizó para la compra D. ganado menor.  Paralelamente tiene un negocio, juntamente con su esposo, D. venta D. repuestos  D. maquina D. coser. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo D. S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para poder invertir en la compra D. repuestos D. maquinas D. coser y comprar algunas cabezas D. ovino.

Su mayor sueño es seguir trabajando hasta que las fuerzas le permitan

Nos cuenta que les gusta mucho los ahorros que podido juntar gracias a sus créditos.
texts.en:
Ms. Flora M. is a member of the “Virgen del Rosario” Microfinance Institute, located in the Queñuani community, district of Yunguyo, province of Chucuito, Department of Puno. She is a 70-year-old married mother of 6 children, only two of whom live with her and attend school. She completed secondary school and lives in the Central neighborhood.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement since the founding of the microfinance institute approximately 10 years ago. Her first loan was for 300.00 PEN, which she used to purchase minor livestock breeds. Additionally, she and her husband sell spare parts for sewing machines.

At this time, she needs a 500.00 PEN loan so that she can invest it in purchasing spare parts for sewing machines and heads of cattle.

Her biggest dream is to keep working as long as she is physically able to do so.

She states that she really likes the savings that she has been able to set asiD. thanks to these loans.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock and spare parts for sewing machines

loans.name: Karen's Group

texts.en:
Karen had established a career as a court reporter, before she was sidetracked by personal tragedy.  After many years, she returned to court reporting and eventually found her passion in helping the hearing-impaired community through transcription and closed captioning services.  While working for a community college providing educational captioning services, Karen started One Stop Verbatim Services, which offers “universal access” to not only the hearing-impaired, but also English language learners, the elderly, and distance learning students.  Karen has big dreams for her business and spends plenty of time cold calling potential clients, such as sports stadiums where she wants to start captioning sports games and events on their big screens.

A $10,000 loan will enable Karen to purchase the updated equipment that she needs to provide the best service to her clients and to expand her services to include online podcasts.

loans.use: Purchase closed captioning and transcription equipment

loans.name: Celia Lucrecia

texts.es:
La señora Lucrecia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen del Rosario”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Queñuani, distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 32 años edad, de estado civil casada y tiene 05 hijos, todos estudiantes.  Tiene estudios  de secundaria completa y vive en el Barrio Vista Alegre.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 8 años.  Su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que invirtió en la compra de sacos de polietileno (plástico).  

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, para poder invertir en su actual negocio, que es compra y venta de sacos de polietileno al por mayor, para luego venderlo en las ferias de yunguyo y otras de la zona

Su deseo es comprarse una casita.

A ella le gustan las reuniones, las charlas y los encuentros que organiza Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Ms. Lucrecia M. is a member of the “Virgen del Rosario” Microfinance Institute, located in the Queñuani community, district of Yunguyo, province of Chucuito, Department of Puno. She is a 32-year-old married mother of 5 school age children. She completed secondary school and lives in the Vista Alegre neighborhood.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 8 years. Her first loan was for 300.00 PEN, which she invested in purchasing polyethylene (plastic) sacks. At this time, she needs a 3,000.00 PEN loan so that she can invest in her current business—buying and selling polyethylene sacks in bulk—so that she can then sell them in the markets of Yunguyo and other areas. Her dream is to purchase her own little house.

She likes the meetings and discussions that are organized by Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase polyethylene sacks

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora Maria, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen del Rosario”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad D. Queñuani, distrito D. Yunguyo, Provincia D. Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 52 años edad, D. estado civil casada, tiene  01 hijo (estudiante), ella  tiene estudios D. primaria incompleta (1er grado)y vive en el Barrio Porteño.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace casi 9 años.  Su primer préstamo fue D. 
S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, con el cual compró carne.  

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo D. S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra D. carne D. ovino y  vacuno, que luego será vendido en el mercado D.  yunguyo.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando para poder solventar los gastos D. la casa.

A ella le gusta las reuniones, las charlas y los encuentros que organiza Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Ms. Maria L. is a member of the “Virgen del Rosario” Microfinance Institute, located in the Queñuani community, district of Yunguyo, province of Chucuito, Department of Puno. She is a 52-year-old married mother with one son who is currently in school. She did not complete elementary school (only the first graD.), and she lives in the Porteño neighborhood.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement for almost 9 years. Her first loan was for 300.00 PEN, which she used to purchase meat.

At this time, she needs a 3,000.00 PEN loan so that she can purchase meat (mutton and beef), which she will then sell at the Yunguyo Market.

She hopes to continue working so that she can cover the household expenses.

She likes the meetings and discussions that Manuela Ramos organizes.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase mutton and beef

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina A. is 32 years old. She is divorced and has three children – two sons and a daughter. One child is in junior high and the other children two are in primary school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Suhum in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She works very hard to provide for the family. Georgina runs a grocery store in her community. Her shop is by the road side. She buys groceries from Accra and other big shops in her community. She has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy provisions in bulk so she can increase her stock. She is hopeful to sponsor her children in school to higher levels.

loans.use: To buy groceries in bulk

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence A., 36 years old, is married and the mother of two children who are currently in school. She is a trader. She trades in lace materials, textiles, and clothing materials. Lace material is popular in room and office decorations.

For lack of adequate working capital, Florence has been limited to buying small stocks of lace materials, which she sells through hawking. She believes this loan will enable her to grow her business to the level to which she hopes to expand it. With the loan, she wants to make bulk purchases of lace materials and textiles. She hopes to use part of her expected profits to help provide her children with quality education.

She belongs to a village bank called "Adepa," which means "Good Things."

loans.use: To purchase lace materials and textiles in bulk

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes A., 49 years old, is married and has three children: two sons and a daughter. She tells us that one attends the junior high and the others are in the primary school. Agnes lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Suhum in the eastern region of Ghana. She works very hard to help her husband provide for the family.

Agnes is a trader. She sells rubber and plastic products such as buckets, bowls, and cups, as well as metal pots, pans, etc. in her community. She sells her wares in a shop located at the market square. Agnes also journeys to other towns to sell on their market days. She buys her wares from Accra.

Agnes has been in business for over 23 years and is requesting a loan to buy goods in bulk so that she can increase her stock. She hopes to help her children attain advanced levels in their schooling.

loans.use: To buy plastic products in bulk for sale

loans.name: Omama

texts.en:
Omama B., age 32, is married and the father of two children. His children attend a good school in the community where the family lives. Omama works very hard to provide food for his wife and children. His wife is very supportive to him.

He sells poultry, such as egg-laying hens, broilers, and particularly roosters. He is been in business for six years now. He has a big cage in the marketplace of Suhum where he keeps and sells his birds. He mostly sells the egg-layers and roosters because he says the broilers are very expensive to rear. Nevertheless, he manages to sell some.

He requests your loan support to buy more birds to increase his profit margin. With the loan, he believes his dream of selling more can be achieved.

He belongs to the village bank called "Asomdwe Mma," which translates as "Peaceful Children."

loans.use: To buy a supply of poultry birds, such broilers and layers, in bulk

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
La señora Petrona, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Vista Alegre” que esta ubicado en la Comunidad D. Queñuani, distrito D. Yunguyo, Provincia D. Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 57 años D. edad y es madre D. 08 hijos (D. los cuales solo uno esta a su lado), es D. estado civil casada, y no tiene estudios.  Vive en el Barrio Río D. la plata.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace casi 2 años.  Su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que utilizó para la comapra D. sacos D. naylon. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo D. S/. 1500.00 Nuevos soles, para poder invertir en su actual negocio, que es la compra D. sacos D. naylon, para luego distribuirlo en las ferias D. la zona.

Su mayor sueño es seguir trabajando para poder dar estudios a su hijo.

A ella le gustan los ahorros  y las reuniones D. su Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Ms. Petrona A. is a member of the “Vista Alegre” Microfinance Institute, which is located in the Queñuani community, district of Yunguyo, province of Chucuito, Department of Puno. She is a 57-year-old married mother of 8 children, only one of whom still lives with her. She has had no formal schooling, and she lives in the Rio D. la Plata neighborhood.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for almost 2 years. Her first loan was for 300.00 PEN, which she used for purchasing sacks of nylon.

At this time, she needs a 1,500.00 PEN loan so that she can invest it in her current business—buying sacks of nylon—so that she can then distribute it at the local markets.

Her greatest dream is to continue working so that she can proviD. her son with an education.

She likes her microfinance institute's meetings and savings.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sacks of polythylene

loans.name: Genaro

texts.en:
Mr. Genaro is 43 years old and works selling clothes for women, men and children.  He also sells jackets, comforters and domestic electric products by order.  He uses a motorcycle to deliver his orders and to collect his fees.  He will use the loan to buy jackets that are on sale, taking into account that it is the beginning of the autumn and winter seasons. 

His greatest wish is to be able to grow his business so he can increase his income, which will help complete the construction of his house.

loans.use: for the purchase of jackets

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es:
La señora Nieves, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Vista Alegre”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad D. Queñuani, distrito D. Yunguyo, Provincia D. Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 52 años D. edad y es madre D. 02 hijos, estado civil casada, y  tiene estudios D. primaria completa, vive en el Barrio  Río D. la plata.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 4 años.  Su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que utilizó como capital para su negocio D. compra y venta D. ají. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo D. S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, para poder invertir en su actual negocio.  Su producto será vendido en la feria D. desaguadero y yunguyo.

Su mayor sueño es dedicarse a la ganadería.  A ella le gustan los ahorros  y las charlas que se les dan en cada reunión D. su Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nieves belongs to the “Vista Alegre” Community Bank located in the Queñuani Community, Yunguyo district, Chucuito Province, Puno Region. She is 52 years old and the mother of 2 children. Her marital status is married and she has completed primary school. She lives in the Río D. la Plata neighborhood.

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for 4 years. Her first loan was for 300.00 PEN. She used it for capital for her business buying and selling chili peppers.

At this time she needs a loan of 3000.00 PEN to invest in her current business. Her product will be sold at the fair in Desaguadero and Yunguyo.

Her biggest dream is to work with livestock. She likes the savings and the talks they are given at each meeting of the Community Bank.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase Chili Peppers.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.es:
La señora Anastacia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Vista Alegre”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad D. Queñuani, distrito D. Yunguyo, Provincia D. Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno.  Ella tiene 45 años D. edad es casada y es madre D. 06 hijos, tiene estudios D. primaria incompleta (2do grado), y vive en el Barrio  Río D. la plata.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela R. desD. hace 5 o 6 años.  Su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, este dinero lo usó para la compra D. ovejas 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo D. S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, para poder invertir en su actual negocio, la comprar y venta ganado para engorD. (ovinos), paralelamente se dedica a la compra-venta D. sogas D. polietileno (plásticos).

Su mayor sueño es continuar trabajando. A ella le gustan los ahorros  y las reuniones D. su Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Mrs. Anastacia belongs to the “Vista Alegre” community bank located in the Queñuani Community, Yunguyo district, Chucuito Province, Puno Region. She is 45 years old, married and the mother of 6 children. She has not completed primary school (2nd graD.). She lives in the Río D. la Plata neighborhood.

She has worked with the Manuela R. movement for 5 or 6 years. Her first loan was for 300.00 PEN. She used it to buy sheep.

At this time she needs a loan of 3000.00 PEN to invest in her current business, buying and selling livestock for fattening (sheep). She works in parallel buying and selling polyethylene cords (plastics).

Her biggest dream is to continue working. She likes the savings and the meetings of her Community Bank.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sheep and bags of polyethylene (plastic).

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose A. is thirty years old. She is married with one child who is currently in school. She owns and operates a beauty salon in her neighborhood in Suhum in the eastern region of Ghana, where she lives with her family. Rose is a skillful and talented hair dresser. She believes in efficiency and effectiveness of service. She wants to use the loan to buy larger quantities of hair products like weavons, pomade, shampoo, activators etc. to serve her customers. She has won many customers in the community who come to her salon to get their hair done. She is busiest on the weekends, since her customers are preparing for the week's work.  She will be grateful for your assistance and belongs to the village bank called ‘Yesu Dea’ which means Belong to God.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of hair products like weavons, pomade, shampoo, activators etc.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Vista Alegre”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Queñuani, distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno.  Ella tiene 55 años de edad,está casada y es madre de 08 hijos,  solo uno sigue estudiando.  Tiene estudios de primaria incompleta (transición), y vive en el Barrio  Río de la plata.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela R. desde hace ya 1 año.  Con su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles compró ovejas. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para poder invertir en su actual negocio, comprará ovejas.  Paralelamente también tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de sacos de polietileno (plástico).

Su mayor sueño es continuar trabajando.

A ella le gustan los ahorros  y las charlas de capacitación que les da Manuela R..
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana belongs to the “Vista Alegre” community bank located in the Queñuani Community, Yunguyo district, Chucuito Province, Puno Region. She is 55 years old, married and the mother of 8 children. Only one continues studying. She has not completed primary school (transition). She lives in the Río de la Plata neighborhood.

She has worked with the Manuela R. movement for 1 year. She bought sheep with her first loan of 300.00 PEN.

At this time she needs a loan of 500.00 PEN to invest in her current business. She will buy sheep. She also has a small business in parallel selling bags of polyethylene (plastic).

Her biggest dream is to continue working.

She likes the savings and the training talks given by Manuela R..

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep, bags of polyethylene

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Married with three children, Comfort is a forty-year-old trader. She has a girl and two boys who are currently in school. She trades in maize cereals. She has been trading for the past fifteen years and has been a good resource for her family. She treks to the farming communities, such as Afram Plains in the eastern region of Ghana, to buy her foodstuffs and then retails them to her customers. She wants to use the loan to buy a larger supply of maize to serve her customers throughout the season, especially in the face of increasing prices due to the current food crisis in the country. This she believes would enable her save more to support her children in school. Comfort belongs to a village bank called ‘Yonko Do’.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of cereals like maize.

loans.name: Ramón

texts.en: Mr. Ramón is 48 years old and is married to Mrs. Fidencia Gimenez, with whom he has three older children, each with their own family.  He sells over-the-counter medicines in two cities on the outskirts of San Lorenzo. He has been working in this industry for ten years. He began delivering his medicines by bus. Two years ago he bought a motorcycle, and now he has a cargo-motorcycle that he bought with another Fundación Paraguaya loan, repaid in full.  His idea for the future is to buy a truck, so that he may be able to sell his medicines to more people in more cities.

loans.use: The purchase of over-the-counter medicines and sweets.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La señora  Francisca, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Vista Alegre”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad D. Queñuani, distrito D. Yunguyo, Provincia D. Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno.  Ella tiene 77 años D. edad está casada, es madre D. 05 hijos, todos independientes;  Tiene estudios D. primaria incompleta (1er grado), fue presidenta D. su Banco Comunal 2 años.  Vive en el Barrio San Martín.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. su fundación, inicio su negocio con un préstamo D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, con el cual comprá diversos productos D. la zona (papas, ocas, habas, etc.) 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo D. S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, los cuales los invertirá en la compra D. papas, ocas, habas, quinua, etc. 

Su mayor sueño es continuar trabajando mientras tenga fuerzas.

A ella le gusta la forma D. trabajo D. Manuela Ramos y sobre todo los ahorros.
texts.en:
Francisca belongs to the Vista Alegre Community Bank; which is located in the Queñuani community, Yunguyo district, Chucuito province, Puno department. She is 77, married, and has 5 independent children. She has a first graD. education. She was the president of her community bank for two years. She lives in the San Martín neighborhood. She has worked with the Moviemiento Manuela Ramos since its foundation. She started with a loan for 300 PEN, which she used to buy various products from the zone (potatoes, oca, fava beans, etc.) She now needs a loan for 500 PEN to buy potatoes, oca, fava beans, quinoa, etc. Her biggest dream is to keep working while she has the strength. She likes the way that Manueal Ramos works; above all she likes the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy potatoes, oca, quinoa, etc. to later sell

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a forty-nine-year-old woman. She is married and the mother of three children.  Two are attending school and the eldest is working. She is a serious-minded businesswoman who works hard to help her husband and provide for her family. She owns and operates a grocery shop in the community center of Suhum where she lives with her family. She sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk etc.  She has run this business for almost thirty-one years.  Now she would like to expand her business and wants to use the loan to increase her stock of goods available for sale. Margaret is also a bookbinder who binds and sells exercise books mostly to schoolchildren. She is convinced that the loan will enable her to buy more supplies at a lower price. It is also her dream to finance her children's education to the university level. She would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams etc.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La señora  Gregoria, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Vista Alegre”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Queñuani, distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Chuchito, Departamento de Puno.  Ella tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y es madre de 03 hijos, y  tiene estudios de primaria incompleta, y vive en el Barrio  San Martín.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 10 años aproximadamente.  Su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, con el cual compró productos de la zona. 

Gregoria en este momento requiere un préstamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, los cuales los invertirá en su negocio de compra y venta  de productos de la zona (papa, ocas, habas, quinua, etc.) 

Su mayor sueño es continuar trabajando, hacer crecer su capital y así poder darles una profesión a sus hijos.

A ella le gusta la forma de trabajo de Manuela Ramos, sobre todo los ahorros.
texts.en:
Gregoria belongs to the Vista Alegre Community Bank, which is located in the Queñuani community, Yunguyo district, Chucuito province, Puno department. She is 45, married, and has three children. She did not finish primary school. She lives in the San Martín neighborhood. She has worked with the Moviemiento Manuela Ramos for approximately ten years. Her first loan was for 300 PEN, which she used to buy various products from the zone She now needs a loan for 3,000 PEN to purchase and sell products from the zone (potatoes, oca, fava beans, quinoa, etc.) Her biggest dream is to keep working, make her capital grow, and this way be able to give her children a profession. She likes the way that Manueal Ramos works; above all she likes the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy potatoes, oca, quinoa, etc.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
This is Janet N.. She is a widow and is the mother of a child who is in the nursing training college. Janet is 47 years old. She sells foodstuffs like cassava, plantain, maize, beans, and gari in the local market of Suhum where she lives. Plantain and cassava are used for fufu, a porridge which is enjoyed by many Ghanaians. She is been selling for the past 20 years and has gained a great deal of selling experience, which makes her successful in winning customers.

Janet is an achiever and her focus is to save enough to strengthen her business now that she is not taking care of children. She wants to use the loan to buy an increased stock of cassava and plantain to serve her customers. She would be grateful for such assistance.

loans.use: To buy increased stock of foodstuffs like cassava, plantain, maize, beans, and gari

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.en:
Ernestina A., age 49, is divorced and the mother of two children. Currently, one is in the university and one is a teacher in training. Ernestina is a seamstress. She has been sewing for 25 years now. She specializes in women's clothing and funeral dresses.

Her skills and designs are of the highest class. She sews clothing in styles that give her customers a unique look, creating apparel such as church attire, kaba and slit clothing, children's school uniforms, wedding dresses, and funeral clothes.

Ernestina wants to use this loan to buy increased supplies of sewing materials such as linen, threads, and thimbles, in order to increase her output and efficiency. Thanks to her dedication and hard work, Ernestina has two apprentices, to whom she is providing quality training so that they may develop valuable career skills.

She hopes to increase her savings to provide her university-going child with a quality education. She belongs to the village bank called ‘Emmanuel.’

loans.use: To buy increased supplies of sewing material like linen, threads, thimbles, etc. to increase her output and efficiency.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia A. is a 30-year-old trader. She is the the mother of three children, all of whom are now in school. Lydia is widowed: her husband died after a prolonged illness.

Lydia is a very resourceful mother who supports her family through hard effort. She earns a livelihood through the sale of used clothing, curtains, and bedsheets. The sale of these items has a large market share in Ghana, as brand new clothes are very expensive for the economically active poor. Therefore, the selling of used clothing has created a successful market for many women. Lydia has been in this business for a year now. She usually concentrates on bedsheets and used towel sales. In addition, she also trades in grocery products: she tells us that this has generated extra income to feed her family.

She travels to a nearby city called Accra to purchase her stock of goods. She wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothing as well as to buy additional grocery products to increase her inventory. She would eventually like to have enough capital to rent a storefront from which to trade.

She believes this loan will help her save for her children's future.

loans.use: To buy bales of used clothing for sale

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience is married and the mother of eight children who are currently in school. She is 50 years old and trades in lace materials, textiles and clothing materials. Lace material is very useful in room and office decorations. For lack of adequate working capital, Patience is only able to buy a few small quantities of lace materials, which she then sells. She believes the loan will enable her to grow her business. With the loan, she wants to purchase lace materials and textiles in bulk. She hopes to use part of her profit to provide her children with quality education. She belongs to a village bank called ‘Gye Nyame’, which means Except God.

loans.use: To purchase lace materials and textiles in bulk.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is married and has two grown sons, Ruslan and Roman. Her family lives in Pavlograd, a regional center in the southeast region of Ukraine. Ludmila runs a small venture selling men’s clothing items in the central market of her home town. She is an experienced market vendor who has been in this trade for 10 years. Her turnover capital amounts to 28,000 Grivnyas. Her net profit is about 6,000 Grivnyas a month.

Ludmila is seeking a loan of 12,100 Grivnyas to purchase 100 sets of men's sports outfits. Her business is the main source of income for the family. Ludmila works hard to keep her venture running. She owns two vending locations and is in the process of constructing a kiosk which would help create comfortable working conditions.

Ludmila is always very attentive to customers and finds a way to approach each of them, even the most demanding ones. We believe her good credit history and stable characteristics of business development will ensure prompt repayment of the current loan.

loans.use: To purchase 100 men's sports outfits for sale

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa B., 40 years old, is married. Of her six children, one passed away some years ago. Two are in school and three are working on their own.

Adwoa is a trader. She trades in rice and other cereals. She has been trading for the past three years, and since beginning this business she been very resourceful in supporting her family. She buys her rice and other cereals in bags and sells in measuring cups to her customers. She sells by hawking her products from house to house. She journeys to the farming area of Koforidua in the eastern region of Ghana to buy her foodstuffs.

She wants to use this loan to buy a larger supply of rice to serve her customers throughout the season, especially in the face of increasing prices due to the current food crisis in the country. This she believes will enable her to save more to support her children in school.

Adwoa belongs to a village bank called "Nyame Adom," which means "God’s Grace."

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of rice and other cereals for sale

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina G. is a 37-year-old local restaurant operator who currently lives with her parent. She is single and has two children attending school. Christina has been in food provision for a year now. She understands customer ethics and is particularly aware of the importance of maintaining product quality and offering excellent service.

She prepares and sells local foods like fufu, banku, and other local dishes. Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain, and is taken with all kinds of soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grainsm and it is taken with hot pepper or soup. With her tasty meals, Christina has attracted lots of customers in the area where she serves her food. As a result, it has become necessary to employ additional hands to assist her in food-delivery service.

She tells us that the prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she needs the support of a loan to enable her to meet her production expenditure. With this loan, she wants to purchase more raw ingredients, such as bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, and vegetables as well as firewood to prepare her meals. She would be grateful for such assistance.

She belongs to the village bank called "Emmanuel."

loans.use: To buy materials like maize, cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel, 48 years old, is married and the father of three children, although he actually takes care of five children. They are all attending school. He is very hard-working and dedicated to his work.

Samuel has been a carpenter for 22 years. Carpentry has been his major occupation and provides the main source of his family's livelihood. He owns a carpentry shop, where he manufactures all kinds of furniture items. Samuel builds chairs, wardrobes, beds, and other such pieces.

He tells us that lack of adequate working capital has prevented him from being able to pre-finance most of the orders he receives from his customers. This, he says, slows down his work because he is obliged to wait for full funds from his customers before any work can begin, which usually results in substantial delays. He requests this loan to enable him to procure useful working tools and furnishing materials, such as polish, glue, sandpaper, and wooden boards to improve upon his efficiency. He believes this will improve his income and ensure a better living for himself and his family.

It has been Samuel's dream to be one of the best carpenters in his entire community. It is also his desire to support the children in his household.

loans.use: To procure useful working tools and furnishing materials like polish, glue, and sandpaper

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is married and has one son, Alexander. She is a small entrepreneur from Pavlograd. Ludmila sells quality women’s outerwear in the central market of her home town. Her business has flourished, in great degree thanks to timely lending assistance. Ludmila launched her trade about 13 years ago. At that time, she worked with a partner and owned two vending locations. As the business grew, she decided to switch to sole ownership. She now owns three vending kiosks. Ludmila has about 100,000 Grivnyas in turnover capital. Her net profit amounts to about 7,000 Grivnyas.

Ludmila is seeking a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to increase her inventory of assorted merchandise for retail sale. Her business boasts stable growth characteristics. Moreover, Ludmila is very reliable and has paid all previous loans promptly.

Although economic forecasts are gloomy in Ukraine, just as they are elsewhere in the world, Ludmila is hoping to continue expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of assorted merchandise for sale

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is 32 years old. She is married and the mother of five children. All her children are currently in school. Hannah owns and operates a grocery store where she sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, and skimmed powdered milk as well as body lotions and hair creams.

She deems it a great opportunity to expand her business to include other items frequently demanded by customers. With her two years of trading experience, she wants to use the loan to buy more items to increase her inventory.

She hopes to improve sales in order to enable her to save more for the children's education.

loans.use: To buy more items for sale in her grocery store

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es:
Rodrigo  vive en la calle # 22 de la zona villa Tunari en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Es soltero vive junto a su madre y sus hermanos en casa de sus familiares. 

Trabaja como ayudante en un taller de carpintería,  donde realizan muebles tallados en madera, los días jueves y domingos vende material de plomería al por menor en la feria principal de la ciudad.

El crédito lo destinará en la compra de más material de plomería para incrementar sus ventas. 
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito
texts.en:
Rodrigo lives on the Calle #22 in the Villa Tunari zone in the city of El Alto. He is single, and he lives with his mother and siblings in the family house. He works as a helper in a carpentry shop where they carve furniture from wood. On Thursdays and Sundays he makes retail sales of plumbing material in his city’s main fair. The loan is to buy more plumbing material to increase his sales. This is his first loan with Impro. The completed evaluation qualifies him for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
This is Georgina F.. She is married with eight children, of whom five are in the senior high school and the rest are in the junior high school. She is 49 years old and a trader. She trades in maize cereals and maize dough. She has been trading for the past year and has become increasingly resourceful to her family since she began engaging in this activity.

Georgina buys the maize in bags and sells it in measuring cups to her customers. This she does through hawking, that is, house-to-house selling. She journeys to the farming communities in Koforidua in the eastern region of Ghana to buy the foodstuffs which she then sells in retail to her customers.

She would like to use the loan to buy a larger supply of rice to serve her customers throughout the season, especially in the face of increasing prices due to the current food crisis in the country. This, she believes, would enable her to save more, allowing her to support her children in their schooling.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of cereals like rice for sale

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es:
Rosmery  vive en la calle Nanagua  de la zona de 16 de Julio en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Vive junto a su esposo y su pequeño de tres años de edad, en una habitación en la casa de sus familiares.

Se dedica a la venta de comida en la puerta donde vive, los días jueves y domingos, ya que estos días se realiza la mayor feria de la ciudad. Su esposo trabaja de albañil constructor.

El crédito lo destinará en la adquisición de insumos (carne, arroz, papa, verduras, etc.) para la preparación de sus platos. 
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Rosmery lives on the Calle Managua in the 16 de Julio zone in the city of El Alto. She lives with her husband and their little three year old in a room in the family home. She sells meals from the door in the house where she lives. She sells on Thursdays and Sundays; those are the days of the major fair in the city. Her husband works as a brick layer. The loan is to buy ingredients (meat, rice, potatoes, vegetables, etc.) for the preparation of her dishes. This is her first loan with Impro; the completed evaluation qualifies her for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martín se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche lo comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche). 

Como segunda ocupación se desmpeña temporalmente en la Federación de Lecheros de la Paz (FEDELPAZ), en el cargo de Presidente, cuya sede se encuentra en la ciudad de El Alto.

Su esposa se encuentra en su comunidad al cuidado de sus pequeños hijos, como también el ganado.
 
Vive. en la  localidad de Huacalla de la Provincia  Aroma del departamento de La Paz, ubicado  a  cuatro horas de la ciudad de La Paz.


El crédito lo destinara en la compra de una vaca lechera y así incrementar  la producción de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo
texts.en:
Martín raises cattle. He sells the milk to PIL Andina (Industrialized Milk Plant). As a second occupation he works temporarily in the Federación de Lecheros de La Paz (FEDELPAZ), in the office of the President whose headquarters are in the city of El Alto. You will find his wife in their community taking care of their small children and their livestock. He lives in the area of Huacalla in the Aroma province in the La Paz department, which is located four hours from the city of La Paz. The loan is to buy a milk cow and increase milk production, which will increase his income. This is his first loan with Impro. The completed evaluation qualifies him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy livestock

loans.name: Ezequiel

texts.es:
Ezequiel vive en la calle  Antofagasta de la zona  Pasankery de la ciudad de La Paz

Vive junto a sus hijos los cuales son mayores de edad y poseen sus propias familias. 

El actualmente es jubilado de la alcaldía, y trabaja como chofer asalariado de transporte publico en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El crédito lo destinara en la compra de materiales de construcción para la reparación de parte de su muro y techo de baño en su domicilio.
 
Es el tercer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Ezequiel lives on Calle Antofagasta in the Pasankery zone in the city of La Paz. He lives with children. They are grown and have their own families. He is currently retired from the town hall. He works as a salaried public transportation driver in the city of El Alto. The loan is to buy construction materials to repair part of a wall and the ceiling in the bathroom in his home. This is his third loan with Impro. The completed evaluation qualifies him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home Repairs

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo vive en la zona Bautista Saavedra, calle German Jordán  de la ciudad de El Alto.

Vive junto a su esposa y sus  hijos los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar, en su casita propia ubicada en una zona periférica de la ciudad.

La Pareja se dedica a la confección de overoles (ropa de trabajo de uso en fabricas, talleres etc.) los cuales vende en la ciudad de Oruro, y una pequeña parte los vende en la feria principal de la ciudad de el Alto..
 
El crédito lo destinara, en la compra de tela al por mayor y asi  incrementar su producción, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
 
Es el segundo  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Eduardo lives in the Bautista Saavedra zone in the city of El Alto. He lives with his wife and children who are of school age in a their own small house located in a zone adjacent to the city. The couple dedicates themselves to making overalls (clothing used in factories, garages, etc.), which they sell in the city of Oruro, and a small part is sold in the principal market of the city of El Alto. The loan will be used to purchase wholesale fabric to increase their production, and in that same manner their income. This is his second loan with Impro, and the evaluation carried out qualifies him to be approved for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital (to purchase wholesale fabric).

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto vive en la calle  12 de Octubre de la zona  Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz

Vive solo, ya que por circunstancias de la vida se separo de su esposa mucho tiempo atrás. 

El trabaja como chofer propietario de servicio publico en su automovil en una de las líneas centrales de la ciudad.

El crédito lo destinara para la reparación del motor,  ya que por el constante uso presenta fallas mecánicas que le impide realizar sus jornadas de trabajo normales. 
 
Es el segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Roberto lives in the Tembladerani zone of the city of La Paz. He lives alone given that due to personal circumstances he and his wife separated long ago. He works as a chauffer offering public transportation services in his automobile on one of the central routes of the city. The loan will be used to repair the motor given that is constantly suffers mechanical problems that prevent him from carrying out his normal workday routes. This is his second loan with Impro, and the evaluation carried out qualifies him to be approved for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair his vehicle’s motor.

loans.name: Olga Sofia

texts.es:
Olga  vive en la zona Mariscal Sucre, calle Miguel Angel Astoria  de la ciudad de El Alto.

Vive junto a su esposo, quien trabaja como patrullero en la policia Nacional,  y sus  hijos los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar, en su casita propia ubicada en una zona periférica de la ciudad.

La señora se dedica a la confección de ropa de algodón para bebes y niños, su producción lo realiza al por menor y sus ventas directamente al publico en la feria de la zona.
 
El crédito lo destinara, en la compra de lana al por mayor y asi  incrementar su producción, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
 
Es el segundo  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Olga lives in the Mariscal Sucre zone called Miguel Angel Astoria in the city of El Alto. She lives with her husband, who works as a policeman in the National Police, and her children who are school-aged in their own small house located in a zone adjacent to city. She dedicates herself to making cotton clothing for babies and children; her production is retail and she sells directly to the public at the regional market. The loan will be used to purchase wholesale wool to increase her production and in that way her income. This is her second loan with Impro, and the evaluation carried out qualifies her to be approved for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital (to purchase wholesale wool).

loans.name: Ceila Ines

texts.es:
Ceila vive en la zona Ballivián, calle Rafael Pavón  de la ciudad de El Alto.
Vive junto a su esposo y sus 2 pequeños hijos, en casa de sus familiares.

La Sra. Se dedica a la confección de ropa, trabaja junto a su esposo el cual también es confeccionista, temporalmente ejerce su otra profesión de auxiliar de enfermería, con el ciudado de personas ancianas en zonas residenciales de la ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito lo destinara  como capital de trabajo, en la adquisición de materia prima  y así aumentar su producción. 
 
Es el segundo  crédito con Impro y el segundo que va via Kiva la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Ceila lives in the Ballivián zone in the city of El Alto. She lives with her husband and 2 small children in her family’s house. She dedicates herself to making clothing; she works with her husband who also makes clothing. Temporarily she is working as an auxiliary nurse, taking care of the elderly in the residential areas of the city of La Paz. The loan will be used as work capital to acquire basic materials and in that way increase production. This is her second loan with Impro, and the second loan that is being channeled through Kiva; the evaluation carried out qualifies her to be approved for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital (to acquire basic materials).

loans.name: Rosario Alejandra

texts.es:
Rosario vive en la avenida Santísima Trinidad de la zona villa Cooperativa  en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Ella es soltera vive en casa de sus padres. 

Trabaja como enfermera auxiliar, en un hospital de la ciudad.

El crédito lo destinara  para continuar sus estudios superiores. 
 
Es el segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Rosario lives in the Cooperativa zone in the city of El Alto. She is single and lives in her parents’ home. She works as an auxiliary nurse in a hospital in the city. The loan will be used to continue her higher education studies. This is her second loan with Impro, and the evaluation carried out qualifies her to be approved for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital (which will be used to continue her higher education studies).

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Don Francisca nació en la localidad de Quinamaya, tiene 32 años de edad y trabaja haciendo envasando y vendiendo cocoa, el mismo que vende por popular  zona llamada Buenos Aires, ademas, viajando por el sud de Bolivia, Villazón, tupiza, Potosí, Oruro. Doña Francisca es soltera y no tiene hijos. Actualmente Doña Francisca vive en la casa que se encuentra en anticrítico con su hermana. 
Doña Francisca ha invertido su dinero en la compra de una selladora para envasar la cocoa en bolsas de 250 gr., además de comprar café por quintales y envasarlos para luego venderlos.
texts.en:
Francisca was born in Quinamaya, is 32 years old, and works packaging and selling cocoa; she sells this cocoa in a zone called Buenos Aires, in addition to traveling to the south of Bolivia to Villazón, tupiza, Potosí, and Oruro. Francisca is single and does not have children. Currently Francisca lives in a house with her sister on anticredito (a system by which the tenant pays a fixed sum considered a loan to the property owner which they receive back in full when the rental period is over). Francisca has invested her money in the purchase of a sealer to package the cocoa in 250 gr. bags, and she has also purchased coffee by quitanles (100 kg) and packaged them to be sold.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase four quintales (100 kg) of cocoa on occasion.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco  se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche lo comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche). 
También  trabaja como veterinario en su comunidad, realizando inseminaciones, venta de medicinas espacialmente para ganado vacuno.
 
Vive. en la  localidad de Pucarani, de la Provincia los Andes del departamento de La Paz, ubicado  a tres horas de la ciudad de La Paz.

Su esposa trabaja en el cuidado del ganado y como ama de casa,  junto a sus hijos. 
 
El crédito lo destinara en la compra de una vaca lechera y así incrementar  la producción de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
 
Es el tercer  crédito con Impro y segundo vía KIVA la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo
texts.en:
Francisco raises bovine cattle and sells their milk to the PIL Andina (Milk Industrializing Factory). He also works as a veterinarian in his community, carrying out immunizations, and selling medicines especially those for bovine cattle. He lives in Pucarani, in the Province of Los Andes, in the department of La Paz, located three hours from the city of La Paz. His wife works in the care of cattle and as homemaker in regards to their children. The loan will be used to purchase a milk cow and in that way increase milk production and their income. This is his third loan with Impro, and the second loan that is being channeled through Kiva; the evaluation carried out qualifies him to be approved for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
Felipe  vive en la calle Sorata  de la zona Villa Cooperativa en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Es soltero vive junto a sus padres en la casa de estos.

Trabaja como costurero en una fabrica de ropa juvenil en la ciudad de La Paz.

 El crédito lo destinara en la adquisición de materia prima y asi empezar su su propio negocio a poca escala en la producción  de poleras.
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Felipe lives on Sorata Street, located in the Villa Cooperative zone of the city of El Alto. He is single, and lives with his parents in their home. He works at a factory that makes children’s clothing, located in the city of La Paz. The loan would be destined for the purchase of raw materials, so he can start his own small-scale business making t-shirts. This is his first loan with Impro, and the evaluation conducted qualifies him to receive credit.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es:
Amalia es pequeña agricultora de hortalizas y productora de leche de vaca mismo que lo comercializa en la ciudad de La Paz vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos de 18, 15 y 13 años de edad mismos que también colaboran con el trabajo en el campo, es su principal fuente de ingreso con que se mantiene su familia. 

Vive en la comunidad Palomar (a dos horas y media de la ciudad de La Paz). 

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una vaca lechera de mediana calidad y incrementar la producción de leche.

Es el segundo crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago que demostró le permite acceder a otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Amalia is a micro-entrepreneur who grows vegetables that she then sells, along with her cow’s milk, in the city of La Paz. She lives in her own home with her three children, ages 18, 15 and 13. They collaborate with her in her farming activities, the primary source of income to support the family. She lives in the community of Palomar (2 ½ hours from the city of La Paz). The loan will be destined to buying a cow to increase milk production. This is her second loan with Impro, and her good standing with regard to her previous loan qualifies her for additional credit.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment capital.

loans.name: Francisco Pedro

texts.es: El señor Francisco tiene la actividad de sastre desde hace 15 años vive en la zona de las delicias  en Villa Fatima, esta casado tiene 5 hijos de diferentes edades todos en edad de estudiantes el cliente se dedica tiempo completo a su actividad; su esposa le colabora aportando a la familia con la venta de dulces y refrescos en la Avenida Las Americas de Villa Fatima donde parten los buses a la localidad de Caranavi, ahí tiene su puesto propio y vende todos los días; el señor Francisco tiene su casa propia la cual fue construyendo poco a poco con su trabajo y el de su esposa, las actividades principales del señor son la confección de trajes completos nuevos, el señor pide la tela a sus clientes los que la adquieren de acuerdo a sus gustos y preferencia posteriormente el señor Francisco saca su revista de moda y hace que el cliente se escoja el modelo una vez escogido, toma las medidas de su cliente, posteriormente comienza con el trazado y confección del traje, además de este tipo de trabajos, realiza el arreglo de trajes desgastados o descocidos o que necesitan algún tipo de reparación esta actividad la realiza en su taller - sastrería.
texts.en:
Francisco has been in the tailoring business for fifteen years. He lives in Las Delicias zone in Villa Fatima. He is married and has five school aged children. He works full time as a tailor. His wife contributes to the support of the family by selling sweets and soft drinks on the Avenida Las Americas in Villa Fatima at the bus stop in the Caranavi area. She has her own stand there, and she sells every day. Francisco has his own house, which he and his wife built little by little. He primarily makes complete new suits. He asks his customers for the fabric, which they get according to their likes and preferences. Then, Franciso takes out his fashion magazine and has the customer look for the style they want. Once selected, he takes the customers measurements. He later starts with the tracing and sewing of the suit. Besides this type of work, he also fixes worn or torn suits. He does all types of mending. He does this in his shop – the tailor shop.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To refund the "anticredico" (a system by which the tenant pays a fixed sum considered a loan to the property owner which they receive back in full when the rental period is over) on the house

loans.name: Maxima Remedios

texts.es:
Maxima trabaja como pequeña agricultora de hortalizas y productora de leche de vaca sus hijos apoyan en el cuidado de las vacas lecheras y el trabajo en las tierras de donde provienen sus ingresos económicos, con lo que cubre la manutención de sus tres hijos que dependen de ella.
 
Tiene su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad Palomar (a dos horas  de la ciudad de La Paz).

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una vaca  lechera de mediana calidad para incrementar la producción de leche.
 
Es el segundo  crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago que demostró en los anteriores créditos permite aprobarle el préstamo solicitado por el prestatario.
texts.en:
Maxima works a small vegetable farm and produces milk. Her children help her take care of the milk cows, and they help work the fields. This is the source of their income, which covers the living expenses of her three dependent children. She has her own house, which is located in the Palomar community (two hours from the city of La Paz). The loan is to buy a medium quality milk cow to increase milk production. This is her second loan with Impro. The good payment behavior she demonstrated on her previous loan allows her to be approved for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment capital

loans.name: Rafael Antonio

texts.en:
Rafael, 31 years old, is married and has two children, one recently born and the other in third grade. He has been working in carpentry for over 10 years, making rustic furniture. He has a large clientele base that is based out of San Lorenzo and Asunción. He started his business by himself, and it has now grown to include six employees in addition to himself.

Rafael has been working with the Fundación Paraguaya for over five years, and he thanks them for the support they give his business. With the current loan, he intends to buy wood for his furniture-making work.

loans.use: For the purchase of wood

loans.name: Vladimir Flavio

texts.es:
Vladimir trabaja como empleado de limpieza en el Aeropuerto internacional de El Alto es su ingreso con lo que mantiene a sus cuatro hijos que estan estudiante el colegio, tiene su casa propia ubicado en la  Zona Villa Tunari de la Ciudad de El Alto.


El crédito lo destinara para comprar de material de construcción para la refacción de su vivienda y culminar con la obra fina de una cuarto que la falta.
 
Es el cuarto crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago permite la aprobación el  préstamo solicitado por el prestatario.
texts.en:
Vladimir works as a custodian at the international airport in El Alto. His income supports his four children, who are in secondary school. He has his own home, which is located in the Villa Tunari area of El Alto. He will use this credit to buy construction materials so he can make repairs to his home and put the finishing touches on one of the rooms. This is his fourth loan with Impro, and he has a good payment record that allows him to qualify for it.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home repairs

loans.name: Adriana

texts.en:
Adriana M. S. owns a small grocery store. She is married and has three children and four grandchildren. Mrs. S. has experienced a life of many obstacles, as she lives with Lupus disease, her husband is bedridden, and her granddaughter was recently diagnosed with breast cancer. Two more of her grandchildren have just finished school, but as yet they have been unable to find work. As a result, Mrs. S. supports the entire family.

She has owned her small grocery store for over 25 years, and it is one of the family's main sources of income. Additionally, the family rents houses to people in the neighborhood. While she has a steady source of income, Mrs. S. explains that the money earned is barely enough to cover the medical and living expenses of the family.

Despite these difficulties, Mrs. S. has been a long-time client of the Fundación Paraguaya and is always prompt with her loan payments. She thanks the Fundación for their help, and asks for their continued support of her business and of her family.

loans.use: To purchase grocery-store merchandise

loans.name: Freddy Hugo

texts.es:
Freddy es tiene una movilidad de trabaja de trufi en la ciudad La Paz, es su principal fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención de su esposa y pequeño hijo de dos años de edad viven en la casa de sus padres ubicado en la  Zona Villa Ballivia de la Ciudad de El Alto.


El crédito lo destinara para la conversión de Gasolina a  GNV (Gas Natural de Vehiculo) mismo que le permitirá un ahorro del 40% en combustible.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada permite aprobarle el  préstamo solicitado por el prestatario.
texts.en:
Freddy has a taxi in the city of La Paz. It is his main source of income, which he uses to support his wife and two-year old son. They live in his parent's house, located in the Villa Ballivia neighborhood of the city of El Alto. The loan will be used to convert the vehicle from using gasoline to natural gas. This will allow him to save 40% on fuel. This is his first loan with Impro. The evaluation that has been done allows Impro to approve the requested loan for this borrower.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase engine parts to convert his taxi from using gasoline to natural gas

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es:
Filomena es productora D. leche mismo que lo comerciliza a PIL (planta Industrializado D. Leche) el esposo es chofer asalariado es su principal fuente D. ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención D. su familia.

Vive en casa propio ubicado en la comunidad Villandrani (a una hora y media D. la Ciudad D. El Alto).
 
El crédito lo destinara para comprar D. material D. construcción, en este momento solo cuenta con una sola habitación donD. comparten con sus cinco hijos.
 
Es el segundo crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento D. pago permite aprobarle otro  préstamo solicitado por el prestatario.
texts.en:
Filomena is a dairy farmer, and she sells milk to the industrialized milk plant. Her husband works as a wage-earning driver, which is the main source of income they use to support their family. She lives in her own home which is located in Villandrani (an hour and a half from the city of El Alto). This credit will be used to purchase construction materials. Right now their five children share one room. This is her second credit with Impro. Her good payment record allows her to qualify for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home repairs

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Mr. Jose R. earns his living by selling fishing accessories, which he and his father make from their home. He supplies his materials from Market 4 in Asunción, where he buys everything he needs to make these accessories.

Jose has a well-established clientele, which means that he does most of business through advance orders. Jose needs this loan for the purchase of materials that he will be able to buy in bulk for a lower price. He intends to buy leads, fishing line, poles, etc.

In the future, Jose wishes to be able to purchase a vehicle in order to better carry out his work.

loans.use: To purchase leads, fishing line, poles, etc.

loans.name: Genara Martha

texts.es:
Genara trabaja como pequeña agricultora de hortalizas y productora de leche de vaca mismo que lo comercializa en la ciudad de La Paz, es su  principal fuente de ingreso con que cubra la manutención de sus cuatro hijos que dependen de ella, vive en la casa de sus padre ubicado en la comunidad Palomar (a dos horas  de la ciudad de La Paz).

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una vaca  lechera de mediana calidad para incrementar la producción de leche.
 
Es el segundo  crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago que demostró en los anteriores créditos permite aprobarle el préstamo solicitado por el prestatario.
texts.en:
Genara works as a small vegetable farmer and producer of milk which she sells in the city of La Paz. This is her principal source of income with which she provides for the four children who depend on her. She lives in her parents' house which is located in the the community of Palomar (two hours from the city of La Paz). The loan is intended for the purchase of an average quality milk cow in order to increase milk production. This is her second loan with IMPRO. The good payment record which she showed with her previous loan will permit the loan she is currently requesting to be approved.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Evangelista

texts.en:
Mrs. Evangelista is 48 years old and married to Mr. Jose Falcon, with whom she has five older children. Evangelista owns a small grocery store and her husband sells charcoal on the street from a small cart. They wake up very early every day in order to travel to purchase merchandise in the Abasto Market in Asunción. 

Evangelista sells her merchandise to her neighbors and to neighborhoods close by. She has a very well established clientele in the area. 

In the future they would like to purchase a vehicle in order to better carry out their charcoal sales.

loans.use: To purchase rice, noodles, sugar, oil, meat, onions and potatoes for her grocery store

loans.name: Martha Silvia

texts.es:
Don Martha S. nació en la localidad yungueña D. Coroico, departamento D. La Paz, tiene 54 años D. edad y trabaja haciendo tortas, macitas, pasteles, etc., los que venD. a un grupo D. clientes selectos, además D. vender en tiendas y colegios. Actualmente tiene un hijo a su cargo, el mismo que estudia en la universidad ya que los otros ya son independientes, doña Martha está casada con don Felix Edgar R., el mismo que trabaja como chofer propietario D. radio taxi, además D. recibir una renta D. jubilación. 
Doña Martha invierte las utilidades D. su negocio D. repostería en la compra D. mercadería (ropa), el mismo que lo acomoda a crédito a los trabajadores D. algunas oficinas y a los jubilados.
texts.en:
Doña Martha S. was born in the area of Coroico in the department of La Paz. She is 54 and works making cakes, pastries, and other baked goods. She sells these to select customers, stores, and schools. She has one son who is still her dependent, and he is in college. Her other children are independent. Martha is married to Felix Edgar R., who works as a driver for Radio Taxi. He also receives a retirement income. Martha invests her profits from her baking business in the purchase of merchandise (clothing), which she sells on credit to office workers and retired people.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of an oven that accomodates four baking sheets

loans.name: Santiago Parada Group

texts.es: Las socias del grupo "Santiago Parada" esta representado Silvia y conformada por 12 miembros dentro los cuales presenta un parentesco familiar entre la señora Sonia y la señora Luz Marina que son hermanas, pero ambas tienen ingresos independientes. En general los socios se dedican a la venta de productos como cosméticos, zapatos, CDs, ropa y comida. Como en todo rubro comercial siempre existe la competencia de la oferta y la demanda de productos pero las socias saben como enfrentarlo, con trabajo y esfuerzo. El crédito esta destinado a la diversificación de los productos así como para la adquisición de materiales, insumos y herramientas que ayuden a generar mayores ingresos para el sustento de sus familias. A pesar que es un grupo relativamente nuevo los socios cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios gracias a su participación en entidades similares a la fundación Agrocapital quien les da un apoyo económico para sus proyectos de crecimiento.
texts.en:
The members of the Santiago Parada Loan Group are represented by Silvia. The group consists of twelve members, among whom there is a family relationship between Señora Sonia and Señora Luz Marina who are sisters but who have independent incomes. In general, the members are engaged in the sale of products such as cosmetics, shoes, CD's, clothing and prepared food. As in any business situation, there is the competition of supply and demand for products but the group members know that they must respond to this with work and effort. The loan is intended for product diversification such as for the acquisition of materials, ingredients and tools that will help to generate greater incomes for the sustenance of their families.
