Despite the fact that this is a relatively new group, they have experience in solidarity groups thanks to their particpation in entities similar to the Fundación Agrocapital which is giving them economic support for their growing projects.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating Capital

loans.name: El Pari Group

texts.es: Las socias del grupo "El Pari"  presentan  como parentesco familiar a la señora Evelin y a la señora Katherine ellas son hermanas con ingresos totalmente diferentes uno D. la otra, D. igual forma el señor Juna y la señora AyD. ambos también hermanos con ingresos independientes. Las socias D. este banco en su gran mayoría se dedican a la venta D. ropa, cosméticos y productos D. belleza por catálogos, ropa, celulares y productos al por mayor. Como en todo rubro comercial siempre existe la competencia D. la oferta y la demanda pero los socios cuentan con experiencia para salir adelante. Este crédito esta destinado para la compra D. mayor cantidad D. productos para poder competir en el mercado pudiendo así generar mayores ingresos para mejorar la calidad D. vida D. sus familias. Los socios van cursando su segundo ciclo demostrando capacidad para la administración D. fondos y para obrar con un grupo responsable y unido.
texts.en:
The members of the El Pari group have family ties with Evelin and Katherine, sisters who have incomes that are totally different from each other. The same is true for Juna and AyD., sisters with independent incomes. The majority of the members of this bank sell clothes, cosmetics, beauty products by catalog, cell phones, and wholesale products. As in all businesses, there is always some competition with supply and demand, but the group members have the experience to get ahead. This loan is to buy a greater quantity of products to be able to compete in the market. This way they will be able generate greater income to improve the quality of life for their families. The members are in their second loan cycle. They are demonstrating their capacity to administer funds and to work as a responsible, united group.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Comité Millenium Group

texts.en:
The Millennium committee started after the breaking up of another committee in the area. After canceling the credit, many of the women decided to get together again, despite the errors and wrongdoings of the previous committee, and began to start their work again.

The women in the committee work selling articles in the neighborhood where they live, from their respective homes as well as going door to door to offer their products. They are from the Santa María zone of San Lorenzo. The average loan that each one receives is 384,210 Gs, which will be invested in the purchase of articles for sale. 

Marina M. ..... Newspaper sales 
Francisca F. ..... Lottery ticket sales 
María C. ..... Small convenience store 
Olga A. ..... Small convenience store 
Petrona F. ..... Clothing sales 
Lida A. ..... Clothing sales 
Cirila B. ..... Lottery ticket sales 
Evelia F. ..... Newspaper sales 
Rosalina Q. ..... Charcoal sales 
Ursulina C. ..... Fruit sales 
Pamela G. ..... Clothing sales 
Dora F. ..... Fruit sales 
Lucia G. ..... Dressmaker 
Gladys B. ..... Newspaper 
Elsa G. ..... Food sales 
Rosa C. ..... Clothing sales 
Ana V. ..... Clothing sales 
María P. ..... Gift shop 
Luz P. ..... Clothing sales

loans.use: To purchase items for sale

loans.name: Giovanni Martin

texts.es:
Don Giovanni nació en la ciudad de La Paz, tiene 31 años de edad y trabaja como transportista en un radio taxi, don Giovanni actualmente se encuentra separado de su esposa, con la que tiene dos hijos. Don Giovanni ha invertido sus utilidades en la compra de otra movilidad, la misma que lo hace trabajar como radio taxi en la misma linea, percibiendo una renta diaria. 
Actualmente vive en anticrético con su hermana, el mismo que se encuentra a nombre de su madre.
texts.en:
Giovanni was born in the city of La Paz, is 31 years old, and works as a radio-taxi driver. He is currently separated from his wife, with whom he has two children. Giovanni has invested his profits in purchasing a second vehicle, which he likewise uses as a radio taxi that earns him a daily income. Giovanni currently lives in “anticrético” with his sister, which is under their mother’s name. [Note: “anticrético is a Bolivian rental agreement in which tenants pay their landlord a fixed sum rather than a monthly rent].

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing a bumper for his vehicle

loans.name: Orquideas Group

texts.es: El grupo "Orquideas" esta representado por la señora Yovannay presenta un parentesco familiar entre la señora Maria de Carmen y la señora Concepción son primas pero ambas cuentan con pequeños negocios propios. Una Gran mayoría de las socias integrantes se dedican a la venta de comida pero también a la venta de productos como ser ropa y cosméticos por catalogo. Dentro del mercado de venta de comida existe un elevado índice de competencia pero lo que rige es el sabor de la comida es por esta razón que los socios desean el crédito para mejorar sus locales y para la adquisición de mejores insumos para su cocina. El grupo se encuentra cursando su segundo ciclo demostrando honradez y responsabilidad en sus pagos.
texts.en:
The group "Orquideas" ["Orchids"] is represented by Yovannay. There is a family relationship between Maria de Carmen and Concepción. They are cousins but both have their own small businesses. The large majority of the members dedicate themselves to selling food but also to the sale of products such as clothing and cosmetics through catalogs. Inside the market of selling food, there is an elevated index of competition but what rules is the flavor of the food. It's for this reason that the members would like the loan, to improve their business places and to acquire better supplies for their kitchen. The group finds itself entering its second cycle, demonstrating honor and responsibility in their payments.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy capital for operations

loans.name: Fermina

texts.es: Fermina tiene 28 años, vive con su hijo de 4 años en casa de sus padres. Desde hace 5 años se dedica a la confección de ternos (conjunto de pantalón y saco de vestir), tiene como socios a unos familiares, con los cuales arrendó un puesto donde expone sus prendas, ahí también acondicionó su taller para poder trabajar y atender a los clientes durante todo el día, generalmente hasta las 7 de la noche. Los fines de semana, descansa para recuperar fuerzas y continuar con los pedidos durante el resto de la semana. Para el futuro, Fermina ve su negocio convertido en una gran empresa de confecciones, por lo que desea ir incrementando su producción poco a poco. Esta es la quinta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y el dinero que solicita será invertido en la compra de telas e hilos para la confección de los ternos solicitados.
texts.en:
Fermina is 28 years old. She lives with her 4 year old son in her parents' home. For the past 5 years she has sewn suits. Some of her relatives are partners in the business and together they rented a spot to display her clothing. She also set up her workshop there so she can work and attend to her customers all day, generally until 7pm. On the weekends, she rests to gather strength and then continue with orders during the rest of the week. In the future, Fermina envisions becoming a large clothing manufacturer, so she wants to increase her output little by little. This is the fifth time she has requested a loan from MFP and the money she is requesting will be used to purchase fabric and thread for suits on order.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Janet

texts.es: Janet tiene 29 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo en una casa arrendada. Desde hace 7 años ofrece el servicio de toma de fotografías, en especial del tipo de las solicitadas para diferentes trámites administrativos (tamaño carné y pasaporte). Atiende en su puesto todos los días, y algunas ocasiones le ayuda su esposo, su día de descanso son los domingos. Para llamar la atención de las personas tiene un mostrador de fotos en una calle muy transitada de su ciudad, una vez que consigue un cliente, lo conduce hacia su puesto (cerca de allí para tomarle la foto y luego de unos minutos entregarle la fotografía en la cantidad y tamaño que le haya solicitado. Debido a la calidad de sus  servicios, Janet mantiene ingresos estables, y esto la motiva seguir invirtiendo en su negocio. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y está muy contenta de ser parte de su banco comunal, por lo que se compromete a ser responsable en sus pagos y en sus funciones como integrante del grupo. El dinero solicita es para la compra de gran cantidad de papel fotográfico.
texts.en:
Janet is 29 years old. She lives with her husband and son in a rented house. For the past 7 years she has offered photography services, especially for administrative type photos (ID or passport sized). She works at her stand every day, and sometimes her husband helps out. She takes Sundays off. To attract customers she has a photo display set up on a busy street in the city. When she gets a customer, she takes him to her stand nearby, takes the photo, and then provides the quantity and size of photos requested a few minutes later. The quality of her work provides Janet with a stable income, and this motivates her to continue investing in her business. This is the first time she has requested a loan with MFP, and she is very happy to be part of her communal bank. For this reason she promises to be responsible with her payments and in her functions as part of the group. The money she is requesting is for the purchase of a large quantity of photographic paper.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of photography paper

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.es: La señora Saturnina es una cliente antigua de la instiucion,  es una cliente responsable y puntual, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, su venta la realiza en la feria 16 de julio, de la ciudad de El Alto , es una da las ferias mas concurridas de la ciudad de La Paz, su puesto esta ubicado en un lugar estrategico de la feria , la señora compra ropa a medio uso por fardos o por amarro.  Tiene un hijo de 10 años que esta estudiando, su esposo se dedica a la venta de zapatos cerca del puesto de su esposa.
texts.en:
Saturnina is a longtime customer of the bank, and is responsible and punctual. She sells used clothes in the 16th of July market in the city of El Alto. This is one of the most highly attended markets in the city of La Paz and her stand is very strategically located. She purchases used clothes in bundles. She has a 10 year old son who is in school. Her husband sells shoes at a stand near hers.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bundles of used clothing for sale

loans.name: Lina

texts.es: Lina tiene 37 años, vive con sus hijos en casa de sus padres. Desde hace más de 10 años se dedica a las confección de prendas de vestir, especialmente, moda para ejecutivos(as), en sociedad con unos familiares, instaló un puesto de ventas donde expone sus más clásicos y novedosos trajes ejecutivos, el cual es también su taller de confecciones. Periódicamente, Lina estudia algunos cursos para capacitarse en las últimas tendencias de estas prendas de vestir y poder elaborar mejores y modernos trajes. Para más adelante le gustaría expandir su mercado de ventas y llevar a vender sus prendas a otras ciudades. Por el momento, está aumentando su producción por la creciente lista de pedidos que ha obtenido. Esta es la quinta vez que Lina tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella es parte de un grupo solidario y reafirma su compromiso de seguir trabajando con una actitud positiva. El dinero que solicita estará destinado a la compra de telas por fardos, así como mayor cantidad de conos de hilos de diversas calidades y colores.
texts.en:
Lina is 37 years old. She lives with her children in her parents' home. For the past 10 years she has worked as a seamstress, especially designing formal fashions for executives. Along with some relatives, she set up a shop where she displays both classic and new suits for executives. The shop is also her workshop. Periodically, Lina takes training courses on the latest trends in formal clothing and to be able to create better and more modern suits. In the future she would like to expand her market and sell her clothing in other cities. For now, she is increasing her production due to an increase in orders. This is the fifth time that Lina has requested a loan through MFP. She is part of a united group and she reaffirms her commitment to continue working with a positive attitude. The money she is requesting will be used to purchase bolts of fabric as well as more spools of thread of different colors and quality,

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Las Autenticas Group

texts.es: El grupo denominado  “Las Autenticas” esta conformado por trece señoras que en su mayoría radican en la zona Elizardo Pérez D. la ciudad D. El Alto, la directiva esta conformada por la señora Juana,  Irene y Maruja que son presidenta , tesorera y secretaria del grupo. Los componentes del grupo en su mayoría se dedican a la venta D. cosméticos por catalogo, víveres, madera y ropa. El mercado D. oferta D. productos es altamente competitivo pera las socias saben como salir adelante ya que D. ello depenD. el sustento D. sus familias. El destino del financiamiento es para la adquisición D. mercaderías, materiales e insumos que ayuden a incrementar sus ingresos y a mejorar la calida D. vida D. sus familias.  Este grupo esta emprendiendo su tercer ciclo demostrando ser un grupo responsable, unido y con ganas D. crecer y salir adelante.
texts.en:
The "Las Autenticas" group (the Authentics) is maD. up of 13 women who mostly live in the Elizardo Pérez area of the city of El Alto. The directors are Juana, Irene and Maruja who are president, treasurer and secretary of the group. Most of the members of the group sell cosmetics by catalogue, food, wood, and clothing. The market for these products is extremely competitive, but the members know how to be successful, because supporting their families depends on it. This loan is for the purchase of merchandise, materials, and ingredients that will help increase their incomes and improve their families' quality of life. This is the third loan for this group and they have shown themselves to be responsible, united and full of desire to grow and be successful.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating Capital

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria tiene 46 años, vive con su esposo y su hija D. 16 en su casa propia. DesD. hace 5 años se dedica a L. venta D. ropa por pedido, sus principales clientes son sus amistades y vecinos, a quienes le lleva las prendas a sus respectivos domicilios, y en ocasiones, durante sus tiempos libres, su hija L. acompaña. Generalmente trabaja al crédito, y con esta modalidad obtiene mayores ganancias por cada prenda, según el tiempo y cuotas pactadas con cada cliente. Esta es L. quinta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, su permanencia ha sido una experiencia muy gratificante, ya que siempre ha promovido L. unidad en su banco comunal, lo que ha tenido muy buenos resultados. El dinero que está solicitando será invertido en L. compra D. mayor cantidad D. mercadería en prendas D. vestir.
texts.en:
Maria is 46 years old and lives with her husband and 16 year old daughter. For the past 5 years, she has maD. a living from selling clothes. Her main customers are friends and neighbors who bring home the items they buy. Sometimes during her free time, her daughter helps her with the business. She generally works by selling on credit, which has helped her earn higher profits depending on the time and amount of payments for each customer. This is her fifth loan with MFP. Her continuing experiences with MFP have been rewarding, not least because the bank has always promoted unity, but also because it has had good results. The money from this loan will be invested in the purchase of more clothes for her to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothes for resell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es: La señora Filomena trabaja  desD. el año 2005, empezó con un grupo solidario, y ahora trabaja individualmente, tiene su tienda en su propia casita, vive con su esposo, quien tiene su movilidad con la que trabaja como taxi, sus hijos ya son mayores D. edad e independientes. Es una cliente muy puntual y responsable, el crédtio será invertido en la compra D. abarrotes para la tienda y comprará también llantas para la movilidad del esposo.
texts.en:
Filomena has worked since 2005; she started with a solidarity group, now she works individually. She has a store in her own house, where she lives with her husband, who works as a taxi driver. Her children are already grown and independent. She is a very punctual and responsible client. Her credit will be invested in the purchase of groceries for the store, and also to buy tires for her husband's taxi.

Translated from Spanish by Cara Gutterman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of groceries (rice, pasta, flour) and tires for her husband's taxi

loans.name: Tilata Group

texts.es: El grupo denominado “Tilata” esta conformado por doce señoras que en su mayoría radican en la zona Tilata D. ahí su nombre, la directiva esta conformada por la señora AyD., Olivia Marisol y Rita Cecilia que son la presidenta, tesorera y secretaria del grupo. Los miembros del grupo se dedican a la venta D. diferentes productos como la comida, ropa, CDs., abarrotes y a la atención en puntos D. llamadas, tiendas D. barrio y a la confección D. chompas D. lana. Dentro del rubro D. oferta D. productos existe gran nivel competitivo es por esta razón que los socios requieren D. este crédito para poder hacer frente a la competencia con la adquisición D. materiales, insumos y herramientas que mejoren la calida D. sus productos para generar mayores  ingresos para el sustento D. sus familias. Este grupo esta emprendiendo su quinto ciclo demostrando honestidad y responsabilidad con sus pagos.
texts.en:
The group called "Tilata" is conformed by twelve ladies who live in the Tilata area. The direction is under Mrs. AyD., Olivia Marisol and Rita Cecilia, who are the president, treasurer and secretary of the group. The group members are engaged in the sale of various products like food, clothing, CDs and groceries trough neighborhood grocery shops, and the making of wool sweaters. The category of products that they are offering is highly competitive and it is why they need a loan in order to face competition with the acquisition of materials, supplies and tools that will improve the quality of their products to generate more income that will allow them support their families. It’s the fifth cycle of this group, demonstrating honesty and responsibility with their payments.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Lidia Mercedes

texts.es:
Lidia es socia del Bancomunal San Judas Tadeo.
Lidia es casada tiene 37 años, 2 hijos de 15 y 12 años que están estudiando en la escuela estatal 
Lidia tenia un negocio con su esposo de carpintería, pero hace dos años lo cerro por que su esposo viajo a  trabajar España, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, en el mercado, es ambulante y  ofrece a sus vecinos, los fines de semana vende comida en la puerta de su casa,
Desde que Lidia esta en Finca los créditos han ayudado a su negocio, le esta yendo muy bien. 
Lidia necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para comprar ropa y la preparación de sus comidas.
El sueño de Lidia es tener una boutique en su casa.
texts.en:
Lidia is a member of San Judas Tadeo Bancomunal. She is 37 years old, married and has 2 children who are 15 and 12 years old and go to a state school.

Lydia had a carpentry business with her husband, which she closed two years ago when her husband moved to Spain to work. She sells clothes in the market, and door to door to neighbors. She also sells meals on the weekends at the door of her house.

Finca loans have helped Lidia's business, she is doing very well. She needs a loan of $425 to buy clothes and prepare meals to sell. Her dream is to have a boutique at her home.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
"El hogar D. la Sra. Paticia C. D. A. esta compuesta por tres hijas, la hija mayor D. 16 años,7 y 1 año, actualmente se encuentra separada D. su esposo, es por esta razon que ella se constituye en el sosten D. su familia, presentando la necesidad  D. un credito para continuar apoyando a su familia y asi mejorar su calidad D. vida.  
La. Sra. Patricia C. D. A. presenta como activiadad la D. lavado D. automoviles en la zona donD. vive por con una antiguedad D. 2 años que atienD. con su hija mayor, ademas D. contar con una segunda actividad que es la atencion D. tienda D. barrio, requiere el credito por la necesidad que tiene D. ampliar su tienda con la compra D. cabinas telefonicas por la demanda D. las mismas.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            "
texts.en:
Mrs. Paticia C. D. A. has 3 daughters who are 16, 7 and 1 year old. She is currently separated from her husband and it’s for this reason that she became the provider of her family. She is asking for a loan to continue supporting her family and improve their quality of life.

Ms. Patricia has a car wash business in the area where she lives and which has run for 2 years with her oldest daughter. She has a grocery neighborhood store, as a second business and is asking for a loan to expand it with the purchase of phone booths that have a high demand in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase of phone booths and food for her grocery shop

loans.name: Lube Maria

texts.es:
Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=89357&_tpos=2&_tpg=1
Tiene una chacra de manzanas, en cañete.
Su negocio es de venta de frutas, que siembra en su chacra, también Lube  ha comprado un moto-car con lo cual brinda servicio de trasporte por su barrio, ha contratado a una persona para que maneje la moto . 
Lube necesita un préstamo de 2600 soles, para la compra de abono, insecticidas, repuestos para su moto- car  
Sueño tener su casa, y  le gustaría tener una tienda, para descansar de la chacra.
texts.en:
Her first loan is shown here: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=89357&_tpos=2&_tpg=1 She has an apple ranch in the city of Cañete. Her business is selling fruits, which she grows on her ranch. In addition, Lube has bought a car with which she provides transportation service in her neighborhood and has hired someone to drive the car. Lube needs a loan of 2,600 Soles to purchase fertilizer, incesticides, and spare parts for her moto-car. Her dream is to have her own house and would like to have a store, so that she can take a break from the ranch work.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and incesticides

loans.name: Estrellas Del Rey Group

texts.es: Los integrantes del grupo  “Estrellas del Rey”  están representados por la señora Maruja y compuesta por 12 miembros que en su mayoría se dedican a la venta de productos como zapatos, artesanías, gorras, celulares, ropa, abarrotes en tiendas de barrio y al servicio de electricista domiciliario. A pesar de sus escasos recursos y la competencia en el mercado de venta de productos siempre salen adelante impulsados por sus ganas de trabajar y su experiencia. El destino del crédito es principalmente para el incremento de capital de trabajo y la adquisición de mercadería, materiales, insumos y herramientas que ayuden a generar un mayor ingreso y por ende una mejor calidad de vida para sus familias. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia de los socios ya obtuvieron financiamientos en instituciones similares a la fundación Agrocapital conociendo la modalidad de trabajo grupal y demostrando responsabilidad y buen manejo de los fondos otorgados.
texts.en:
The members of the group "Estrellas del Rey" (Stars of the King) are represented by Mrs. Maruja. The group has 12 members, who mostly sell products such as shoes, handicrafts, hats, cellphones, clothes, and groceries in neighborhood stores, and who work as electricians for households. Despite their scarce resources and competition in the market, they always finish ahead, thanks to their desire to work and their experience. The loan will be used mostly to increase working capital and to acquire merchandise, materials, equipment and tools and will help generate more capital and consequently a better quality of life for their families. With regard to their experience with loans, they have already obtained financing from institutions similar to Agrocapital, showing how they work together as a group and demonstrating responsibility and good management of the funds granted to them.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
Candelaria es socia del Bancomunal San Judas Tadeo
Candelaria es casada tiene 51 años, cinco hijos de 28, 24,22,14 y 11 años que esta  estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Candelaria trabajaba llevando desayuno al municipio a los trabajadores, pero le empezaron a deber y dejo el negocio, se puso a vender en su casa tamales y ha repartir casa por casa. Y los fines de semana prepara comida para vender. 
Desde que Candelaria esta en Finca aprendió como trabajar mejor en su negocio.
Candelaria necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para la compra de maíz, azúcar, aceite para preparar tamales.
El sueño de Candelaria es abrir un restaurante en su casa.
texts.en:
Candelaria is a member the communal bank San Judas Tadeo. Candelaria is married and she is 51 years old. She has five children ages 28, 24, 22 14 and 11 years old. The 11-year-old and 14-year-old children are students at a public school. Candelaria used to make a living by selling breakfast to city workers, but they started to owe her too much and she left this business. Then she started to sell tamales out of her house. She make home deliveries to her costumers and on the weekends she prepares a variety of foods to sell. Candelaria needs a loan of $425 to purchase corn, sugar and oil to prepare tamales. Candelaria's dream is to open a restaurant in her home.

(Translated by Mariela of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase corn, sugar and oil to prepare tamales.

loans.name: Julia Juana

texts.es:
Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=89361&_tpos=1&_tpg=1
Julia continua con la venta de fruta de la estación  por cajones y también cocina comida chinchana, esta haciendo postres calientes por la temporada de frió.
Lo que le gusta del Bancomunal es  que se encuentra con sus amigas y los consejos de negocio de la promotora, le ayudan mucho.
Julia necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para comprar  cajones de fruta y preparar comida.
El sueño de Julia es techar su casa y abrir un restaurante.
texts.en:
Julia continues to make a living by selling fruits that are in season by the box. She also prepares a food to sell called "chinchana". She also makes warm deserts to sell during the cold season of the year. What she likes about being part of the communal bank is that she gets to meet up with her friends and the great business advice that she has been given their has helped her a lot. Julia needs a loan of $425 to buy boxes of fruit and to buy food to prepare and sell. Julia's dream is to put a roof on her house and to open a restaurant.

(Translated by Alexis of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy boxes of fruit and to buy food to prepare and sell

loans.name: 27 De Enero Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal denominado  “27 D. Enero” esta conformado por trece señoras que en su mayoría radican en la zona Alto San Pedro D. la ciudad D. El Alto, la directiva esta conformada por la señora Soledad Judith quien es la presidenta y las señoras Zenobia Judith y Maria Martha que son tesorera y secretaria. Los componentes del grupo son en su mayoría artesanas tejedoras D. mantas y vendedoras D. productos como cosméticos por catalogo, abarrotes en tiendas D. barrio,  ropas, comida, Cd y la atención en fotocopiadoras. El mercado donD. trabajan es altamente competitivo y es necesario contar con capital D. trabajo para poder obtener productos mas acorD. a las exigencias del mercado, es por esta razón que requieren del crédito para la adquisición D. mercadería, materiales, insumos y herramientas que ayuden a obtener productos D. mayor calidad y D. mayor demanda en el mercado y generen un mayor ingreso para poder brindarles a sus familias una mejor calida D. vida.  Este grupo va cursando su segundo ciclo demostrando responsabilidad y cumplimiento D. sus pagos contando con la confianza D. la fundación Agrocapital ya que demuestran las ganas para poder sacar adelante a sus familias.
texts.en:
The communal bank known as January 27th is comprised of 13 women, the majority of whom live in the Alto San Pedro zone of the city of El Alto. The group's leaders are Soledad Judith, who is the president, and Zenobia Judith and Maria Martha, who are the treasurer and secretary. The majority of the members of the group are artisans who weave blankets or they sell cosmetics out of catalogs, or groceries, meals, clothes, and CDs in neighborhood stores, as well as proviD. photocopying services. The market where they work is very competitive, and operating capital is needed to obtain products that will meet the demands of the people. Because of this, the women need a loan to purchase merchandise, materials, ingredients [for cooking meals] and tools that will help them get better quality products that are in greater demand and that will generate a better income so that these women can proviD. their families a better quality of life. This is the group's second loan [with Kiva partner Agrocapital] and they have demonstrated responsibility and maD. their payments on time [and maintained] Agrocapital's trust. They have shown that they are earning money and supporting their families.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operations capital

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 34 años, su principal motivación son sus tres hijos y sus padres, con quienes vive, ya que debido al abandono de su pareja atravesó diversas dificultades que sólo supo afrontar con el apoyo de su familia. Desde muy joven trabajó en diversas actividades, pero desde hace 7 años se dedica a la venta de ropa de forma ambulante en el mercado de su distrito, lugar que es muy concurrido, pero donde también hay más delincuencia, por lo cual trata siempre de tomar las precauciones necesarias. Además, vender en la puerta de los mercados no es tarea fácil, ya que tiene que instalar su carpa desde muy tempranas horas, debido a que las personas visitan los mercados generalmente por la mañana y vende hasta las tres de la tarde para después regresar a casa para atender a sus hijos. El deseo de Carmen es comprar un puesto dentro del mercado para dejar de exponerse al peligro, tener mayor seguridad y estabilidad económica en su negocio. Los años que lleva trabajando en su banco comunal le dieron la oportunidad de crecer económicamente, y este cuarto crédito la ayudará a mejorar y la posibilidad de seguir trabajando con sus compañeras, con quienes tiene muchos proyectos para realizar en su grupo, como organización. Con los 1800 soles que solicita adquirirá mayor cantidad de mercadería en prendas para la temporada de invierno.
texts.en:
Carmen is 34 years old. She is mainly motivated by her three sons and her parents, with whom she lives. Being abandoned by her partner has caused her to go through various difficulties which she could only face with the help of her family. Since being very young she has worked in various fields, but for the last seven years she has worked selling clothing, moving about in her district market - a place that is very crowded but that also has more delinquency, which is why she always tries to take the necessary precautions. Moreover, selling in the entrance to the markets is not an easy task since she has to set up her awning very early because people generally visit the market in the morning. She sells until 3:00 in the afternoon and after that returns home to take care of her children. Carmen's wish is to buy a stall inside the market so she can stop exposing herself to the danger, have better security, and have economic stability in her business. The years that she has working in her community bank have given her the opportunity to grow economically and this fourth loan will help her to improve and provide the possibility to continue working with her companions with whom she has many projects to carry out as a group, such as organization. With the 1800 soles that she is requesting she will acquire a larger quantity of clothing merchandise for the winter season.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her merchandise

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=89362&_tpos=1&_tpg=1
Su negocio es de venta de todo tipo de bebidas entre cerveza, gaseosas  y golosina, le deja mas ganancias, no se malogran.
Lo que le gusta del Bancomunal, es que aprendió ahorrar y ha querer tener otros negocios.
Alejandrina necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles, para surtir su negocio y comprar 20 cajas de cerveza,
El sueño de alejandrina es que su negocio siga creciendo
texts.en:
First loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=89362&_tpos=1&_tpg=1 Her business is in the sale of all types of drinks amongst them beer, soft drinks, and sweets; in this business she earns more and her merchandise doesn’t spoil. What she likes about the Communal Bank is that she has learned how to save money and to want to have other businesses. Alejandrina needs a loan of 1,600 PEN to stock her business and to purchase 20 boxes of beer; Alejandrina’s dream is that her business continues growing.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her business, and to purchase 20 boxes of beer.

loans.name: Víctor

texts.es: Víctor tiene  38 años, su mayor anhelo es ver progresar a su familia, a quienes trata de brindar los mejores cuidados y atenciones dentro de su casa. El negocio que viene desarrollando desde hace 9 años  es la venta de abarrotes en la tienda que  instaló en un local alquilado en una zona muy comercial. Sin duda, dedicarse a este rubro le ayudó a mejorar su vivienda y a ofrecer a sus hijos estudios de calidad. Empieza su trabajo realizando la limpieza del local desde muy temprano, debido a que debe atender a los clientes  que hacen sus comprar muy temprano, por ello, don Víctor trata de estar con las puertas abiertas desde las 6 de la mañana. Es así, que junto a su esposa, atiende su negocio hasta la media noche, tomando precauciones, ya que en las noches hay más ventas pero también mayor peligro por la delincuencia. Para un futuro cercano, Víctor quiere instalar otra tienda en su vivienda, como una sucursal de la principal. Los cinco años que tiene trabajando con MFP en su banco comunal ha sabido desenvolverse  con responsabilidad, al igual que todas sus compañeras, por lo que han hecho de su grupo uno de los más confiables y organizados de la institución. Con los 2000 soles que solicita incrementará su mercadería, además de comprar algunos exhibidores para sus productos.
texts.en:
Victor is 38 years old. His greatest desire is to see his family get ahead. He tries to provide them with the best care and attention within his home. He has been selling groceries for 9 years in the store he set up. It is in a rented place in a very commercial area. With out a doubt, working in this trade helped him improve his house and offer his children quality schooling. He begins work early by cleaning the store. He must wait on customers that shop early so Mr. Victor tries to have the doors open by 6 in the morning. He tends to his business, together with his wife, until midnight. He is careful since there are more sales at night but also greater danger due to delinquency. Victor wants to open another store in his home, like a branch of the main store, in the near future. He, as well as all his co-workers, have known how to manage themselves responsibly at their community bank in the five years he has been working with MFP. This has made his group one of the most trustworthy and organized in the institution. He will increase his merchandise with the 2000 PEN he has applied for, as well as purchasing some display cases for his products.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise and purchase display cases

loans.name: Otilia

texts.es:
Otilia es socia del Bancomunal San Judas Tadeo.
Otilia es casada tiene  44 años, tres hijos de 29, que esta trabajando y los de  15 y 6 años que están  estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Otilia siempre se dedico a su casa, pero por la salud de su hijo que sufría de los bronquios le empezó a dar medicinas  naturales   y como eran caras , ella decidió empezar a vender hace cuatro años.
Desde que Otilia esta en Finca, le gusta como ayudan a que las mujeres salgan adelanté con un negoció y son ayudan para su familia. 
Otilia necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles, para la compra de productos medicinales naturales, por que la venta es al contado.
 El sueño de Otilia es crecer en el negocio y salir a vender a provincias.
texts.en:
Otilia is a member of the Communal Bank San Judas Tadeo. Otilia is married, 44 years old, and 3 children, one who is 29 and working and two who are 15 and 6 years old who are studying in the state school. Otilia always dedicated herself to her home, but due to her son’s health who suffered from bronchial problems she began to give him natural medicines, and because these medicines were expensive she decided to start selling them four years ago. Since Otilia has been with Finca she has enjoyed how the organization helps women get ahead with a business and provide help to their families. Otilia needs a loan of 1,400 PEN to purchase natural medicine products to sell for cash. Otilia’s dreams are to expand her business and to travel to sell to other provinces.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase natural medicine products to sell for cash.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen  es socia del Bancomunal San Judas Tadeo
Carmen  es casada tiene 41 años, tres hijos de 23, 19 y el ultimo de 6 años que esta en la escuela estatal.
Carmen  por años se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo  y ahora  esta trabajando  en una panadería que su hermano ha abierto, ella se encarga de administrar ver todo lo que falta.  
Desde que Carmen esta en Finca aprendió a desenvolverse, ha expresar lo que siente por que era muy callada.
Carmen necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles para la compra de una vitrina y compra productos de belleza.
El sueño de Carmen es ver su casa terminada con acabados.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the Communal Bank San Judas Tadeo. Carmen is married, 41 years old, and has 3 children ages 23, 19, and the last who is 6 years old is in the state school. For years Carmen has dedicated herself to sale of beauty products through a catalog, and now is also working in a bakery that her brother has opened; she is in charge of managing to ensure that nothing is lacking. Since Carmen has been with Finca she has learned to come out of her shell and to express what she feels because she was a very quite person. Carmen needs a loan of 1,200 PEN to purchase a display case and beauty products. Carmen dreams of seeing her home completely finished.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a display case and beauty products.

loans.name: Maravillas De Sur Group

texts.es: El grupo denominado  “Maravillas del Sur” esta conformado por 15 socias que en su mayoría radican en la zona San Luís Zongo D. la ciudad D. El Alto, la directiva esta conformada por la señora Eduartina,. Virginia Maria y Alejandra Natty que son presidenta, tesorera y secretaria del grupo. Los componentes del grupo se dedican a actividades como la venta y confección D. matas tejidas a mano, ropa deportiva, verduras, pan, comida frazadas y la elaboración D. muebles D. madera. Los rubros D. venta D. los pequeños negocios del grupo son altamente competitivos pero ellos saben como salir adelante ya que D. ello depenD. el sustento D. sus familias. El destino del financiamiento es para compra D. materiales, insumos y herramientas que ayuden a hacer frente a la competencia con productos mejor elaborados y D. mayor calidad. Este grupo esta cursando su tercer ciclo con la institución demostrando capacidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos.
texts.en:
The group named “Maravillas del Sur” (Wonders of the South) is maD. up of 15 members. Most of the members live in the neighborhood named Luis Zongo in the city of El Alto. The leaders of this group are Eduartina, who is the president, Virginia Maria, who is the treasurer, and Alejandra Natty, who is the secretary of the group. The members of the group make a living selling a variety of items and by making handwoven mats and sports clothing. They also make wooden furniture pieces, prepare foods, make blankets and sell fruits and vegetables. All of these activities are highly competitive and the money from the loan that they are requesting will help this group to buy the materials, ingredients and tools that will allow the members to outsell the competition by having products that are better maD. and of high quality. This group is in its third cycle of loans with the institution. They are demonstrating their ability and responsibility to make timely payments on the loans that they take out.

(Translated by Alexis of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for Businesses

loans.name: Katy Ana

texts.es:
Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=89365&_tpos=1&_tpg=1
Katy es socia del Bancomunal San Judas Tadeo
Katy  siempre le gusto el negocio, ella tuvo que trabajar con su mamá vendiendo comida,  donde aprendió ahora da pensión a las obras constructoras  en Lima y en provincia, lamentablemente todavía  tiene que seguir viajando dando menús a provincia, peor ella sabe que este año su sueño se hará realidad.     
Katy necesita un préstamo  de 2000 soles, esta arreglando su casa para hacerla restaurante, 
El sueño de Katy es poner un restaurante en su casa.
texts.en:
To view Katy Ana's first loan, click: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=89365&_tpos=1&_tpg=1 Katy is a member of the San Judas Tadeo Communal Bank. Katy has always liked business; she had to work with her mother selling meals, where she learned [what she needed to know] to now provide meals to the construction work sites in Lima and the surrounding area. Regrettably, she has to continue traveling, providing her meals to the outskirts. But, she knows that this year her dream will become reality. Katy needs a loan of 2000 soles. She is preparing her house to operate a restaurant [out of it]. Katy's dream is to have a restaurant in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operate a restaurant out of her home

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
For the past 8 years, Luisa has operated her family-run pet supply business out of the weekend flea market in San Jose with help from her husband Garrett and, occasionally, their teenage daughter. Luisa currently specializes in bird cages and accessories, toys and supplies for dogs, and cages, food and supplies for hamsters, guinea pigs and rabbits. 

Recently, when the aquatic supply business next door to Luisa’s shut down, Luisa decided to jump at the chance to expand her business and begin selling fish and aquatic life merchandise. But buying all the inventory for the new product line is expensive and she also needs a new store awning and sign to better advertise her store. A $3,500 loan will help Luisa purchase the new inventory and the new signage and awning and greatly increase her store’s sales and foot traffic.

loans.use: Purchase of awning for storefront and inventory

loans.name: Maria Cecilia

texts.es:
Maria  es socia del Bancomunal San Judas Tadeo.
Maria es casada tiene 36 años, dos hijos de 15 y 8 años que están estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Maria tiene una tía que se dedica ala venta de vinos y su tía la animo a que entre al negocio ella se animo  a vender y le  esta yendo bien  vende 80 botellas semanales.
Desde que Maria esta en  Finca aprendió a trabajar con el préstamo, a invertir, su negocio ha crecido. 
Maria necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para comprar botellas de vino, bidones de vino en chincha.
El sueño de Maria es tener un restaurante.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Bancomunal San Judas Tadeo (San Judas Tadeo Communal Bank). Maria is married and is 36 years old; she has two children aged 15 and 18 that are studying in the public school.

Maria has an aunt who sells wines and her aunt has inspired her to enter the same career. She is motivated to sell and her sales are good, selling 80 bottles each week.

Since Maria joined Finca she has learned how to work with the loan and how to invest, her business has grown. Maria needs a loan of 1200 soles to buy bottles of wine and barrels of aging wine. Maria’s dream is to have a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To puchase bottles of wine and barrels of aging wine.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=89366&_tpos=1&_tpg=1
Ana tiene su  continua con su tienda de venta ropa para dama y caballeros.
Lo que le gusta Ana del bancomunal es el compañerismo y que ha aprendido muchas cosas para su negoció.
Ana necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, para la compra de ropa , para su tienda.
El sueño de ana es tener una tienda propia, la que tiene es alquilada.
texts.en:
First loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=89366&_tpos=... Ana continues to have her store selling women’s and men’s clothing. What Ana likes about her community bank is the companionship. She also likes that she has learned many things for her business. Ana needs a loan for 2,000 PEN to buy clothes for her store. Ana’s dream is to have her own store. The one she has now is rented.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes for her store

loans.name: Virgen De Cotoca 1 Group

texts.es: El grupo “Virgen de Cotoca I”  esta cursando su primer ciclo, esta conformado por  15 participantes  pertenecientes al barrio santa lidia su  mesa directiva esta conformado por las señoras Felipa que es la presidentas, Elisa tesorera y Heidy Liliana secretaria. A pesar de ser su primera participación en la institución las socias ya estaban juntas en entidades similares a la fundación Agrocapital conociendo la modalidad de trabajo en equipo, y demostrando ser responsables y con ganas de trabajar juntas para salir adelante.  Los miembros de este grupo realizan diferentes actividades como la venta de refrescos, ropa, comida, material escolar, carne y también realizan actividades de soldadura, transporte publico de pasajeros y la agricultura. La competencia en el rubro a la cual se dedican los socios es grande pero las ganas de trabajar y de salir adelante los pone en campaña para ser mas competitivos a través del crédito otorgado con el que podrán contar con un capital de trabajo que ayude a en la adquisición de materiales, insumos y herramientas para generar un mayor ingreso que apoye en el desarrollo de sus pequeños negocios y de sus familias.
texts.en:
The Virgen de Cotoca I group is in their first loan cycle. The group is made up of fifteen members who live in the Santa Lidia neighborhood. Their executive board members are Felipa, the president; Elisa, the treasurer; and Heidy Liliana, the secretary. In spite of this being their first participation in the institution, the members have already been together in similar entities at the Agrocapital foundation. They know the way to work as a team. They demonstrate responsibility and have the desire to work together to get ahead. The group members have different businesses such as selling soft drinks, clothes, meals, school supplies, and meat. They also perform tasks from welding to public transportation of passengers and farming. The competition in the area that the members work is big. But, the desire to work and get ahead puts them on a campaign to be more competitive. They do this via the loan, which they count on for working capital to acquire materials, supplies and tools to generate greater income. This will support the development of their small businesses and their families.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
Teofila es socia del Bancomunal Paz y Desarrollo.
Teofila es madre soltera tiene  64 años,  6 hijos, todos son mayores. 
Teofila es de Huancavelica ella empezó vendiendo medias, casacas llevando a provincia, por varios años hasta que le robaron todo y se quedo sin capital. Una amiga le invito a que participara como socia de Finca, y pudo empezar nuevamente vendiendo ropa, también empezó a ayudar en  un comedor popular allí recibió clases de pastelería, actualmente hace pasteles al por mayor y vende ropa.     
Desde que Teofila esta en Finca, aprendió ahorrar, con sus ahorros pudo comprar su refrigeradora. 
Teofila necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles para harina, manteca, azúcar y ropa. 
 El sueño de Teofila es tener una pastelería
texts.en:
Teofila is a member of the Paz y Desarrollo Community Bank. Teofila, 64, is a single mother, and she has six grown children. Teofila is from Huancavelica. She started taking socks and jackets to the province and selling them. She did this for various years until everything was stolen, and she was left without capital. A friend invited her to participate as a member of Finca. She could start selling clothing again. She also started to help in a popular dining room where she received cake making classes. She currently makes cakes to sell wholesale, and she sells clothes. Since Teofila has been in Finca, she has learned to save. She was able to buy a refrigerator with her savings. Teofila needs a loan for 3,000 PEN for flour, shortening, sugar, and clothes. Teofila’s dream is to have a pastry shop.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, shortening, sugar, and clothes

loans.name: Lorenza Mercedes

texts.es:
Lorenza es socia del Bancomunal Paz y Desarrollo
Lorenza es casada tiene 57 años, tres hijos de 36, 33, 26 años, ellos son independientes.
Lorenza  empezó haciendo dulces encáramelados, después puso una cafetería pero quedaba muy lejos y gastaba mucho pasaje, decidió mudarse, por su casa pero esta vez puso una bodega  vende abarrotes
Desde que Lorenza esta en Finca, aprecio ahorrar y al cierre de cada ciclo tiene su  dinero para invertirlo.  
Lorenza necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles, para la comprar arroz, azúcar, leche aceite. Para su bodega. 
El sueño de Lorenza es tener una librería y una fotocopiadora.
texts.en:
Lorenza is a member of the Bancomunal Paz y Desarollo (Communal Bank of Peace and Development). Lorenza is married and 57 years old; she has three independent children aged 36, 33 and 26.

Lorenza began by making caramelized sweets, later she established a small snack bar but lived far away from it and it was a long travel to her business. She decided to move her business into her home, this time selling groceries.

Since Lorenza has been a member of Finca she has learned how to save and at the end of each cycle she has the money to invest. Lorenza needs a loan of 3000 soles to buy rice, sugar, milk and oil for her store. Lorenza’s dream is to have a bookstore and a photocopier.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: for the purchase of rice, sugar, milk and oil

loans.name: Las Kantutas Group

texts.es: El grupo las “Kantutas” esta conformado por 3 hombres y 12 mujeres este banco es  bueno ya que esta dirigido y bien organizado a la cabeza del señor Bernardino quien es su presidente, la señora Seneida Tesorera y la señora Rinia Susana secretaria, todos pertenecientes al barrio Mineritos. Responsables del sustento D. sus familias los miembros D. este grupo realizan diferentes actividades como   la venta D. bebidas, abarrotes en tiendas D. barrio, ropa, pan, comida y al servicio D. transporte en motocicletas.  El crédito solicitado esta destinado a la compra D. mercadería, materia prima y a la reparación D. sus maquinarias D. trabajo que ayuden a generar mayores ingresos para poder brindarles a sus familias una mejor calida D. vida. Los miembros D. este grupo van cursando su segundo ciclo demostrando puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos por lo que cuentan con la confianza D. nuevos financiamientos.
texts.en:
The "Kantutas" group is maD. up of 3 males and 12 females. This well organized bank is highly regarded and is managed by the minds of señor Bernardino, the president, señora Seneida, the treasurer, and señora Rinia Susana, the secretary. They all live in the Mineritos neighborhood. All of the group members are responsible for supporting their families and engage is different activities such as selling drinks, groceries, clothing, bread, and food in the neighborhood stores and providing transportation via motorcycle. The loan will be used to purchase merchandise and raw materials and to repair machinery used in their lines of work. The loan will help to increase their incomes and allow them to proviD. their families with a better quality of life. The members of this group have repeatedly demonstrated punctuality and responsibility in making the payments of their second loan and are confident they will do so with their new financing.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
Zoila  es socia del Bancomunal Paz y Desarrollo.
Zoila es casada  tiene 63 años, cuatro hijos, ya son independientes.
Zoila  empezó con Finca con los prestamos, haciendo tamales por pedidos, y buffet criollos, trabaja con su hija.  Tiene su esposo que esta con cáncer al hígado su negocio bajo un poco por que tiene que atender a su esposo.   
Desde que Zoila esta en Finca, con la inversión,  pudo empezar a construir su casa y hacerle los acabados, gracias a sus  ganancias.  
Zoila necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para compra de  tamales, hoja de plátano, arroz para la preparación de su buffet.  
El sueño de Zoila es poner un restaurante
texts.en:
Zoila is a member of the communal bank Peace and Development. Zoila is married and is 63 years old, has four children that are now grown and live independently. Zoila started with the organization Finca by getting loans for her business. She makes tamales by taking orders, and making Creole Buffets. Zoila works with one of her daughters. Zoila's husband has Liver Cancer and her sales have decreased a little because she has to take care of her husband. Since Zoila has been in Finca, with the investment, she has been able to build a house and also complete the finishing touches thank to the earnings that she has been able to make. Zoila needs a loan of $350 to buy tamales, banana leaves and rice for the preparation of her buffets. Zoila's dream is to start her own restaurant.

(Translated by Sonia of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tamales, banana leaves and rice for the preparation of her buffets.

loans.name: Dionicio

texts.es: El Sr. Dionicio M. M. Tiene la actividad de mecánico de reparación de chapas, bisagras y levanta vidrios de automóviles, el mismo solicito un créditos para la compra de herramientas nuevas para su taller que atiende por mas de 10 años en la zona el cual es el medio de sustento para el y su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Dionicio M. M. is a mechanic that repairs the bodywork, hinges and windshields of automobiles. He solicits a loan for the purchase of new tools for his workshop which he has run for more than 10 years in his area. This is the primary means of income for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purpose of the loan is to puchase new tools for his workshop.

loans.name: Toribia Norma

texts.es:
Toribia es socia del Bancomunal Paz y Desarrollo
Toribia es casada tiene 65 años, siete hijos ya son mayores y están casados.  
Toribia  tiene una amiga que tiene su deposito D. gas y la animo a vender  en su casa, ella ambiento su patio y se ha puesto a vender  gas, gaseosa, cerveza y los fines D. semana venD. anticuchos en la puerta D. su casa.
DesD. que Toribia esta en Finca ha podido logra muchas cosas, y aprendió ahorrar.
Toribia necesita un préstamo D.  2000 soles, para una vitrina para vender hojas, El sueño D. Toribia es volver a tener su librería
texts.en:
Toribia is a member of the Paz and Desarrollo Community Bank. Toribia is 65 and married. She has seven adult, married children. Toribia has a friend who she sells containers of gas. The friend encouraged Toribia to sell from her house. She set up her patio and has started selling gas, soft drinks, and beer. On the week ends she sells kebabs from the door to her house. Since Toribia has been in Finca, she has been able to achieve many things, and she has learned to save. Toribia needs a loan for 2,000 PEN to buy a display case to sell sheets of paper sold by the unit. Toribia’s dream is to return to having a book store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: a display case to sell sheets of paper sold by the unit

loans.name: Encarnaciona Jovina

texts.es:
Encarnación es socia del Bancomunal Paz y Desarrollo
Encarnación es casada tiene  53 años, dos hijos de 30 y 24 años que trabajan
Encarnación cuando se caso su esposo ya tenia su carpintería, elle decidió trabajar junto a el, ella se encarga de las compras, la  especialidad de su carpintería es sillas de madera, tiene local propio.   
Desde que Encarnación esta en Finca, le enseñaron ahorrar  y ganamos los fines de ciclo. le gusta reunirse con sus amigas. del Bancomunal.
Encarnación necesita  1400 soles, para la compra de madera, caoba, cola, lija.
El sueño de Encarnación es tener una mueble de muebles.
texts.en:
Encarnación is a member of the communal bank called "Paz y Desarrollo" (Peace and Development). Encarnación is married, is 53 years old, has two kids, 30 and 40 years old that both work. Encarnación's husband has a carpinter shop and when she married him she started working with him. She was put in charge of buying materials. They own the space that they run the carpinter shop out of. Since Encarnación has been in Finca they have taught her how to save money and run the business better. She likes to get together with her friends from the communal bank. Encarnación needs a loan of $475 (1,400 Soles) to buy mahogony wood, glue and sandpaper. Encarnación's dream is to have her own furniture store.

(Translated by Sonia of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy mahogony wood, glue and sandpaper.

loans.name: Huracan Group

texts.es: El grupo “Huracán” esta conformado por 4 hombres y 11 mujeres  a la cabeza D. su presidenta la señora Griselda y las señoras Mercedes y Martha que son la tesorera y secretaria del grupo,  este banco se caracteriza por ser uno D. los mejores ya que demostraron ser responsables y siguen creciendo juntos es así que cada una D. ellas va invirtiendo en sus pequeños negocios D. venta D. comida, cosméticos por catalogo , ropa y sus actividades D. elaboración D. pan, transporte público, servicio D. peluquería y constructores D. vivienda. El crédito que solicitaron fue para  la compra D. materia prima para la elaboración D. sus productos así como la adquisición D. materiales y herramientas que hagan mas eficiente sus actividades generando mayores ingreso que ayuD. a mejor la calidad D. vida D. sus familias y ser mas competitivos en el mercado
texts.en:
The group “Huracán” [“Hurricane”] is comprised of 4 men and 11 women. At the head of their organization is the president, Griselda, the treasurer, Mercedes, and the secretary, Martha. This bank is characterized by being one of the best since they demonstrated they are responsible and continue to grow. It’s in this way that each one of them invests in their small businesses of selling food, cosmetics through catalogs, and clothes and their activities of making bread, public transportation, hairdressing services, and homebuilding. The credit that they requested was for buying raw materials to make their products, such as the acquisition of materials and tools that make their activities more efficient and help generate greater profits. This helps to improve the quality of life of their families and makes their businesses more competitive in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for Operations

loans.name: Adelinda Yobana

texts.es:
Adelinda es socia del Bancomunal Paz y Desarrollo.
Adelinda es conviviente tiene 1 hijo de cinco años que  esta en la escuela estatal.
Adelinda  trabajaba en una fabrica pero la fabrica cerro, se quedo sin trabajo y empezó a vender zapatillas, animada por su suegra ella tiene un  puesto en la Av. Grau. 
Desde que esta en Finca, aprendió cosas buenas, como ahorra , ha logrado comprarse un terreno. 
Adelinda necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, para comprar zapatillas en Grau.
El sueño de Adelinda es tener un puesto propio, vende en el puesto de su suegra.
texts.en:
Adelinda is a member of the Bancomunal Paz y Desarrollo (Communal Bank of Peace and Development). Adelinda and her partner have one 5 year old son who attends the public school. Adelinda worked in a factory but the factory closed, leaving her with no job. She began to sell shoes, finding inspiration in her mother-in-law who has a place on Av. Grau.

Since Adelinda has been a member of Finca she has learned good things such as saving. She has managed to buy a plot of land. Adelinda needs a loan of 2000 soles in order to buy shoes on Grau Avenue. Adelinda’s dream is to have her own place; currently she sells her merchandise in her mother in law’s place.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase shoes for her business.

loans.name: Maria Angelica

texts.es:
Maria  es socia del Bancomunal Paz y Desarrollo
Maria es casada tiene 38 años tres hijos de 18 esta en la universidad del estado, los de 17 y 12 años están en la escuela estatal.
Maria estudio partería un año, se compro un horno a gas y se ha puso hacer pasteles al por mayor, reparte por su barrio a las tiendas, envía a provincia , también esta enviando a  familiares y amigos que tiene en Estados Unidos. 
Desde que Maria  esta en Finca, le gusta la manera que tienen para hacerle ahorra  les alientan a no tener miedo para empezar un negocio, o para pedir un préstamo. 
Maria  necesita un préstamo de  3000 soles, para la compra de una moto-car al contado.
El sueño de Maria exponer una fuente de soda en su casa.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the communal bank "Paz y Desarrollo" (Peace and Development). Maria is married, is 38 years old and has 3 children, ages 18, 17 and 12. The 18-year-old is a university student and the 17 year-old and 12-year-old are students at public schools. Maria studied midwifery for a year. To start her business she purchased a gas oven and began making pastries and she started selling them in bulk to stores in her neighborhood. Her pastries were also sent to stores in outlying areas and to family members and friends that she has in the United States. Since Maria has been in Finca she has really liked the way that they have to help people manage their money well and to motivated them to not be fearful to start a business or to ask for a loan. Maria needs a loan of $1025 (3,000 Soles) to be able to buy a moto-car. Maria's dream is to start a soda shop in her home.

(Translated by Sonia of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a moto-car.

loans.name: Luz Jackelin

texts.es:
"La Sra. Luz Jackelin P. M., tiene como actividad economica la preparacion de jugos, batidos y venta de productos Herbalife, oficina que atiende todas las mañanas de Lunes a Sabado.
La Sra. actualmente es la persona que mantiene y sustenta su hogar ya que se encuentra separada de su esposo, es por esta razon que solicitó el credito para ampliar su clientela."
texts.en:
Luz Jackelin P. M. makes a living by making and selling juices, smoothies and by selling Herbalife products. She goes to the Herbalife office every morning from Monday through Saturday. Presently she is the breadwinner for her family since she is separated from her husband. She is requesting a loan so that she increase her clientelle.

(Translated by Alexis of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The money from the loan will be used to invest in more products to sell.

loans.name: Quintin Carlos

texts.es: El  señor carlos es un cliente antiguo de la institución esta en su secuencia 10 y tiene 0 dias de atraso en su ultimo credito, se dedica al servicio de la amplificación tiene gran cantidad de amplificadores y dos cabezales, su mercado son las fiestas de matrimonios, bautizos y fiestas de zona. sus dias de contrato son los fines de semana empieza desde el dia jueves y termina el dia domingo, la esposa del señor Carlos se dedica a la elaboracion de colchones en su mismo domicilo y los distribuye en la zona 16 de julio y caja de El Alto, en el departamento de La Paz; el señor Carlos y su esposa lucia tienen tres hijos que estan estudiando, el destino del credito sera invertido en la compra de rampas o fierros para la colocacion de juego de luces.
texts.en:
Carlos is an old client of this institution [Emprender]. This is his 10th loan and he has had 0 missed payments. He works in the sound amplification industry and has a large amount of amplifiers. He markets to wedding receptions, baptisms and other local parties and he is contracted on the weekends, from Thursday to Sunday. Carlos’s wife makes blankets and comforters from their home and delivers them in the 16 de Julio region and the El Alto neighborhood in La Paz. Carlos and his wife Lucia have three children who are in school. This loan will be invested in the purchase of metal to use to hang his lighting sets.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: lighting sets

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad says every day is wonderful because she spends it in the company of children. She has been running her in-home day care center since 2003, but her experience extends decades back. She is married and is the mother of three grown children.

Trinidad received a loan from ACCION USA to make improvements to her in-home day care. She is refinishing her floors, painting and purchasing some new toys and practical items for the children. As a licensed day care provider, she is required to make these improvements. 

With the help of her daughter, Trinidad would like to one day open a larger day care outside of her home where she can make an even greater impact on her community.

loans.use: New flooring and paint for her home-based business as well as new toys and playpens

loans.name: Fatima Ivone

texts.es:
La señora Fátima Ivone vive con su esposo y tienen 2 hijas de edad escolar, ella trabaja para una parroquia en el puesto de secretaria, su cónyuge es cartero puesto que desempeña desde hace 16 años.
Tienen un proyecto de realizar una mejora a su nuevo hogar ya que la casa que tenían como patrimonio lo perdieron con la desgracia del tornado y la inundación en Villa de Fuente; ante tal situación su papa le regalo esta casita para que ella al igual que su familia tuvieran un hogar, lugar donde le hacen falta detalles. 
Por el momento desean construir un nuevo cuarto y ultimar las acabados interiores y exteriores, motivo por el cual están solicitando este crédito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatima Ivone lives with her husband and their 2 school-age children. She works for the church parish as a secretary and her husband has been a mailman for the past 16 years. They are working on some home improvements for their new house. They unfortunately lost their old house to the tornado and flooding of Villa de Fuente. When confronted with that situation, her father gave them this small home so that she and her family would have a place to live. This home is lacking a few details—at the moment they would like to add on a room and finish the interior and exterior, which is why they are asking for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Adulfo

texts.es:
El señor Adulfo es albañil independiente al igual que su hijo quien contribuye al ingreso familiar.
La esposa de don Adulfo se encarga del hogar y trabaja en una empresa como operadora en el área de producción.
Juntos como la familia unida que son están tramitando este crédito para realizar  la construcción de una barda en el frente de su casa para mayor  independencia y seguridad del hogar.
texts.en:
Adulfo is an independent bricklayer, along with his son who also contributes to this family business. Adulfo’s wife takes care of their home and works as a production operator for a local company. They are a united and close-knit family who are asking for this loan in order to build a fence in front of their home, to create more privacy and security for their home.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a security fence

loans.name: Juanita

texts.es:
La señora Juanita vive con su esposo el señor Ariel y su familia esta integrada por dos hijos en edad escolar. Ella labora para una guardería en el área de pedagogía, su esposo trabaja en una institución médica en el departamento de conservación desde hace 20 años. 
Ellos le han ido realizando poco a poco mejoras a su casita pero el proyecto que tienen  en este momento es la colocación del vitropiso, y por esta razón es que están solicitando este crédito.
texts.en:
Juanita lives with her husband Ariel and their 2 school-aged children. She works as a teacher in a daycare and her husband has worked in the Conservation Department of a medical institution for the last 20 years. They have slowly been making improvements to their small home and their current project is buying and laying floor tile, which is the reason they are asking for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: floor tile

loans.name: Mark

texts.en:
For 15 years, Mark worked in architecture offices as a graphic designer, producing websites and scale images of architecture projects. He liked the work, but the jobs were inconsistent and had long dry spells that were difficult to manage. Mark knew that he could do it better as his own boss, so in late 2008 he decided to start his company, Urban Digital.

Urban Digital specializes in marketing and visual tools for builders and architect engineers. With a degree in architecture and many years of experience, Mark is an expert at producing technical images, websites, marketing kiosks and other materials that architects need. But getting started is hard, especially given the high upfront cost of all the hardware and technical software he needs to complete the projects he is pitching to clients. With a $7,000 loan from Opportunity Fund, Mark will be able to make these purchases and truly get his business up to speed. 

Mark is saving money right now by running the business out of his home, but his goal is to bring in enough clients that he can hire employees and establish a real office.

loans.use: Hardware and technical software

loans.name: Ysmael

texts.es:
El señor Ysmael y su esposa la señora Guadalupe son originarios de Tabasco, pero tienen en esta ciudad mas de 8 años, se vinieron a esta frontera buscando salir adelante trabajando. 
Ahora don Ysmael a pesar de ser un padre de familia joven de dos niños el y su esposa son personas muy trabajadoras. El esta trabajando en una empresa muy bien establecida, día a día luchando por salir adelante, y por tal motivo el esta solicitando este crédito para la ampliación de un cuarto y asi obtener mayor comodidad de su familia.
texts.en:
Ysmael and his wife Guadalupe are from Tabasco, but they have been living [in Piedras Negras] for more than 8 years. They came to this border area looking for better work opportunities. Ysmael and his wife are very hard workers even though they are the parents of two small children. He is working for a well-established company, fighting every day to get ahead. They are asking for this loan to add on a room so their family will be more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Room addition

loans.name: Enier Oniel

texts.es: Enier Oniel es casado, de 24 años de edad, agente vendedor de Tienda El Verdugo, trabaja sin horario, pues tiene que visitar toda la region incluyendo San Carlos, Rio San Juan.  Su esposa Hellen Hernandez de 23 años trabaja en la Procuraduria de Derechos Humanos y lo apoya con los gastos del hogar, tiene un horario de Lunes a Viernes de 8 a 5 de la tarde, no tienen hijos, en su casa les apoya una tia.   Desea utilizar el credito para comprar materiales de construccion para una tapia y compra de protectores de puertas y ventanas para de esta manera dar un poco de seguridad a la vivienda y a la familia.  Ellos son una pareja de jovenes esforzados, pues quieren tener condiciones en el hogar para luego traer a los hijos.
texts.en:
Enier Oniel is married, 24 years old, and works as a salesman for the store El Verdugo. He does not have set hours and works throughout the region of San Carlos, Rio San Juan. His wife, Hellen Hernandez, is 23 years old and works in the Human Rights Attorney's Office and helps with the household expenses. She works Monday to Friday from 8 to 5 in the afternoon. They do not have children and take care of an aunt in their house. They would like to use the loan to purchase construction materials to build a wall and purchase protective covers for their windows and doors to provide extra security for their dwelling. They are a dedicated young couple who would like to have a safe dwelling to raise children in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials to build a wall

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Juan Manuel  vive con su esposa la señora Elvia y son padres de tres hijos,
El trabaja en una empresa bien establecida y su esposa labora para una maquiladora con una antigüedad de 2 años. Son originarios de la ciudad de Veracruz pero se vinieron a esta frontera para salir adelante, para poder obtener un mejor estilo de vida para ellos y su familia. 
Ellos están tramitando este crédito para la construcción de una barda en la parte trasera de su vivienda para tener una mayor seguridad y privacidad;por esta razón están solicitando este crédito.
texts.en:
Juan Manuel lives with his wife Elvia and their three children. He works for a well-established company and his wife works for a maquiladora that has been in existence for two years. They are originally from Veracruz but came to the border to achieve a better life for themselves and their family. They are requesting this loan in order to build a wall in the rear of their house that will afford them greater security and privacy.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a wall behind their house

loans.name: Milciades Omar

texts.es: Milciades es casado, de 28 años de edad, tiene 2 hijas, una estudia el 1er grado de primaria y una recien nacida de 20 dias, trabaja en el Banco de Finanzas de Juigalpa en Servicios Bancarios, con 4 años de servicio, su esposa de 25 años deedad no trabaja, cursa estudios universitarios, ademas de su salario tiene un incentivo de C$.3,600, la ayuda de U$.100.00 dólares mensuales que recibe de un hermano que esta en el extranjero, y ademas se dedica a la venta de celulares que le envia su hermano donde obtiene alguna ganancia.  Esta solicitando credito para comprar 5 protectores para las ventanas de su casa para dar mayor seguridad a la familia, pues estas son con aluminio y vidrio y son muy fragiles.  Se le conoce como un joven responsable, trabajador y cumplido con sus obligaciones, se siente muy contento por la oportunidad que la institucion le esta brindando y manifiesta que una vez cancelado el credito continuara pidiendo otro para lograr el sueño de tener una vivienda digna y segura.
texts.en:
Milciades is married and 28 years old. He has two daughters, one in first grade and a 20-day-old newborn. He has worked in the Bank Services department of the Banco de Finanzas de Juigalpa for four years. His 25-year-old wife is not working while she studies in the university. In addition to his salary, Milciades earns a bonus of C$3,600, receives an additional US$100 a month from a brother who lives in the United States, and also earns some money selling the cell phones his brother sends him. He is requesting this loan in order to buy bars for the windows of his house to give his family greater security. The windows are made of aluminum and glass and are very fragile. He is known to be a responsible, hard-working, and conscientious young man. He is very happy about the opportunity the institution is providing, and says that once he has repaid the loan he will request another in order to achieve his dream of having a decent, safe home.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase building supplies

loans.name: Walter Danilo

texts.es: Don Walter es Licenciado en Administracion de Empresas, casado, de 41 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos (2 estudian la primaria, 1 universidad y una niña de 14 meses de nacida).
