Trabaja en el Super San Antonio como Gerente Comercial con 19 años de servicio con un horario de 8 a 5 de la tarde todos los dias de la semana, ya que es socio del negocio que es familiar, ademas tiene transporte selectivo de servicio de taxi donde obtiene una utilidad cada mes, su esposa trabaja en el INTA desde hace 8 años y aporta a los gastos del hogar.Esta solicitando su credito para la compra de materiales y pago de mano de obra para la construccion del techo del porhce de su casa de habitacion, el costo total de la obra es mucho mayor que el credito solicitado, pero el asumira la diferencia.  Es conocido en la ciudad como una persona honesta, resposnable y cumplido con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
Walter studied business administration. He is married and 41 years old, and has 4 children (two in elementary school, one in the university, and one 14-month-old daughter). He works as a manager in the Super San Antonio grocery store. He has been working there for 19 years from 8 to 5 every day, since he's a partner in the business, which is owned by his family. He also has a taxi service from which he earns some income each month. His wife has worked for INTA for 8 years and contributes to domestic expenses. He is requesting a loan to pay for materials and labor in order to build a roof for the porch of his house. The total cost of the project is much more than the loan requested, but he will cover the difference. He is known in the city to be an honest, responsible, and conscientious person.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building a porch

loans.name: Castulo Alfonso

texts.es: Castulo Alfonso, es casado de 56 años de edad, casado,  trabaja en el Super San Antonio desde hace 19 años con horario de 8 a 5 de la tarde todos los dias de la semana, ya que es socio del negocio que es familiar, cuenta con otros ingresos de servicio de taxi y por venta de leche. Esta solicitando su credito para la construccion de un porche de su casa de habitacion de 50 mts cuadrado, el costo total de la obra es mucho mayor que el credito solicitado, pero el asumira la diferencia.
texts.en:
Castulo Alfonso is married and is 56 years old. He has worked in the Super San Antonio for 19 years from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. every day of the week since he is a member of the family business. He gains other income from his taxi service and through selling milk. He is requesting his loan for the construction of a porch for his home that will be 50 meters square. The total cost of this work is much more than the loan he is requesting, but he will assume the difference.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To construct a porch

loans.name: Bertha Aurora

texts.es: La profesora Bertha Aurora es pensionada y también esta laborando para el gobierno de nuestra ciudad, ella vive solita ya que sus todos hijos ya son mayores de edad y radican en otra ciudad, ella es propietaria de esta vivienda a la que desea realizarle estas mejoras tales como impermeabilización y colocación de piso de concreto; motivo por el cual ella esta tramitando este crédito.
texts.en:
The professor, Bertha Aurora, is a pensioner and also is working for the government of her city. She lives alone since all of her children are already older and settled in another city. She is the owner of a home to which she wishes to make improvements such as waterproofing it and installing a concrete patio; the motivation for which she is applying for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To waterproof her home and build a concrete patio in the back of her house

loans.name: Fidelia Paola

texts.es: Fidelia Paola es soltera, tiene 34 años dedad con una hija de 4 añitos estudiando el pre-escolar, trabaja en els Super San Antonio desde hace 11 años como impulsadora de ventas, con un horario de 12 horas de Lunes a Domingo, con un dia libre el Martes, tiene la ayuda del padre de su hija quien le da un aporte de C$.100.00 quincenales.  Esta solicitando su 7mo credito el que destinará para la compra de 2 puerta y 3 ventanas para asegurar su vivienda, la que no pudo concluir con el credito anterior.  Expresa sentirse satisfecha con la atencion que la ha brindado AFODENIC, pues gracias a los creditos que le han brindado ha llegado a cumplir un poco el sueño de su vida como es tener una vivienda digna para su hija.
texts.en:
Fidelia Paolo is single and is 34 years old with a four-year-old daughter who is in preschool. She has worked at Super San Antonio for 11 years as a promoter of sales. She works for 12 hours a day, Monday through Sunday, with a day off on Tuesday. She has the help of the father of her daughter who gives her support in the amount of 100 NIO biweekly. She is requesting her seventh loan, which she will use to buy 2 doors and 3 windows to secure her home, which she couldn’t finish with her previous loan. She expresses that she feels satisfied with the attention that AFODENIC offers her. Thanks to the loans that they have offered her, she has begun to achieve a bit of her life’s dream to have a worthy home for her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy doors and windows

loans.name: Yesenia Esmeralda

texts.es: Yesenia Esmeralda S. R. de 28 años de edad reside en el departamento de Ahuachapán junto a su pequeño hijo de apenas tres años de edad. Ella posee un cafetín en el Centro Médico de Ahuachapán, en el cual los empleados de dicho centro médico le pagan semanal o quincenal los alimentos que ella les provee. Yesenia cuenta con muy buena reputación en el lugar como una persona muy activa y trabajadora, la cual brinda un excelente servicio. Ella solícita un préstamo para poder comprar más suministros para su negocio, ya que como madre soltera necita trabajar arduamente y obtener mayores ganancias para ofrecerle una mejor vida a su hijo, debido a que ella es la única que vela por su hogar, necesita invertir en su negocio para obtener mayores ganancias lo cual puedo lograrlo a través del préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Yesinia Esmeralda S. R. is 28 years old. She lives in the Ahuachapán region with her little three-year-old son. She owns a small café in the Ahuachapán Medical Center. The employees of this medical center pay her weekly or every two weeks for the food she supplies them with. Yesenia has a very good reputation there as an active and hard-working person. She provides excellent service. She is applying for a loan to purchase more supplies for her business. As a single mother she needs to work arduously and obtain greater earnings to offer her son a better life. Since she is the only one who watches out for her home, she needs to invest in her business to gain greater profits. She can achieve this with the loan she has applied for.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase food

loans.name: Gloria Natali

texts.es: Gloria Natali D. L. O D. D. 23 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Santa Cruz Michapa en el departamento D. Cuscatlán, vive junto a sus padres y tres hermanos. A pesar D. ser muy joven elL. posee una librería y una venta D. tarjetas para recargar saldo a celulares. Gloria solícita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más papel para su negocio como así también más tarjetas para hacer recargas a celulares, cabe mencionar que esto último ha venido a tener una gran demanda en los últimos años y es un negocio muy gratificante si se cuenta con una cantidad granD. D. tarjetas. Gloria desea mejorar su negocio, ya que es D. esta manera como elL. logra solventar todos sus gastos personales.
texts.en:
Gloria Natali D. L. O D. is 23 years old. She lives in the town of Santa Cruz Michapa in the Cuscatlán region. She lives with her parents and three brothers. Although she is very young, she owns a bookstore and sells cards to recharge cell phones. Gloria is applying for a loan to be able to buy more paper for her business as well as more cards to recharge cell phones. It is worth mentioning that this last activity has come to be in great demand the last few years. It is a very gratifying business if you have a large number of cards. Gloria wishes to improve her business since this is how she manages to cover all her personal expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of paper goods and cell phone cards

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es: Juan Antonio A. C. de 64 años de edad, reside en Santo Domingo, departamento de San Vicente. El vive solo, ya que recientemente se separo de su compañera de vida y está empezando una nueva etapa de su vida. Juan Antonio tiene más de 26 años de vender billetes de lotería, negocio con el cual ha logrado sustentar todos sus gastos. El vende sus billetes de manera ambulante en el parque central de Ilobasco y con el tiempo ha contratado dos personas más para que le ayuden en el negocio. Juan solicita un préstamo, con el fin de poder comprar más billetes de lotería.
texts.en:
Juan Antonio A. C. is 64 years old. He lives in Santo Domingo, San Vicente region. He lives alone since he recently separated from his life partner and he is starting a new life. Juan Antonio has been selling lottery tickets for more than 26 years. He has managed to cover all his expenses with this business. He sells his tickets as a street vendor in the central park in Llobasco. Over time he has hired two more people to help him in the business. Juan is applying for a loan in order to purchase more lottery tickets.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase lottery tickets

loans.name: Juancito Pinto Group

texts.es:
En la zona de Villa Tejada se encuentra ubicado el centro focal del mismo nombre, a este pertenece la asociación comunal “Juancito Pinto” formado por doce integrantes que trabajan junto a Pro-Mujer hace mas de un año.
Casadas en su mayoría, afirman que los ingresos de sus esposos no solventan los gastos diarios que tienen en sus familias, por ello se vieron en la necesidad de buscar una actividad que sea rentable para apoyar económicamente a sus parejas.
Diversas son las actividades de este grupo; Se dedican a la panadería, venta de cosméticos por catalogo, realizan viajes a pueblos cercanos llevando ropa de invierno para su posterior comercialización, también venden material de construcción, entre otros. La asociación Juancito Pinto desea comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería para poder aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
In the area of Villa Tejada you will find the center called Villa Tejada. It belongs to a communal association called "Juancito Pinto", formed by twelve members who have worked together at Pro-Mujer for more than a year. Mostly married, they affirm that the incomes of their husbands do not cover the daily expenses of their families, and that therefore they were seen in need of seeking out a profitable activity to be able to support their partners economically. The group activities are diverse; they work at the bakery, selling cosmetics by catalog, taking trips to nearby towns carrying winter clothes for later sales, and they also sell building material, amongst other things. The association Juancito Pinto wants to buy a greater quantity of merchandise to be able to increase their sales.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Lupita

texts.en:
As a single mom, Lupe had to cope with her son’s diagnosis of neurofibromatosis on her own. After she learned how to give him daily massages to relieve his pain, Lupe realized how much she enjoyed massage and helping people heal. She enrolled in massage school, graduated, and opened DayDream Therapy, her own massage and wellness center. While there have been setbacks – her computer and massage table were stolen – her business has thrived. 

Lupe now needs a $5,000 loan to replace her equipment and expand her business. In addition to serving her own clients, Lupe provides office space, mentoring and training to three single moms who are just starting to build their practices. Lupe’s goal is to help these moms establish their businesses and provide for their families. Lupe also performs free massages for victims of domestic violence, donates profits to children charities and helps with many local fundraising events. She is a hardworking mother who is dedicated to helping others. 
Visit http://www.daydreamsmassage.com/

loans.use: Replace stolen computer and massage chair

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria, a single mother of two, has always loved children. She received her degree in child psychology and worked in the field for more than 35 years before moving to California and opening her own daycare.

In 2008, Maria got her first loan from Opportunity Fund and opened a daycare in her home. Today she cares for three children and focuses on educational activities such as memory games, shapes and color recognition, alphabet sounds and letters. 

Maria is ready to care for more children, but needs to invest in more supplies to do so. With an $8,000 loan, Maria will be able to purchase new equipment and educational supplies and to buy a computer and printer. 

Maria is going back to get her preschool teacher certification and expand her business.

loans.use: Computer, printer, educational supplies

loans.name: Barrio Lindo Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de El Alto se encuentra el centro focal Villa Tejada  a éste pertenece, la asociación “Barrio Lindo”, integrada por doce mujeres ansiosas de progresar en sus pequeños negocios.
La actividad principal en la asociación es el comercio, venden ropa para niños, chompas tejidas en lana, comida, mantas de lana de vicuña, artefactos eléctricos, abarrotes, verduras y otro tipo de mercadería dependiendo de la temporada. Productos que los ofrecen en distintas ferias de la ciudad. Ellas precisan capital para incrementar su mercadería  de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para sus familias.
texts.en:
In the city of El Alto there is a center called Villa Tejada, "Barrio Lindo" association belongs to this center. The association is formed by twelve women anxious to progress with their small business. The main activity of the association is sales, they sale children's clothes, wool sweaters, food, vicuna wool bed sheets, electronic devices, groceries, vegetables and other types of merchandise depending on the season. They offer these products on different markets in the city. They need working capital to increase their merchandise and therefore produce more income for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: 09. Đông Sơn (10.13.09) Group

texts.en:
Châm Lê Thị (251) is a 41 year-old female living in the town of Đông Sơn.  Châm is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 09. Đông Sơn (10.13.09).

Châm is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To making a living, Châm owns and operates a general store selling mostly daily use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste to the local community.  Châm has been in this business for over one year and earns approximately 1.500.000 VND a month.

Châm joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women in 2008 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Châm has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1.626.900 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  She is now requesting her second loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women, in the amount of 1.626.900 VND, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  Châm plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:
1.  Lê Thị Gấm (241) is a 34 year-old female who is requesting a 1.626.900 VND loan to support her business operating a butcher shop.
2.  B. Thị M. Thư (240) is a 32 year-old female requesting a 1.626.900 VND loan to support her business running a general store.
3.  Lê Thị Hiền (236) is a 31 year-old female who is requesting a 1.626.900 VND loan to support her business making and selling food.
4.  Đỗ Thị Gái (237) is a 55 year-old female requesting a 1.626.900 VND loan to support her business running a food stall.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:
The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Elemmelic

texts.en:
Elemmelic B. is 26 years old and still single. She and four family members happily live in the rural village of Baranggay Tandul, Cabatuan, Isabela. Their village is well irrigated and rice farming is their major source of income. Elemmelic gladly shared that, through her business, she is able to assist her parents in sending her sibling to school. 

Elemmelic is requesting to borrow PHP 9,000. She will use the loan for the improvement of her general store which she has operated for more than two years. She also believes that bringing out the best could be the best motivating factor to become successful someday.

loans.use: To improve her general store

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is 45 years of age and married to Sonny A. Sr. They are blessed with five children: Aries is 23 years old; Aileen is 21 years old; Sonny A. Jr. is 18 years old; Stephanie is 11 years old; and Lovely Ann is 8 years old. Her family is peacefully residing in Barangay Tandul ,Cabatuan, Isabela.

Esterlita has her own vegetable garden in her family’s farm. She works hard to generate income from selling her vegetables. She wants to help her children finish their studies by working very hard and always being patient in pursuing her business. She herself was not able to finish a high level of education but is grateful now that, despite the hardship of life, she manages to send her children to school.

Esterlita is requesting a loan of PHP 13,000 as additional capital. She promises to utilize the loan wisely towards the improvement of her business and to further support her children’ needs.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca manages a simple store in their village. She displays her products just in front of their house since she does not have a permanent store yet. She is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 11,000 for her business to enable it to grow and become stable someday.

Francisca is 55 years old and is already a widow. She has five children and is thankful that they support her in times of crisis. Her youngest is still studying while her second youngest works as a housemaid. Some of them are already married.

Francsica hopes that Kiva will allow her to increase her income so that she may give her two youngest children a better living. They are humbly living in the peaceful Barangay of Tandul, somewhere in Cabatuan, Isabela. She is thankful that her store has worked well so far because it is very important to her and her family. She promises to work hard to expand her business and become a productive ASKI-Kiva client for her family.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en:
Oyunchimeg T. is a widow living with her 13-year-old son in Arhangay province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Her 13-year-old son is a student in a local high school.

She has a small retail business in second-hand clothing. She started selling second-hand clothes for women and men in 2002 at the local black market in Arhangai province. She frequently travels to Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, and purchases cheap second-hand clothes from the wholesale markets there.

Since the beginning of her business in 2002, she has done well and gained significant experience in retailing second-hand clothes at the local market. She says that she works hard for her son. She would like to make sure that her son grows up without any serious financial strains. She requests a loan to purchase more second-hand clothes from Ulaanbaatar for her business.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco C. is already 52 years old and is married to Marcelina. They are blessed with four children, namely: Jenalyn - 25 years old, married; followed by Jessmer - 22 years old, who works as saleslady; next to her is Jonalyn - 18 years old, a high school graduate; and Mel John - 14 years of age, a high school student. They are peacefully living at Barangay Tandul of Cabatuan, Isabela. It is a rural place and about two kilometers away from the national highway. 

Francisco has managed a business making vinegar and soy sauce in their village for almost twenty years. He delivers the products to his clients in their village and nearby villages but mostly operates a village store. He earns a weekly net income of PHP 3,000 which he uses for the maintenance of their hog-raising and for basic necessities at home. Some of their income also is invested in the education of his youngest child.

Francisco is requesting the amount of PHP 9,000 for his business to enable further growth and to give his family a better living.

loans.use: To enable further growth of his business

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda manages a village store in Tandul, which is in the municipality of Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 42 years old and is married to a farmer named Joel A.. They have a son named Mark Dexter, who is five years old. Their main source of income is farming, but Imelda’s store is a great alternative source of income that provides her family with many of their basic needs.

Imelda is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 13,000 for her store. She hopes that through the loan she will able to increase the weekly income she earns from the business.

“Share a little love whenever you can” is the quotation that Imelda uses to share blessings with others, she said.

loans.use: To obtain business capital for her store

loans.name: Mungun

texts.en:
Mungun D. lives with his wife and his infant daughter in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Mungun got married two years ago and his daughter was born just eight months ago. His wife is a cook in a local restaurant but now stays home taking care of her infant daughter.

Mungun makes various household items and furniture in wood. He has been running a small carpentry shop since 2005. He mostly makes traditional wooden furniture by request of local customers. Since the start in 2005, he has done well and his business capital has increased from 200,000 MNT to 600,000 MNT (100,000 MNT is approximately $75).

In the future, he hopes to purchase a small truck for his business. The truck would enable him to deliver raw materials to his carpentry shop by himself, instead of buying expensive woods from retailers. He requests a loan to purchase various woods for his carpentry business.

loans.use: To buy various woods for his carpentry business

loans.name: Leilanie

texts.en:
Leilanie is 36 years old. She is married to Marlon P., who is a farmer. They were blessed with three children: Kristine Jenel, 16; Queen Xyrish, 15; and Marlon P. Jr., 13. They are all attending high school in their town of Cabatuan, Isabela. Her family resides in Barangay Tandul, where most people produce rice.

Leilanie is a vegetable vendor and hog raiser at the same time. She works hard at her business for the future of her three children. She is requesting a loan of PHP 13,000 to use as additional working capital. Some of the loan will be utilized to buy different vegetables to sell in their village and some will be used to buy five bags of feed for her hog-raising business. She hopes that Kiva will continue to give support to small entrepreneurs like her so that they may also have the ability to help themselves.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and five bags of feed

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Melanie is married to Tony D. M., a welder and a car painter. This couple helps each other in achieving their common goals for their family's welfare. They also hope that someday their children, Christine Faye (9) and Mark Anthony (8), will able to finish their studies and get a good job.

Melanie is requesting a loan of PHP 13,000 to utilize as additional capital for her village store business.  Melanie is a resident of Barangay Tandul of Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 41 years old. She earns a weekly income of PHP 1,000 from the business she patiently manages. According to her, the business is a big help in maintaining their daily needs, especially the education of her children. The money will enable her to purchase a variety of commodities to sell in the store.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Gan-Ochir

texts.en:
Gan-Ochir D. lives with his wife and 10-year-old son in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. His son is a student in a local high school.

Gan-Ochir has a small retail business selling wood. With the support of his wife, Gan-Ochir started his business in wood selling in 2007 with a small loan of 300,000 MNT (approximately $210). He usually buys raw wood from local lumberjacks and sells them at profit to local carpenters, who make various household items in wood.

Since the start, he has done well and his business capital has increased to 4,000,000 MNT. With his business profit, he was able to fix his truck that he uses for carrying wood. In the future, he would like to expand his business by adding more customers to his clientele. He requests a loan to purchase more wood for his business.

loans.use: To buy wood at wholesale prices

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida, age 49, is married to Reynaldo A.. Her family lives in Barangay Tandul Cabatuan, Isabela. They have four children: Rosemire, Renalyn, Girlie Mae, and their youngest, Kracean Felle, who still attends high school. One of the children is now married and the two others are working to help support the family. Zenaida finds ongoing strength in her belief that “before fear holds you back, go forward with faith, to make you a better person.”

She has been managing a store for almost two years now in their rural village. She is earning a weekly income of PHP 500 that benefits her family directly, especially her children. She wants to purchase more grocery items for her retailing business so as to have a better profit, but, since she doesn’t have enough capital to buy these items, Zenaida is therefore requesting a loan from ASKI, a microfinance partner of Kiva in the Philippines. The loan would amount to PHP 10,000 and would be used as additional working capital.

She hopes to make her business grow so that she can increase the support she offers her family.

loans.use: To obtain business capital for her grocery store business

loans.name: 10-Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Hà B. Thị (247) is a 37-year-old woman who lives in the town of ThA. Hoá. Hà is the leader of a 6-member group loan offered by the ThA. Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 10-Đông Sơn (10-13-010).

Hà is married and has 2 school-aged children. To making a living, Hà sells snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Hà has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 1.200.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2008, Hà joined the ThA. Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hà is requesting a second loan from the ThA. Hoa Fund for Poor Women of 1.626.900 VND that she will use to expand her business. Hà plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About the other borrowers in the group:

  • T. Thị Ý (5) is a 51-year-old woman who is requesting a 1.626.900 VND loan to support her business making and selling food.
  • N. Thị Thương (246) is a 27-year-old woman who is requesting a 1.626.900 VND loan to support her service-based business.
  • T. Thị Hương (248) is a 31-year-old woman who is requesting a 1.626.900 VND loan to support her business making and selling food.

loans.use: To expanding her business

loans.name: 043 - Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Thoa N. Thị (106) is a 37-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá. Thoa is the leader of a 5-member group loan offered by the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 043 - Quảng Hưng (18.01.043).

Thoa is married and has 2 school-aged children. To making a living, Thoa owns and operates a butcher shop where she butchers and sells pork in the local community. Thoa has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 1.500.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2008, Thoa joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Thoa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1.626.900 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She used her previous loan to expand her business. She is now requesting a new loan of 1.626.900 VND that she will use to expand her business. This will be Thoa's second loan from the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thoa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

  • N. Thị Hoa (107) is a 50-year-old female who is requesting a 1.626.900 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.
  • N. Thị Phượng (108) is a 50-year-old female who is requesting a 1.626.900 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.
  • T. Thị Hải (109) is a 56-year-old female who is requesting a 1.626.900 VND loan to support her business making and selling food.
  • N. Thị Tuyên (110) is a 30-year-old female who is requesting a 1.626.900 VND loan to support her service-based business.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. Thoa N. Thị (106) là 37 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá. Thoa là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 043 - Quảng Hưng (18.01.043). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ giết mổ and bán T.t heo trong cộng đồng địa phương. Thoa thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 4 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Thoa kiếm được khoảng 1.500.000 VND. Vào 2008, Thoa đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Thoa đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 1.626.900 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 1.626.900 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. N. Thị Hoa (107) là 50 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 1.626.900 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 2. N. Thị Phượng (108) là 50 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 1.626.900 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 3. T. Thị Hải (109) là 56 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 1.626.900 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất and buôn bán thức ăn. 4. N. Thị Tuyên (110) là 30 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 1.626.900 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ. Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả and giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng and chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. ."

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: 042 - Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Tuyên N. Thị (100) is a 55-year-old female who lives in Thanh Hoá. Tuyên is the leader of a 6-member group loan offered by the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 042 - Quảng Hưng (18.01.042 ).

Tuyên is married and has 3 adult children. To making a living, Tuyên owns and operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from harvesting and selling river-caught fish in the local community. Tuyên has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 1800000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2008, Tuyên joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a new loan of 1963500 VND which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This will be Tuyên's second loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Tuyên successfully repaid a previous loan of 1626900 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She used the previous loan to buy more fish to sell. Tuyên plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to supplement the family''s income.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Manohari

texts.en:
A four-storied wooden framed building in the heart of Tangal, a busy district near Kathmandu, is home to the family-run business, ‘Nepalese Wood Craft Child Craft.’ The T. family has been in the wood craft business for three generations. Over the years, the business has expanded to employ twenty people from the community who have become like a family, according to Mrs Manohari T., the business proprietor.
Manohari is applying for a Kiva loan to purchase more raw materials to make wooden toys and learning tools for children.

Once a year during the sale season, Manohari sells her products to a number of buyers, including non-profit organizations such as “Save the Children” and “Room to Read.”  Many of these products help children to learn to read and count, while some products, such as the rocking horse, are meant for entertainment. For rest of the year, Manohari is busy overseeing the preparation of stock for the next season.

The factory works at every stage of the production line - from cutting through the first grain of wood for making a rocking horse or a jigsaw puzzle to varnishing a toy with final paint. The Kiva loan will help Manohari purchase materials for these processes so that the business can produce more stock in time for the big sale season.

loans.use: to buy more wood and paint to make children's toys

loans.name: Bimila

texts.en:
Bimala has been successfully running a small shop selling kitchen utensils for more than 13 years. Bimala is a mother of one daughter and two sons. Her husband, Krishna, is employed with Nepal Telecom. She is applying for a loan of 30,000 Nepalese Rupees to purchase a wide range of kitchen utensils.

In future, Bimila hopes to expand her business and grow her income so that she and her husband can afford to build a small house.

loans.use: to buy new kitchen equipment and utensils to restock her shop

loans.name: Confort Group

texts.en:
Y. L., 36, is married with four children, aged 12, 9 and 5 years, and the youngest being 9 months old. He has a business of selling kitchen ware that he started two years ago. He works from 9am to 5pm everyday. He earns a monthly profit of around $177. This will be Y.’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He wants a loan to increase the stock of his kitchen ware.

Y. will share this loan with his group, Confort, which has 19 members. The members will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans. In the picture above, Y. is in blue shirt.

loans.use: To increase stock of kitchen ware

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is married with two children. He sells sportswear at the central market in Ivano-Frankovsk. Victor's kiosk is in a good location that attracts many customers. Large variety and affordable prices are the keys to my business - says Victor. Victor used to work as a construction worker. But then he decided to start his own business. During the last eight years, Victor was able to develop his business and open a second location which is managed by his wife.
This business is the only source of income for their family. Victor would like to borrow 15500 UAH to purchase more inventory. He is going to use the income to take better care of his family. His dream is to have his own apartment or house.

loans.use: To purchase more sportswear

loans.name: Meena

texts.en:
Meena U. is the successful business owner of a nursery, which is located 26 km north of Kathmandu Valley, towards the Tibetan border.

Meena employs 20 people in her nursery and, although she lives Kulashwor in the Kathmandu Valley, she regularly travels a long way to oversee her business. The flowers grown at Meena’s nursery are sold at a number of locations in the Kathmandu Valley and her business is growing over time.

Meena is applying for a loan of 30,000 Nepalese Rupees to purchase new seedlings for her nursery. Because it is monsoon season in Nepal now, it is an important time to plant new seeds in time for the rain.

Meena has one daughter who has recently finished high school and is hoping to begin university soon and a husband who works in the government service.

loans.use: To purchase seedlings for the nursery

loans.name: Gilberto Antonio

texts.es: Gilberto Antonio M. en el departamento de Morazán ubicado en la zona de oriente del país. Gilberto tiene 25 años de edad, vive con su abuelita doña Maria de 71 años de edad, Gilberto trabaja para sostener a su pequeña familia, el se dedica a su negocio que es un taller de reparación y mantenimiento de aires acondicionados; en la zona donde Gilberto tiene su negocio la demanda es mucha, ya que a los alrededores no hay ningún otro negocio ofreciendo los servicios de Gilberto, es por ello que Gilberto tiene un clientela muy estable e ingresos diarios, Gilberto solicita este crédito para la compra de materia prima como gas, válvulas y compresores.
texts.en:
Gilberto Antonio Martinez lives in the department of Morazan located in the east side of the country. Gilberto is 25 years old, lives with his grandmother Mrs. Maria, who is 71 years old. Gilberto works to support his small family, he repairs and provides maintenance for air conditioners. There is a lot of demand for his services in the area where his business is located, because there is no other business offering the same services; this is why Gilberto has very stable customers and daily income, Gilberto is requesting a loan to buy materials like gas, vales and compressors.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials

loans.name: Olena

texts.en:
Olena is married. She owns a retail business that sells women's shoes and clothing. Her business is located at the central market of Belaya Tserkov city. Olena's monthly profit is 4,000 UAH. She has been in this business for 14 years. During these years, she learned a lot about business principles and developed strong business type character.

Olena would like to borrow 9,300 UAH to purchase summer shoes for the coming season. She hopes to make extra income that will help her finish the construction of her house, so she can move in.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Đặng's Group

texts.en:
"Đặng Thị T. H. (20203050056) is a 31-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Đặng is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Ô Cách 10 (10).


Đặng is married and has one infant child.  To make a living, Đặng works in someone else's business venture.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from manufacturing & selling to local businesses and community members.  Đặng has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 2.500.000 VND a month from these activities.


Đặng joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Đặng is requesting for the first time a loan from SEDA.  She is now requesting a new loan of 5.152.000 VND which will be used to purchase tools & other equipment to expand the business.  The loan will be the first loan taken out by her from SEDA.  Đặng plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Nguyễn Thị T. (20203050057) is a 54-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


2.  Trương Thị L. (20203050058) is a 22-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a manufacturing business.


3.  Trương Thị H. (20203050059) is a 24-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture making business.


4.  Trương Thị B. (20203050060) is a 34-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.


5.  Cao Thị Luyến (20203050061) is a 50 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture making business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các pH. thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa pH..  Đặng thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Đặng kiếm được khoảng 2.500.000 VND.  Đặng đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Đặng đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ SEDA.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nguyễn Thị T. (20203050057) là 54 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Trương Thị L. (20203050058) là 22 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất.


3.  Trương Thị H. (20203050059) là 24 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


4.  Trương Thị B. (20203050060) là 34 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


5.  Cao Thị Luyến (20203050061) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."
